Reviews.Title: “I like it but”
Reviews.Author: justi p
Reviews.Content: early in April there was no bar open at the roof tarrace and my room was being cleaned in late afternoon so when I was back around 3pm I couldnt stay there as cleaner was coming in. Also I found quite suprising that despite the note whenever I left my towel on the hook it was still exchanged for a new one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Exploring Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: martpt
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for exploring the city. Its close to all the main attractions, great to head off on walks around the city, bus routes are close by and the airport bus is literally five minutes round the corner - the easiest way to and from central Barcelona. Add the fact the hotel has a great level of accommodation, the staff we met were very friendly and helpful and our room had everything we could need including a super king bed. One example of the level of service is when checking out I was asked - rather than having to ask - if i wanted to leave my bags. Another Daniel knew we were extending our stay and had our daily cards - needed for the gym - ready and waiting for us. Our room looked over the 'courtyard' and was quiet. No net curtains won't be everyone's cup of tea and does mean the room can be like a dungeon to prevent being looked at when changing. The weather didn't allow us to use the roof top area yet it looks fun for when the sun shines. I like a gym to be available when I travel and this hotel's gym is one of the best - perhaps because its a commercial gym in its own right. Sadly you have to pay 7 euros to use the sauna and steam room - a first ever when using a gym in my experience and a mistake really when you are paying a high price for your hotel room. I know it says its a gay friendly hotel - get over that and you'll be fine. On our visit the guests were very diverse from retired couples to single men and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good hotel to sightsee Barcelona from. Breakfast is expensive as in all hotels and you'll find cheaper by stepping out of the door of the hotel - its the cost of convenience and can't be bothered to explore. We'll be going back in June. Guess that says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for family with toddlers!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaJ_Oslo
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, friendly atmosphere, comfy beds, clean rooms, nice bathtub with bubbles, delicious breakfast and very very helpful staff! We stayed 5 nights with our 7 month old twins and enjoyed every it alot :-) The Hotel povided us with 2 babybeds and helped us with hot water day and night ( for the baby milk). We paid extra for balcony and bathtub and its defenitly worth it. The kids slept early but we could sit at the balcony and drink some wine & eat tapas. The bathtub was fun for the kids and relaxing for the parents. We are a gay family but we would recomend this Hotel to any sort of family :-) If we go to Barcelona again we will stay at Axel Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location; poor service”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located. Rooms are modern and clean. However, having paid almost €200 I did not expect to be given a disabled room on the 1st floor...not even a sign post to indicate that this room is one of 3 around an interior patio. Bed was fine. However, entrance is a sliding door that looks onto the patio so the room is like being in a fishbowl. unless you close the curtains (and feel like you are in a cave) you get no privacy whatsoever. Bathroom is adapted for disabled people..everything at the wrong height for an abled body person. The receptionist girl was completely and utterly useless at addressing this issue. She showed no sympathy, said the manager was not available to talk and basically shrugged her shoulders to get rid of me. I stayed at this hotel not long after it had opened. You now get the impression that the hotel is all about appearances and doesnt really make the effort it used to with guests. Unlikely to be back thanks to the attitude of the receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good place, better services needed...”
Reviews.Author: RoMiHevi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located, in a quiet are at the very heart of the Eixample in Barcelona. Rooms are tiny but correct, with a decoration original but outdated. It is very clean and in the bathroom you will find all sort of amenities, including condoms. The breaksfast is not included and it cost 15.00 EUR, which is ridiculuos, taking into account that just in front of the hotel you can have a copious breakfast for half the price in a cafeteria. If you need to use Internet... do not go to this hotel. Free Wi Fi is advertised, but it is a joke: the signal is poor, the connection come and goes all the time, and it is completely impossible to get connected to a page.

Reviews.Title: “april”
Reviews.Author: Fredb75
Reviews.Content: Axel hotel has a great location in barcelone, the staff is friendly, helpfull BUT the quality of the hotel is cheap. other detail: the wifi doesn t work so well into the hotel. we had a sweet room at the 7th floor and it was very disappointing. Only the terrasse is great. there is no lounge space where you can have a drink. that s a pity. there is only a night bar which is dark. i dont know if we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Lousy Internet is a real shame for a hotel charging 300€ / night...”
Reviews.Author: Gilles L
Reviews.Content: Overly priced for what it is (i.e. just an average hotel) and even more so when you are charged 300 € / night, for a more than average room but with such a bad Internet connection, which "worked" barely 10% of the time during our stay (the quotation marks around worked are self-explanatory, since it then worked more slowly than a 3G connection). Not a single four star hotel in the world would dare to impose only cold water in their rooms. Why aren't they at The Axel hotel ashamed to provide such a bad Internet connection? This is totally shameful and unacceptable. PS: when I complained about at the checking out, I could read on the cashier's face that I was probably the 10,000th to complain. How many more complaints and lost clients do you need to fix that???

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - totally recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: CarolineNoon
Reviews.Content: We had read reviews which seemed a bit mixed so weren't sure waht we were going to - we absolutely loved it. It's about 15 mins walk to La Rambla. It was exceptionally clean and staff were pleasant. We had a flght issue but couldn't stay a further to nights at this hotel which we were really disapppointed about however staff were really helpful allowing us to stay on longer than necessary to use teir wi-fi and obtained prices of other hotels around them. Breakfast was more than adequate - the fruit amazing and the bar qute lively at the weekend. The fact that it is advertised as a gay hotel really didn't make any difference to us and wasn't in your face when you were there. Would totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but otherwise nothing extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: QuebecMonde
Reviews.Content: Staff was mostly friendly/ welcoming. Decor was probably cutting edge when the place first opened over 10 years ago, but now beginning to look a bit dated (the "golden" wallpaper?), even tacky (the picture of the shirtless men on the room safe?), or cheap (banal Ikea-type desks)... But the most surprising -and frustrating- was that the WiFi connection was completely unreliable, and when it did work it was painfully slow. And I happened to be in one of the rooms closest to where the signal was supposed to be coming from! Elevators were also not coordinated and very slow. In 2012, in a major city, and in a somewhat upscale (i.e. not cheap) hotel --come on!! Get your act together, tios.

Reviews.Title: “cool”
Reviews.Author: laurentsw1
Reviews.Content: yeah yeah, so i write a lot of reviews and travel a lot, not easy to impress me, axel was not overimpressive, but there were personal touches in the rooms which i had never seen before in other hotels, small but significant like slippers ( tilled floors are bloody cold) condoms, yes condoms in the bathroom and everything comfortable and tasteful in what is described as a double bed but is actually a king size. i was living in barcelonan when this hotel opened and there was a little identity crisis in the begining for product placement but i think this hotel is pretty damn cool. Right location, nice rooms, good value for not a tiny price, staff could be a little more elegant but hey....bar at the side of the hotel is a let down, totally unelegant, dark and pink and unnecessary! Didnt do the gym because i was too busy and a little intimidated by the amount of attention i attracted but hey, if you cant attract attention from guys going into a gym in a gay hotel then taht would make you pretty freaking hideous :-) I will say one thing more, I am black so when i am showering and look down andd see caucasian hairs in the shower that screams nasty to me. so thats why my cleanliness score is so low.

Reviews.Title: “Things are looking up”
Reviews.Author: batw
Reviews.Content: Following on from my previous review, things have definitely improved at this hotel. Breakfast was served on non-cracked crockery, the juice jugs were new and unchipped (even though they were plastic) and the Spa allowed me to add the 7 euro charge to my room account (despite being told they were only doing it once as a favour - this pathetic ruling has GOT to stop !) Staff were extremely friendly and could not have been more helpful. HOWEVER, there is still a long way to go and Hotel management skills still need to be improved. I arrived for a 1 night stay, around 2.00pm, only to discover that the sun deck was being varnished and was therefore closed to guests. That immediately took out the only sunbathing area, the outdoor pool and the jacuzzi. I wasn't informed about this, neither on the booking website, nor by the Hotel staff upon check-in. I have complained before about the Spa area where 2 or 3 of the hydro jets never seem to work. On this visit 6 of the 7 jets were broken. The lovely receptionist apologised, explaining it was due to maintenance. B*llocks ! Will it take for all 7 to break before someone calls in a plumber ? And the cheek of it was, they still charged me the full 7 euros for use of the Spa ! Breakfast hasn't changed in that the hot option is just BAD...mini frankfurter sausages, fatty bacon and (still) brown scrambled egg. The cold breakfast option is good, but the 16 euro cover charge is still not worth the money. I am encouraged that many of the things I mentioned in my last review have been fixed, so hopefully Axel management will kindly take on board my remaining complaints in time for my next visit. Despite these concerns, I will definitely return to stay at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay - mixed opinions”
Reviews.Author: Hamish989
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Axel for the second time recently taking a number of our friends with us. The last time we stayed was almost 6-years ago and the place has changed quite significantly with a number of the rooms being renovated. Prior to going I had read in other reviews on this site that standard “city rooms” could be upgraded to premium ones for €40 a night so I emailed the hotel and asked for the upgrade which we were duly received. The room that we were given was one of the latest ones to be updated and was certainly very clean and modern. We particularly liked the shower, one wall of which is glass and open to the room itself (so perhaps only go as a couple, unless you’re “very” good friends). Our friends were staying in the standard city rooms so we were able to compare them to our own and whilst ours was more modern, particularly in the bathroom, it was not that much bigger than the standard room at all. Knowing that now I perhaps wouldn’t bother with the upgrade, certainly not for €40 a night. The rest of the hotel is nice and there is a lovely roof terrace, although sadly not open in March. We used the spa, which is an additional €7 per person – this was very nice BUT why charge guests to use the spa? We’ve stayed in plenty of 5* hotels that don’t charge their guests and given what we were paying already this seemed a bit unfair. Breakfast is buffet style and if you have not added it to your reservation in advance it costs €16 per person. Finally don’t book direct with the hotel, if you use Trivago or Hotels.com you will get a rate that’s about 30%– 50%. All in all a pleasant stay but the management need to re-think a few things and smarten some aspects of the hotel up.

Reviews.Title: “An eye opener!”
Reviews.Author: Katie G
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a long weekend! This was booked without me realising it was a 'gay' hotel! Nevertheless we had a wonderful stay and were made to feel so welcome! Room service was fantastic and the bar downstairs was great fun! All staff were very helpful and very polite! Wouldn't reccomended if people aren't totally comfortable with such surroundings!

Reviews.Title: “What a shame- The management needs to change!!!”
Reviews.Author: downtownsml
Reviews.Content: The hotel should be great but clearly the managment is not interested in providing amazing guest experience. The free WiFI that they speak about hardly works in the rooms. I arrived after 2pm for checkin and was told that I would have to wait for a room. I booked a King sized bed and was told no room was available with a king until 2 hours from then. I ended taking a room next to the elevator with 2 twins pushed together and a view of a wall (they call it a garden because their is some fake grass). The staff is very nice and works with what they are given. But clearly the management has sold out for 100% booking only and not concerned weather you come back. When leaving a guy from Austrailia at 6pm was to his reservation made last July- was there but the hotel had no rooms- they are oversold..... crazy....

Reviews.Title: “The service was great but the good stops there...”
Reviews.Author: Clemsongal42
Reviews.Content: I have to say I read up on this place before getting there for Mobile World Congress. We knew it was a Hetero Friendly hotel so we were prepared to be the minority. The art work and vibe the other reviews complain about did not bother us in the least. The staff were all awesome from the front desk to the cleaning lady. The room is where this place fails. Our room reeked of mold. You could see where the baseboards and become disconnected and the wallpaper was peeling like major water damage had occurred in our room. The bed linens and bed were uncomfortable and the light fixture in our room was actually just a piece of fabric stretched out over a bulb. To say the least for all the money invested in the common areas they could make the actual room a lot nicer. I could hear the man above us snoring and any time a person flushed the toilet or took a shower the water sounded like it was running right about our head. This is no fault of the hotel but the recycle bins are very noisy, we were directly above them and all night and early morning people were dumping their bottles loudly in the bin. I could care less what you put on the walls and if my neighbors are cruising around looking for a "D" card hanging on the door. These rooms need a major over haul STAT. If you are looking for a clean affordable room and care less about the scene in the lobby don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and quite central”
Reviews.Author: Gusto2009
Reviews.Content: Location: quite central, easily accessible from the main train stations or metro, and walking distance to most of the tourist attractions. Several nice eateries nearby Room: nice with all the essentials. Interesting Facebook like concept for the guests but didn't try it, but like the idea. Facilities: roof top terrace and gym - very nice. The spa was nice too Breakfast - not included in ours, didn't try them. Probably cheaper to get breakfast at Cafes around the hotel. Hotel was asking for €16 pp for breakfast or €12 if we booked in advanced for 5 nights. Cons: no proper lobby area to sit down apart from two enormous chairs at the entrance. Or other choice is to sit at the bar which is quite dark. We got quite good deal as it was low season, probably won't stay if we have to pay full price. But the staff were very friendly and helpful. We chose to upgrade to premium room - in retrospective, we should have checked the "normal" room first before accepting the offer - but it's only €40 extra. We had lovely time in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Plesant Stay - Poor internet connection”
Reviews.Author: Dunxb
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that we had a very plesant stay at the Axel Barcelona. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful and everyone we spoke with spoke english. We stayed at the hotel twice on our trip so we got to experience two different rooms. Both rooms were spotless and nicely decorated. My only irritation and it was a big one!!! The wireless signal in both the rooms was very poor and at most times we could not connest at all. This is very frustrating as we relied on the wifi to plan our daytrips. I eventually resorted to buying a local data card for Spain. There is a computer on the 1st floor for guests to use, but prefer not to have to leave my room and sit aove the reception. Ther website clearly stated that there was wifi available........

Reviews.Title: “over rated”
Reviews.Author: vs2012
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Axel hotel this past May after the renovation. There have been some that have diminished the hotel's service quality which has led me to conclude that the hotel is over rated. The tiles in the bathroom on the 6th floor were apparently not part of the renovation and we so badly chipped that they should have been replaced. The major complaint was the service. The Catalan speaking staff talk on the phone incessantly and will do their best to avoid making eye contact with you keeping you waiting for several minutes at the front desk and at the gym. There were a couple instances at the gym where I didn't bother waiting past a few minutes and they came into the gym screaming for my hotel card even though I visited the gym the day before and the same staff member verified my call the day before. I stayed at this hotel several times over the past few years and was deeply disappointed that the service attitude has gone from friendly boutique hotel to arrogant at times.

Reviews.Title: “Good gay hotel”
Reviews.Author: YossiRd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gay oriented. If you are not gay - stay at another hotel. Pros: very nice and comfortable rooms, comfortable beds, breakfast, jacuzzi. Cons: Small swimming pool, price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from Check-in to Check-out”
Reviews.Author: AaroninDublin
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time to stay at Axel and it was even better than the previous stays. I arrived at the hotel at about 1130am, which was nearly 3 hours early for check-in. The lovely lady on check-in, Marisol, informed me that because I am a regular guest they have upgraded my room and that it was ready for me now. This was much appreceated as I had been up since 3am and was very tired. The room was lovely, large, well furnished and I loved the glass fronted Shower. All the staff would say hello/hola to me when ever I walked past and were willing to help me out with directions to places I wanted to visit. Breakfast every morning was fresh and service was great. After the 1st couple of mornings I didnt even have to ask for Coffee, Gustavo served it to me right away. As others have said the hotel is right in the center of things and there are cool bars ect within easy walking distance. The Ground Bar can be quiet during the week, but Shimai’s Drag Contest was great fun. There was a good mix of gay and straight guests at the hotel and I did get to chat with some of them. Axel people is good fun too. I loved BCN. I will be back and would only stay at Axel Hotel. Thanks for helping to make this one of the best holidays I've had.

Reviews.Title: “Well located botique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: johnbamsterdam
Reviews.Content: The Axel has well appointed rooms, fitness cetner and chic rooftop bar. The location is close to Placa de Cataluyna and Las Rmablas. The hotel is gay oriented and thus this location provides easy access to the gay nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: notria123
Reviews.Content: This is a great place. It fab to have a swim in the upstairs pool and have a great view of the city. I think that you had to pay for internet access in the room which is disappointing but that might have changed. The staff in reception are very helpful but the rooftop barstaff were not so friendly. This is a very stylish hotel in a great location. The best gay (hetro friendly) hotel in the world (other than their sister hotel in Argentina)

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Alfy1
Reviews.Content: We had another excellent stay at the Axel!.. We spent 10 days at the hôtel this Time and are returning for a week on the 10th march for m'y partners birthday!!! As promises the director gave us an upgrade and we had a fantastic room ( that i hope we Will have again in march if possible as it was fabulous!!!) The staff were really friendly and we fell in love with the young lady from the Spa who was so so kind!! i unfortunately broke my toe whist there and within 30 minutes they had got a doctor to my room! Again perfect customer service!!!! We've also stayed at the Axel in Berlin which was excellent and the plan is to try and go to Argentina some Time soon!!! All in all we love this hôtel and ALWAYS stay here when we come to Barcelona!!. Really looking forward to our trip in march and hopefully to another upgrade and fantastic room :-)

Reviews.Title: “Axel Hotel in Winter”
Reviews.Author: SmallWorldNYC
Reviews.Content: Our week-long stay at Axel Hotel in Barcelona was a good one. The staff at the front desk were always very gracious. After our over-night flight we arrived around 9am and were accommodated to upgrade for an early check-in. The room we were in was an interior one on the second floor. The room was quiet, the bed very comfortable, the room was immaculate. The shower being in a big glass box took some getting used to at first but was a real pleasure for its roominess and the water was hot and plentiful. The bath amenities were always stocked. "Decorative Style" is very subjective. The room didn't reflect the beauty of Barcelona. It felt like were were in a big Godiva Chocolate Ballotine (minus the chocolates). We were two but there was only one chair and a small desk though there was plenty of floorspace in the room for another chair and a desk/table where the two of us could have sat together. And the open closet system was expansive but not practical. The location of the room made it lack light. If we stay there again we would ask for a room higher up and facing the street. We ate one breakfast at the hotel (15 Euros each) but found it lacking; the coffee tasted like what you get in a diner and the offerings, while fresh, weren't anything special. There are much nicer offerings both across and down the street. The location of the hotel is great! To arrive by Aerobus was very quick and convenient. (Have ready 5.30 Euro's each.) But returning to the airport we took a taxi and felt it was worth it. One block away is a fantastic restaurant, La Flauta, at 23 Aribau. The Gothic District is an easy walk. Overall the experience of staying at the Axel Hotel was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel and easy to get to on bus from Airport with short walk up Aribau from Universitat. Easy walk to the Arena clubs. Gym was fine and breakfast good. However room was a bit "over funky" - steps down to bed and open wire racks for clothes. Was surprised that we were not offered any info on gay venues or gay map of Barcelona on arrival (we found these ourselves at a cafe). When we asked the staff what movies were showing in English that week, they were stumped, even when I suggested a couple of websites for them to check for me. May be it is better in summer as we were there early January.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in one of Europe's best cities”
Reviews.Author: GreenwichPaul
Reviews.Content: The Axel Hotel is in the modernist area of Barcelona, a few blocks back from Casa Batlo and in the centre of Barcelona's gay area. The hotel itself is a grand old building and in a good location. The room I was in was stylish and comfortable and looked out onto the street but didn't suffer from any street noise. Lovely friendly reception staff and all in one of Europe's most fantastic cities! (As another reviewer pointed out though you do need to be wary of thieves in Barcelona - especially in Barri Gotic and Las Ramblas areas)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: grahatd
Reviews.Content: Hotel Axel is a very nice hotel in the Eixample district of Barcelona. The location if very good and a short walk to many of the sights of Barcelona and close to public transportation. It is easy to get to the hotel from the airport using the Aerobus A1 from Terminal 1. Get off at the 3rd stop - Placa Universitat and the hotel is a short walk up Carrer d'Aribau. The fare was 5.30 Euro in November 2011. My room was very pleasant with a large comfortable bed and a large bath. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico (watch out for the thieves)”
Reviews.Author: Rag D
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a fantastic city. I'm sure it would be even more fantastic if I was gay but I had a great time with my kid and girl. Apart from getting my Ipad stolen in the bar downstairs which is open to the street and full of thieves and scum looking to rob or leach off a single gay guy. If you're single and gay, definitely watch out because you're a target from the moment you step in the downstairs bar. Hunting season. Apart from that, excellent service, wonderful roof bar, wonderful small spa, wonderful breakfast, excellent Mojitos as prepared by a Salmah Hayek lookalike though the best are prepared by Juan. My kid had a blast everywhere and the service was exceptional, including the secret family upgrade, You can probably tell from the replies to comments that Axel really cares what clients feel about. BUT AXEL PUT A BIG BOUNCER ON THE BAR DOOR.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city”
Reviews.Author: MMartins1953
Reviews.Content: Have a pleasnt satay my wife and myself and for sure when visiting Barcelona again my choice will be again your nice hotel Thanks a lot for a good reception <msnuel Correia Martins

Reviews.Title: “Fun, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: NMPCC100
Reviews.Content: It was fun to stay at this ‘hetero-friendly’ hotel and they have a great roof pool and view of the city, but for the quality of the rooms and décor I found it to be a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “ambience has changed completely”
Reviews.Author: Gaudifans
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have always stayed here when in Barcelona but with enlargement and refurbishment the hotel ambience has changed completely from *hetero friendly* to being a hotel where gay guests feel less comfortable than before. The management is clearly going with the money with straight guests but still trying to milk the overpriced gay market. The facilities that were previous included free and exclusive to guests on the roof are now a mixed public facility with swimwear police in the basement where paid spa and gym members are coming in from the street - past the dining room which is usually freezing because of the open door. Hotel guests feel extremely unwelcome - and have to pay - down there. The reception staff in the spa are very rude. The breakfast is very expensive and very poor - the hot items are badly / over cooked and the cold items looked exactly the same for the three mornings of our most recent visit stuck to the plates. The gimmicky metal wardrobes in the bedrooms have been the same for years but are not much use - the token glass sliding wardribe door in our room had vanished. The recently added minibar fridge will probably cook your netbook and other electronic gear because the room safe is directly above it - and they have scrapped the free chilled bottled water that used to be available on all the landings. This hotel actually has very few facilities yet you are paying as much as 5* straight hotels in the centre of Barcelona for a now non-existent gay ambience. The extended ground floor bar is cold, the music is too loud and the drinks prices are outrageous for perfunctory service. I think we have just about decided to stay elsewhere in future. This was a great place to stay but the management has systematically destroyed much of it that appealed the gay market.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Second Stay.”
Reviews.Author: gazzerukukuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights because the hotel is in a good location and I was promised that this stay I would have a room at the front instead of the back. Upon check in, it was agreed that I would have a room at the front but I was offered to upgrade for 20€ per night which I did. However, the room was more or less identical to the room I had before. Not only this, but it does not have tea/coffee making facilities and the wireless internet connection is hit or miss. My room was not made up on the last night and the shower smelt damp. Lastly, nobody told me that the room isn't very well soundproofed and you can hear traffic all day and night. I feel ripped off and I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Its a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: qurde
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in nice area with lots of bars close by. We only stayed there 1 night in a standard double. Room was rather on a small side (not cramped though) with a simple interior. Piece de resistance in the room was a bare wardrobe made from chrome metal wire. Bathroom had a nice shower, but no bathrobes. On arrival we were offered upgrade for €40, but decided it wasn't worth it (one night stay with very late check-in). Those who want to experience designer element of this establishment will have to go for an upgrade or book deluxe room. Bars downstairs were funky but dead empty so not much ambiance there. Would come back, depending on price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: floridaskater2003
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Europe and I loved Barcelona. The Axel Hotel was the perfect place to stay. It is a beautiful building and the rooms are modern and spotless. The staff was so welcoming and helpful. Marrisol (spelling?) was especially helpful. She was at the front desk when I checked in. She was able to get me into a room 3 hours before the normal check in time which was wonderful. She took the time to give me directions to all the places I had on my list that I wanted to see. It was nice to have a smiling face greet you after a long overnight flight from Boston. I had a beautiful room on the 6th floor on the street side. I had a small balcony that had a view of beautiful 19th century buildings. I had a king size bed with a pure white comforter. The bed was super comfortable and the linens and towels were spotless. I loved the large rain style shower head. It was great after a long day of touring. The Axel Hotel is in a great location Lots of small shops and restaurants in the neighborhood. The streets are very clean and safe. A great area to go walking. Only about a 10 or 15 minute walk from the hotel is the Plaza Catalonya in the city center. A great area for shopping and restaurants. La Rambla is close by too. I used the Aerobus for the airport. When I wasn't walking, I was touring on the Hop ON Hop Off bus or Julia Tours which I used for my visit to Montserrat. All of these modes of transportation were within a short walk from the hotel. I had room service a couple of times and the food was excellent. The pasta and bolognase was wonderful. When I return to Barcelona, I will definitely stay at Axel Hotel again. Comfortable, Clean, Affordable and Friendly. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Optimal location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jmbSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good located. If you arrive by plane, take the Aerobus A1 or A2 and stop at Universitat. You are only two blocks from the hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. I had a quite small room, but it was facing the patio; so the room was very quiet. Plenty restaurants and bars very near.

Reviews.Title: “My Second Home”
Reviews.Author: Gilbert K
Reviews.Content: Axel Hotel Barcelona is always my destination if I want to relax and enjoy, alone or with friends. The staff is always friendly, willing to serve and a big plus is the recognition. Also the Guest Relations Good F&B quality. Every visit I use the spa and get a "Back to Serenity" treatment, just the thing you need! Also great gym facility. You don't have to leave the hotel because it offers everything you need. Location is perfect, everything is closeby, very central in Barcelona. The total atmosphere is friendly and inspiring. I advise everyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Axel Hotel Barcelona = Super!”
Reviews.Author: EthanHunt_12
Reviews.Content: Axel Hotel Barcelona was for us wonderful. The staff, cleanness of the room, good breakfast and location, super! Great spa and sporting facilities. Lots off nice and good restaurants and great shopping boutiques in the area. Good (gay)nightlife in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bladebiker
Reviews.Content: The location within the Gay district of Barcelono makes the Axel a good choice. From the facilities to staff you won't be disappointed. Very clean and the staff are a credit to the establishment, offering sound advice on good eateries and places to visit. The WiFi could do with upgrading, very slow in the room, there are 2 terminals available on the 1st floor for those all important online flight check-ins though!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Mzzlyn
Reviews.Content: We are a young straight couple that found this wonderful hotel using the lonelyplanet website. We were so incredibly pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel was this beautiful little gem! We stayed in a sweet little room on the third floor, and ordered breakfast in bed. Delicious!! But a little expensive. The service we received was wonderful, front desk was so helpful and friendly. We enjoyed our stay so much we ended up wanting to stay another night but were unable to afford their undiscounted rates, after a wink and a few minutes tapping away at the computer, our wonderful receptionist managed to give us one more night at the discounted price that we had paid for our previous two. Lobby: immaculate, very nice gothy-ish design, loved the after hours security of hotel. Elevators are tiny!!!! 4 people maximum, and very intimitely. Room: clean clean clean. There was no bath but no need because the shower had like 4 heads!! The towels were abundant and fluffy, they provided the usual complimentary hotel stuff, and then some really nice extras. Tv is a good size. Bed is like sleeping on feathers. AC works beautifully. Good strong quality curtains keeps the room nice and dark so catching up on sleep wasnt a problem. Rooftop: the pool is nothing more than a glorified water fountain. The rooftop is lovely to lay and tan on, but the drinks are expensive. I have to admit tho, i was pretty disappointed that we had to pay for wifi. In this day and age, and the quality of clients that come through there, one would expect that they would at the very least provide free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice”
Reviews.Author: RSA-tourists
Reviews.Content: We checked in just after 22h00 as we took a late flight from Amsterdam. We were suprised when we got to the hotel, as it was our first stay a t a "gay" hotel. My partner and I were both impressed as it was a modern hotel. Checking in took some time as the receptionist took her time and kept helping other guests while she was checking us in. After a long day at work and a flight to Barcelona, all we wanted was our room, but we had to wait some time while she helped other guests that kept asking her for things. Would have been nice if she checked us in and then helped them... The room was very nice as we upgraded to a bigger room with a balcony. It was modern and clean. The hotel is situated in a great area. It's very centrally located to all the gay bars and shops that is nice. The hotel bar is nice for some drinks before you go out. We also spent some time in the spa, which was very nice. It's a nice place to relax after a long day. It would be nice if the rooms had some coffee machines...but I guess coffee at a cafe in the city is much more fun anyway. We are already planning our next trip to Barcelona, and we will stay at the Axel Hotel again. We liked everything that the hotel had to offer, and the location is a plus. We can't wait to return to the city and Axel Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive - in all the wrong ways”
Reviews.Author: Daniel G
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked the Axel thinking it would be fun to stay in a stylish gay hotel. To be fair - it is. The place looks good, it's clean, modern and the room size fine for Barcelona. The problem is the atmosphere. It's like a party to which you haven't been invited. We headed up to the roof-top pool area for early evening cocktails and there was a gaggle of local boys prancing around. I suspect they are brought in with free drinks to provide some 'eye-candy' but the result is, well, a little but queeny with lots of people who seem to know one another dominating the small space. Some may think, 'sounds great' and I respect that. Really, we both questioned our sense: why go to an exclusively gay hotel - it's Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “very plaisant”
Reviews.Author: tinemar75
Reviews.Content: The wifi was no fonctionnal in our room (317) I have reserved a room with balcony. When I arrived I didn't get it and I was obliged to pay ''upgrate tarification'' to get it!! Why there is no electric kettle in the rooms to make coffee or tea??

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in contemporary designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Exoticsense
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my 2 night stay and regret why I didn't stay the other nights. I highly advise to take the rooms facing the street. That extra bucks make a big difference of how you feel about your whole trip. Breakfast Buffet for 12Euro was good and they serve it pretty late. that helps a lot if you plan to party the night before and getting up late. the gym was much better than many other hotel gym and some locals who happend to look very good also work out there. It was much better than the pictures. The wifi worked for me on the 6th floor . it was not always perfect qality but was reasonable. I didnot find the decoration and painting sleezy. there are soem photography of shirtless man but nothing gross. I can say 30 percent of clients were young straight couples and they were enjoying their stay. I highly advise this hotel because of location, value for price. keeping in mind that it is a boutique hotel. There was a sky bar which is closed for December but I am sure it is great for summer time. The only negative was massage which was very very average in the best.

Reviews.Title: “Disgrace to the management”
Reviews.Author: Scarletdiv
Reviews.Content: Was staying at Axel for 1 night in July. The hotel was recommended to me by friend who stayed there before and was planing to stay later in august. But he cancelled his reservation after he knew. I will try to be brief. There was a torn towel in my room. I noticed it late evening and complaind at check out next day. The guy at reception told me something like "sometimes it happens". I asked to invite the general mananger. The manager came and didn't bother to apologize. The message and the delievery were gross. What he told me is that in his opinion I MADE THE HOLES ON TOWEL TO GET THE DISCOUNT (!!!!). That was offensive. He went on saying that i left the room in terrible condition and stainded the bathroom with blood - he showed the pics on his iPhone.That wasn't blood guy - twas red clay hairwash. The conclusion is - the torn towel in 4 star hotel is a disgrace. But even more disgrace is when the general manager offends the clients instead of bringing apologies. Overall - the hotel is ok but needs some refubrishment and iprovement in service. Luxury is not the word to describe it.

Reviews.Title: “service going downhill”
Reviews.Author: JohnCostelloe
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Axel a number of times and until now enjoyed it, good value, location and service. This time, i had several issues which were all manageable but the staff handled them badly. First, my reservation was prepaid but apparently a problem with my card at the time of reservation meant it didnt go through. They said they emailed but could not show me the email and i didnt get one. they provided a room that was still free, it was off a public balcony area on the 1st floor.. the floor was water damaged and generally the room shabby compared to my previous stays at axel. i asked to change the next morning, they said there would be a €20 charge!! i refused and they changed anyway without the charge. my new room was much better but when i returned from work that evening, there were no bath towels. i used hand towels to dry as i was in a rush to a business dinner and asked the reception to arrange towels while i was out. they said there was nobody available to deliver them and asked if i would collect them from reception myself!!! i said, No, shouldnt my room have towels provided? they did not bring towels to my room. i had to return to reception when i got back later that night to get the towels myself. i think this is terrible service. such a pity because i used to really like this hotel. i think their success is going to their heads so now they think they can be arrogant to their guests... doomed.

Reviews.Title: “I really want to love this Hotel, but I don't”
Reviews.Author: batw
Reviews.Content: The Axel used to be a GREAT Hotel. Small, with friendly staff and a great little gym, sauna and Jacuzzi on the roof terrace. Now it's a big, impersonal machine with an "anal" spa in the basement. The staff are nice enough, but can't exactly be called "friendly". This is a predominantly gay hotel but with the strapline "hetero friendly". Firstly I checked in at 4pm and didn't meet one male staff member until breakfast the following morning. I visited the Spa and was asked for 6 or 7 euros. I was in my gown and slippers and explained I was not carrying my wallet. I therefore asked for the amount to be added to my hotel account. Oh no..I was made to go back up to my room and get the money...not to mention the rolling of the eyes and tutting when I handed the girl a 20 euro note. The spa itself was quite relaxing except that 3 of the water jets were not working (and haven't been working for over 1 year !). 1 guy removed his trunks to take a shower and the swimming costume police from reception descended on him like flies ! Breakfast choice hasn't changed one ounce in the 5 or 6 years I have been staying at the Axel and is dreadful value for money. 16 euros for very little and the fruit juices and coffee are served in cracked jugs. And why is the scrambled egg always brown ? Why is it that "speciality" hotels seem to think they can get away with a drop in standards, just because they offer a "unique" service. Come on Axel, get your act together.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ultra-Modern and Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stuart80
Reviews.Content: After a few days in Sitges we went to Barcelona and stayed at this hotel....Such a great trendy place. Firstly...The roof top bar (slightly pricey, but you are in Barcelona) was great. Great views over Barcelona and plenty of loungers with pool and jacuzzi Secondly...The rooms were good. We stayed in a room that overlooked the front of the hotel. Very clean, comfy and had everything in there that we needed. Lastly...The location of the hotel was pretty much central from everything you would want to do (and if its not then it not far away from the transport links for those things that are further out of the city) Would highly recommend this hotel...As long as you dont mind the odd guy on the roof top bar walking around in his speedos........But i dont suppose many would :-)

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveller-360
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after reading a few negative comments on this and other review sites but i have to say that my experience was very good. Starting with Andre the Portuguese receptionist who helped us settle in after a long trip. He offered to upgrade to a suite for a little more money and get us an early check in. That alone is soooo important after flying overnight with no sleep. The Hotel is spartan but in a nice industrial/modern way and our suite was on the last floor and it was quiet and clean. The only thing that didn't work was the music system. Had a massage at the spa by an Italian guy. It was tecnically good but i was hoping for a more sensual experience. I guess i am used to my NYC masseurs. ;) I ended up going to a famous local sauna where they take care of that... I will definitely go back on my next trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and amazing day spa”
Reviews.Author: CMC91381
Reviews.Content: After setting in mediocre hotels that claim to be 4 and 5 star I was delightfully surprised with Axel. By far the nicest place we stayed while in Europe. Close to all the things you wanna do in Barcelona and had a better gym tan most hotels. Also had an amazing day spa. Very reasonably priced for all we got. Thanks to te staff for all their help as well. Especially the guy at the gym/spa area. Grat experience.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel; five star.”
Reviews.Author: Stan1245
Reviews.Content: This is the first hotel we give a five star for everything. The hotel has very modern rooms, nice and helpful staff at central desk and great facilities around (great spa in cellar (EUR 7 pppd), good working free wi-fi in the room, minibar, a shower even better than at home, great roof terrace with wonderful views). We didn't try breakfast though, because their are so many places in town where you can eat. We got a cheap last minute rate voor 5 nights, so we can't complain about the price either. Staff really helped us around in town and we felt very welcome everyday. We have read some bad comments here on tripadvisor, so were curious what to expect, but we can only say: first class, full marks! The gay "design" is visible but not annoying for any moment, our guess is at least half the hotel was filled with straight people. As it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Trentino M
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel, good sized rooms, great location in the gayborhood, it was little over priced and the Ikea shelves have to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great Barcelona Stay”
Reviews.Author: zacstar
Reviews.Content: Good location...especially for party boys. The Saturday night drag show on Saturday night downstairs was hilarious!! Good quality hotel with all the mod cons, and funkified design glamour. Rooftop (plunge) pool a great treat and option to the beach...although we LOVED the beach at Barcelonata. We were surprised at all the hetero couples staying....I guess they are onto a good thing....though I wonder what they think about the 'Please disturb' signs you can place on your door!! LOL

Reviews.Title: “cost cutting”
Reviews.Author: girasolrestaurante
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a premium room and it was pretty good (well, for the price it should be); an emergency light above the door and adjacent to my head on the bed was extremely irritating iluminating the room and disturbing our sleep. also, the humming from the toilet was also annoying. reception service was abysmal; not because the staff themselves were bad - they were just overstretched; ie only ever one person per shift; that's to take calls from customers, check in and check out, answer questions etc...........there was always a line of people waiting to be attended............ WIFI hardly ever worked in the room which is just not acceptable these days !!!!! it didnt work in the lobby either - many other customers were pissed off as well!!!! it's also a pity the restaurant closes at night now and the only "relax place" is the dark bar which was always empty!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bramses
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Axel Hotel for the previous 4 days. Absolutely excellent stay. The staff is friendly and most helpfull the rooms are spacious, clean, modern. Delightfull rainshower in the bathroom. Had some minor flaws on the wifi and the airco but this was fixed directly! Btw, NEVER stayed in a hotel that had wifi working properly! ;-P except when you're in the lobby... The location is absolutely marvelous in the middle of Eixample (nicknamed Gayxample as it is Barcelona's gay district) with lots of nice restaurants, bars, galleries. 10 minute walk from Passeig de Gràcia and Avinguda Diagonal for some great shopping where you will find all the international brands. And ofcourse the Ramblas with all it's great food. All in all; great vallue for money, super location, fantastic hotel! Thanks to the guys and girls of Axel! See you soon...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel , comfortable and enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: jpreid
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very comfortable in a good location , 2 blocks from the metro station on the central line. Check in staff was so friendly with such a beautiful smile gave us a map of everything we could do in the area .The room is beautiful with wifi , amazing facilties at the hotel the only negative was the bathroom wich is ok but we would have like a closed shower , as the open shower made the entire bathroom wet. Love it will go back to Axel.

Reviews.Title: “Glamour and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: Axel hotel is a very glamorous hotel, it is big, lots of rooms, modern and clean. Staff where helpful though they are busy, it is a popular hotel, but having said that they run very efficiently for a large busy hotel. The day staff are more friendly and helpful than the night staff. The rooms were clean and well equipped, the bathrooms clean and well stocked, nice towels. The hotel is centrally located. The roof top bar and pool excellent. The drinks a bit pricey but when on holiday in such a great place OK to splurge. I sued the gym and pool and spa, all we good. I would go back again an recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: JulianHugo
Reviews.Content: I paid over £500 for three nights in this hotel and it was the worst money I ever spent. Almost everything about it was poor. The reception is shabby. The room was furnished with what looked like Ikea furniture (a metal rail instead of a cupboard!), the bathroom was a weird triangle shape, smelled strongly of mould and the bathroom fan was ridiculously noisy. In the lifts are TV screens showing soft porn (nothing wrong with porn, but come on, not in the lifts! How tacky). Unbelievable despite paying a 4* price for a 3* hotel, they have the cheek to charge €7 to use the spa!!! The only good thing was the roof terrace, which is nice and has good views. But you can go there without staying in the hotel. Avoid this hotel unless you have literally no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AaroninDublin
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time to stay at Axel BCN and I enjoyed my stay even more than the 1st. I arrived at the hotel at around 11am, so far too early for check-in. I was able to leave my bags with reception and go up to the roof terrace for a couple of hours until my room was ready. My room was 401. It is an inside room and so was a little dark. But this was not a big issue. The room was spotless and the cleaning staff did a great job. WIFI was much improved over my visit last year. If you want an outside room I suggest you request this at the time of booking and also when checking in. I opted for Breakfast each morning and it was a very good selection and service was always with a smile. The roof terrace/pool area are amazing. You can get the sun for the whole day. The bar area is a nice place to socialise although €4 for a Coke is a little over-priced. But it is Barcelona! The staff were all great, friendly and always willing to give recomendations on which club/bar to go to. Axel have a social network called Axel People, which is very inovative and a great way to meet other guests. Although the hotel is a little expensive, they do have the non-refundable discounts which make it alot more resonable. I would say the hotel is still good value for money. I would recomend Axel BCN and I will be back. Thanks very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good gay hotel in heart of gay district”
Reviews.Author: Damian1974
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters predominantly for gay clientele, but is marketed as being "hetero friendly". Suggestive images of near naked men posted in rooms & around hotel. Being gay, I liked this, but wondered whether straight couples or even the one family I saw with young children appreciated this. If imagery like that offends you, then this is not the place for you! Front desk staff very helpful, although English not their first language so getting direct answers were not always that easy. However, they'd try their best to help! Everyone seemed to have problems with the card readers in the lifts. Not sure what was going on but it was hard to lock in your floor after swiping, often going for a few rides before it would decide to work. Free wifi in room was great. Rooftop Pool/deck area was fantastic with a bar. Pool, however, is just a small splash pool so can't swim. It's all about the sunbathing & scantily clad men!! Bit of a party hotel on weekends too. There was a drag show & DJ in the bar downstairs the sat night we were there which started at 1am. great location near gay bars/clubs & restaurants/cafes, and not too far from tourist places like la rambla. Enjoyable stay, will return

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: Cassar F
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good situation, near the gay district, near the touristic, in the middle of all the touristic places 5 Sagrada familia, Las Ramblas, Gaùdi buildings, Montjùic... A little far away from Barcelonneta beach, by walk, subway is better for this place. The hotel is clean, friendly, and quiet. The roof top is very good, but too small, because it success. The rooms are nice, large, and lightening. The staff is particulary friendly, particulary the receptionist called Ricardo. Only one bad points: the dressing in the room are not really esthetical ( open dressing, clothes are on view) and functionnal. The clim is too cold.

Reviews.Title: “do not let them book you a taxi-RIP OFF”
Reviews.Author: secretshopper1234
Reviews.Content: They booked us a taxi back to the airport, the 25 euro ride cost us 38 euros, the taxi driver said it was the comission for the hotel. What a rip off, the hotel is too expensive and then to charge comission for the taxi ride. I WILL NEVER STAY WITH THEM AGAIN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Nels
Reviews.Content: Let me start by letting everyone know this is NOT a gay hotel. It is a gay friendly hotel. Next, if you are interested in a nice relaxing spa keep your shorts on because the spa is co-ed. Also, the jacuzzi is not heated. They of course do not mention any of this in their marketing. Next, don't look up in the locker room or you'll see black mold growing everywhere. At check-in everyone was very friendly and then when some issues arose their was no nicety and no accommodation. Instead of working to correct any issue a manager has to get involved, only problem there is never a manager on duty. Whomever thinks this is a good hotel for the price really needs to get out more. There are so many great hotels in Barcelona this is the last place you should select.

Reviews.Title: “The new Axel looks great”
Reviews.Author: LA-CATraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Axel hotel in Barcelona from 9/19-9/22. I have stayed at this hotel twice before and really like it before. However, it looks really good now. As a person who enjoys working out, I was very impressed with the gym; it is now on the bottom floor. It has a wide array of equipment for every body part. I found the restaurant for breakfast to be nice as well. The bathroom next to the lobby is quite impressive. It should be noted that you really cannot beat the area where the hotel is located. The only issue I had was the wifi. I raised this issue to management prior to arriving after reading the many Trip Advisor reviews and experienced it first hand how slow it was. However, I discussed this with Lukos who was very professional and helpful and he moved me to another room the next day. All of the staff at Axel were very helpful. I would absolutely stay at the Axel Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “love the Axel”
Reviews.Author: peter07043
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Axel in 2008 and returned again in September 2011. I liked the Axel the first time, but I love it now. Ricardo at the front desk was terrific. Coming from New York, our plane landed early morning and we arrived at the hotel before any rooms were available for check in. He secured our luggage, gave us the WIFI password to have an internet connection, and advised us to get something to eat, then relax at the rooftop pool deck, and that our room would be ready no later than 2pm. We wound up getting some sun and a very refreshing nap up on the pool deck, and when we checked on the room status around 3pm, Ricardo informed us that it was ready and he had upgraded our room to a higher category. We LOVED the room. It had obviously been recently renovated, had a super-comfortable king bed, and a fantastic view out onto the street and the beautiful spanish architecture of the area. The hotel and the room had every amenity one could need. The gym/spa is fantastic, the pool deck becomes a lounge at night and is the perfect place to have a drink or three. The only downside to this trip was the the hotel no longer provides complimentary bottled water on each floor. This was a nice touch, that I think should be reinstated. But there are convenience stores nearby and a 1.5 litre bottle of water is only 1.5 Euro. The Axel is perfectly located in Barcelona. It's just a short walk to the the subway (for quick runs around the city) or the RENFE lines (if you want to check out Sitges or other places in Spain). The neighborhood is safe, picturesque, and charming. The Axel is surprisingly affordable for what you get. The bang-for-the-buck factor is very high.

Reviews.Title: “Good fun, great rooftop bar and great location!”
Reviews.Author: urbanwellness
Reviews.Content: Was a bit weird at first staying in such a gay hotel, but was great fun. Room was comfortable and clean, and we really enjoyed sundowners on the rooftop bar. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and brilliantly situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Axel is brilliantly situated in the L'Eixample area of Barcelona. There are many shops, cafes, restaurants and bars very close by, and it is only three blocks from the nearest metro stop. The main Placa Catalunya and La Ramblas are only a 10-15 minute walk away, and the area surrounding the hotel has numerous interesting buildings and places, so one is never short of compelling sites. There are fabulous views from the roof of the hotel. There can be fewer better locations in the city. Axel has the great virtue of not being unduly noisy. The streets surrounding the hotel are busy but once one is inside the hotel, one is genuinely insulated from the traffic and the activity of the streets. Our room was on the second floor overlooking the intersection of two streets, so I initially expected that it was going to be a very disturbed stay. Fortunately I was wrong. The room we had was small but well organised and well appointed, and both the room and the bathroom were immaculately clean. Facilities were modern; the bed was very comfortable; the shower was excellent; bathroom amenities were generous and more than sufficient; the wi-fi was fast and presented no problems; the airconditioning was good; the television worked well. The gym downstairs was well equipped. I have no complaints of any kind. Perhaps the greatest strength of the hotel, however, is its exceptional staff. I have stayed in places calling themselves a 'gay hotel' before, and often this has meant that one needs to tolerate second-rate service or facilities in the interests of supporting gay causes or gay businesses. (Axel is not exclusively gay, but through its marketing and publicity certainly probably attracts a fairly high proportion of gay guests. It advertises itself as 'hetero-friendly', and I have no doubt succeeds in that; I observed all guests being treated with great professionalism.) All too many gay businesses seem to regard they deserve support in spite of offering sub-standard facilities or service, and often overcharge for the privilege too. From the second of beginning the check-in process, I experienced nothing but highly professional, efficient and friendly service. The facilities of the hotel were well explained. The staff spoke good English (which I discovered was unusual in Spain). Room service was calm and speedy. I regretably had to cut our visit short as a friend in Barcelona was extremely offended that we were not staying privately in his apartment, so in the interests of harmonious friendship we decided to move for the second half of our visit. The change involved some negotiation, as our reservation had been made through a booking website rather than the hotel itself, and full payment for the original booking was made on arrival. The Axel staff assisted in contacting the original agents, completing the necessary paperwork, and organising everything. Within 24 hours of departure a refund on the nights initially booked but not used at very short notice was in my credit card account, with no charge or fee. I regard both the way in which this was handled as well as the fact that I was only charged for the nights we stayed as extraordinary service. Overall, a very positive experience, and I would without hesitation recommend this hotel to anyone; and I want to return myself as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Jonnycol
Reviews.Content: Hotel Axel is very nice hotel and is centrally located near the heart of Barcelona. La Ramblas (shopping and tourist district) is within walking distance and the subway/metro is two blocks away. It's a gay hotel that advertises as "heterofriendly." The staff were friendly and attentive. Rooms are spacious and the decor leans toward modern and sleek. Downside is that the hotel is quite expensive. Though, if you book during a sale or off season, it's easier on the wallet. The hotel is near most of the gay bars/clubs. Most of the visitors are on the roof deck pool/bar. The drinks are terribly expensive at the pool! 13 euro for a mojito (you can drink for 3.50 euro down the block). I would recommend the hotel and stay there again. I stayed for five nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!! Great Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: boardini
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was in a great Location 10 walk from minutes from La Ramblas . The staff were very helpful and friendly . When we booked this hotel on Expedia we were not aware that it was a gay hotel, this was a bit of an initial shock when we My girlfriend and I arrived but we didn't find this a problem because there were plenty of other hetero-couples. The rooms were very clean with good facilities and a comfy bed. The breakfast was excellent with a good variety of choice. Overall we had an excellent stay and would recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Josh305
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. It is clean and convenient and very LGBT friendly. The front staff are vary knowledgable and pointed us to a wonderful restaurant. If you're in the LGBT group, this is a great place to begin your vacation in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Just an ok hoel...nothing great, nothing too bad (except the smell in the room)”
Reviews.Author: torontoguyabroad
Reviews.Content: The lobby was impressive and the location was great. We also really liked the roof-top bar and pool area. Very nice. The room had a terrible musty smell that would not go away. The decor in the room was starting to look a little worn and dated. The room decor was probably very chic when it first opened. Did I mention the bad smell? The person that checked us in was helpful giving us tips for restaurants (that were good) and safety tips about the area. The breakfast was good and it was nice that they served it until late morning. The service in the hotel breakfast room wasn't that good. You had to search for someone to bring you coffee and they took a while to bring it.

Reviews.Title: “Best gayhotel”
Reviews.Author: DirkSAntw
Reviews.Content: It was the 3th time we stayed at Axel, we love that place !!! We slept in the new part, these rooms are bigger. Great atmosphere at the roof. But straight people remember it's a heterofriendly hotel, so it is gay ! You feel it everywhere in the hotel !

Reviews.Title: “We won't be back to stay at the hotel despite the nice roof-top bar”
Reviews.Author: noddza
Reviews.Content: The lobby is impressive when you walk into the hotel but sadly things were not so great after that. When we first arrived to our room there was no electricity and it took the staff almost half an hour to sort it out during which time we just had to sit and wait. The room itself was much smaller than we expected and only had a view of the building directly opposite. We had to keep the curtains closed so that the people in the building couldn't see directly into the room. The bathroom only had a shower and no bath. On the second day just as we were getting up the electricity in the room failed again and we had to sit in the dark for about 45 minutes until the staff found the problem (a leak from upstairs into the light in the bathroom). A request to move to another room was denied by reception staff who assured us they would fix the problem but it wasn't done speedily and meant we couldn't leave our room to go out for the day when we wanted to. The room key cards also stopped working regularly during the day and on the second day housekeeping hadn't left us any towels. The WiFi coverage in the room was extremely intermittent. Although the staff did try to fix the problems we had it is a shame that this did not happen more quickly and that they didn't agree to move us to another room. On the positive side, the hotel is in an excellent location and the roof-bar is pleasant to sit out in and enjoy the views and the sun. However, despite this our experiences overall will mean we won't be back as there are several other excellent hotels within the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Prisoner cell block H and taxi rip off”
Reviews.Author: Nantosu
Reviews.Content: The room was very small with limited space for clothes and no coffee making facilities, which was very disappointing for a four star hotel. The air con wasn't very effective. The room stank of smoke and the towels were grey and old. The floor wasn't cleaned well and an item of clothing went missing. The lift was erratic. The view was of corrugated iron hence title of review. We couldn't even tell if the sun was shining. The most disappointing thing was ordering a taxi to the airport via the hotel was a rip off. The driver charged us an additional fifteen euros to what we paid on arrival. Hence I would not stay in such an untrustworthy place again. Oh and pool tiny and no parasols. The location was good and there were free condoms if that's what you're after.

Reviews.Title: “A great city stay”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the hotel (our first time). We found it everything we had hoped it to be. It was very much in the centre of the gay district of Barcelona. Very conviniently placed. The building itself has been very nicely refurbished both outside and in. In particular the reception area and sky bar. They both appear that of a 5 star hotel. We (to our surprise) got greeted by a very well spoken english chap who was very pleasant. He informed us where we could find the SPA (which is not part of the hotel) the gym and most importantly, the sky bar! He was unsure of some of the information but told us he was new and apologized but soon found out for us. We received one of the nicer newer rooms. (We had friends staying in the older part) The room was very nice, the only thing was the minibar, which had many things already missing. Still it was always clean and we only had one issue with towels on our last night. (They had none!) Breakfast buffet is ok, but avoid it if you want anything special. Also, the lifts have a mind of there own, it can take ages to get to your floor. Again, it's location is ideal. We really had a great time and shall stay again, preferably in winter!

Reviews.Title: “Must try harder”
Reviews.Author: ColinandDidier
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I are just back from a trip to Barcelona and Sitges. We had stayed at the Axel 7 years ago and loved it and were really happy to return. We checked in to be greeted by what has to have been the most dour check in clerk I have ever come across. We were understandably happy to be starting our trip and were all smiles and Hi's, non were returned, a little pleasantry goes a long way. After what must have been 20 minutes or more were were given our key, no info on the hotel, breakfast, rooftop bar, offer of map, location advice etc only info on the spa facilities and treatments? When we got to the room we were greeted by a horrible smell of cigarette smoke. The room itself was on the 5th floor to the right of the lift, nice room. I phoned down to reception (no indication of services I just dialed 0, the 9 then eventually someone answered). I explained to the Check in Clerk, (The same one who had dealt with us moments before) that the room stank of cigarette smoke, he said that 'the hotel is Non Smoking so...' I replied that if he wished to send someone up they could check? he paused and asked what I would like him to do...I said that we would not be happy to stay in this smelly room suggested that he might move us, I asked for another room away from the lift. We were given a room on the 3rd floor Next to the lift? The room was of an older design but as we were only staying for 1 night we just took it. I understand that people will smoke even when told not too but the cleaning staff could have opened the windows and sprayed some air freshener earlier in the day then returned and closed the windows a few hours later. In addition I don't expect an attitude from the desk clerk when I report a valid complaint and then have to return to reception and wait again for another key. We should have been told which room to go to and met at the new room to ensure that this room was ok? It seems this lack of attention has been noted by other TA reviewers and is brining this hotel down. I would not be moved to return unless I notice a reported change in what appears to be a Don't Care attitude. I must say that having had a really great experience on our previous visit the benchmark had been set high but if you are coming on a first visit Don't expect all 4 star rooms, Service or Assistance and compare the price to other NON Gay hotels and you will be making a fair comparison. The Axel is trading of its past glory. The prices have come down but I would be happy to have paid more and had our previous experience repeated. Also I noticed that the fridges filled with bottle water for guests have been removed and one of our towels was a bit thread bare, a few more symptoms maybe?? If you are going to stay..Ask for a rome away from the lift and not directly under the roof bar as it goes on until 2 and then you have the dragging of bottles for another hour at least.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: filipnw
Reviews.Content: I have experienced the roof top and terrazz with friends before but never stayed as a guest. This was the first time and I was looking forward to it a lot. Starting from check in, things turned out to be not so great. Not really bad, but not as good as I had hoped. Check in took forever and we received no information about the facilities. The roof terrace was over crowded (this was after Circuit week). No towels to sun bath so we got our own ones from the room which meant we had no clean towels to shower. Any contact with staff was very forced and I almost felt like I had to apologize to ask a question. Security questionable since anyone could easily go to roof terrace and after that take the stairs down to any floor you want to. Maybe part of the business idea; spontaneous visits to the guests from the street? On the positive side, sound proof and easy access to any mischief you might want to get up to!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel service and a total robbery in terms of value.”
Reviews.Author: beto2808
Reviews.Content: Booked online 24 hours before for staying two nights, stil it took 20 minutos to chrck in and i was the only person in reception, never got greated ( guy called kealen) never told that the hotel had a gym or a spa , the guy hardly spoke. my reservation was made under my 1 st surname bizzarly. reception stuff looked all from eastern countries, cold, no expression , old uniform and very poor quality, also it did not fit tbe guy properly, too small. no pool towllers , we asked and asked , spend all day by the pool with room towllers, we were told to complaint at the reception. went to the SPA very nice, the lady wanted us to pay cash, i was quite suprised to be charged at all. in the SPA too much chem product in the pool my eyes got read and ichy. overall never again.

Reviews.Title: “good location but poor maid service”
Reviews.Author: juanluisamoroso
Reviews.Content: mixed gay & straight hotel; nicely remodeled ; very modern inside ; gay bar on the roof ; good breakfast ; but every day there was a problem with the maid, one day no blankets, another day no soap , another day no towels , etc. front desk was helpful; free internet & computers in mezzanine ; in gay neighborhood

Reviews.Title: “Worst scam ever! Stay away from the Axel”
Reviews.Author: fablupark
Reviews.Content: I had prepaid the most expensive rooftop suite with terrace etc and got charged 600€. When I arrived, staff simply told me people in the suite had decided to stay longer. I thought it was a bad joke until they put me in the lowest category room, a 12m2 facing a wall. No excuses and no offer to refund! In 10 years of travel

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler33Nyc
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of searching around online to find a place to stay for a few days while we were in Barcelona. The hotel is adorable. The person at the front desk was super helpful, very nice, The rooms are a good size, much bigger than what I generally expect when I'm in Europe. The location is great, super close to everything, we pretty much walked around the city from the hotel. We had breakfast included in our room rate which was helpful. Typical hotel breakfast, bacon, toast, fruit, coffee, all really good. The one thing I did that I normally don't do is I bought one of the packages for tours in the city. We had both a bus ticket on one of the tour buses and a discount museum pass. This saved us a ton of money. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere, but phone got stolen in room”
Reviews.Author: pl2se
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location in a very nice area. Rooms where quite average regarding their decoration and furniture. They where clean, but housekeeping forgot to refill soap and shampoo sometimes. The same with the minibar. The only time they refilled it was after our first night. ( out of five nights ) Wifi in room was terrible but it worked fine in the lobby. The other guests was very nice and friendly and the rooftop pool and bar where excellent. The only problem, and that is a very big one, is that my girlfriends iPhone 4 got stolen from the room! I have never ever had anything like that happening to me during my around 2000 nights at different hotels worldwide. The phone was stolen when housekeeping had opened the door. I made a complaint and tried to get in contact with their manager but he has neglected to call me back. Of course this reflects my over all rating.

Reviews.Title: “I loved every part of it - I will go back next summer ...”
Reviews.Author: Wintersmiths
Reviews.Content: Travelling solo has it´s advantages and disadvantages. Fortunately the warm and friendly environment of the hotel made it easy to get in touch with people, and I had good company all along my stay. The staff were very professional and friendly, and every question and request was met with a smile and a warm attitude. The breakfast buffet was excellent so going to eat breakfast was a treat in itself. The location is also perfect, right in the middle of "everything", with clubs, shopping and sights close by. The rooftop terrace has a nice pool and jacuzzi, and excellent happenings and parties every night. Being gay, this is the percfect "friendly" place to stay in Barcelona, and I would really like to recommend this place, both if you travel as a couple, but especially if you travel solo like I did.

Reviews.Title: “Over hyped, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: stephen787
Reviews.Content: I only stayed her as a friend has already booked at the Axel. Guests are greeted by blaring dance music in the reception area which is quite disconcerting when you are arriving after a long trip and are tired. A lot of money has been spent on the public areas to give the hotel a 'design' look but the rooms are very basic and over priced for what you get. The finish of the rooms is that of a budget hotel rather than a 4 or 5 star property. My tiny double room faced the rear light well. so my window looked out on to other rooms which also had no view. So my curtains remain closed the whole time. The rooftop bar was it's only saving feature as this was a great spot for drink in the afternoon and at sunset. Pity the bar staff are not better trained as well in mixing drinks as we were served some odd concoctions. The rooftop pool design did not encourage me to use it as it filled up with only a few guests. The final downside is the breakfast room off the reception area. The waiting staff seem to have lost all control on how to run a dining room with 70% of tables covered in dirty dishes when we cam down for breakfast and we were forced to sit at a dirty table for 10 mins before someone appeared to clean it. The breakfast selection was not wonderful and we left preferring to eat out at a cafe rather than pick and scraps from the buffet.
