Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Njh001
Reviews.Content: Axel Hotel The rooms are very basic as we expected but we were a little surprised at the finish most obviously in the bathroom with chunks of grouting missing and dirty tiles. There is a nice pool deck on the roof with a bar serving drinks and light snacks which is very handy if you don't fancy visiting the beach. The breakfast was good and the staff helpful and efficient. Very mixed selection of guests certainly evidence of their 'heterofriendly' tag line. Wireless in the public areas but in the rooms was next to useless - something that definitely needs fixing! Nice hotel in a good location but I think I would opt for an upgraded room if I were to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth Paying Premium Rates”
Reviews.Author: RonPalmSprings
Reviews.Content: Unless you obtain a very good rate, this hotel is not worth paying a premium rate just to stay is a Gay establishment. If you want to meet other people on the roof deck, this is open to the public and has a very mixed crowd as is common for Barcelona. I was staying there prior to a Gay cruise and so was helpful to meet other people. I booked very early to obtain a good rate. There was a 4 hr wait to get into the rooms on the return when the cruise was over. The internet was almost non-existent in the rooms. The front desk staff was helpful but not always consistent on information. The gym facilities are owned by an outside group but guests are only permitted to use the gym free and not the rest of the club. The hotel provides you a small bar of soap that is used up with the first washing! So if you must be in the center of the gay area and can good a good rate, this hotel would be a choice to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings - our second stay at the Axel Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JT88
Reviews.Content: We booked an Axel Premium room for our stay at the end of June (room #206 or #210 if I recall correctly). We were on the 2nd floor. Noise level was not bad with the doors closed given our proximity to the road. Really large bedroom (looks renovated since our last visit there) with a very swanky lobby. The pool/bar area on the roof was very nice and expanded since our last stay there. Location was also great and we walked everywhere, including to/from the Renfe Train stop. Wifi internet was accessible and fine for surfing, but too slow to accomodate use of Skype (even just audio) - either that or they were blocking VoIP. No problems with checkin/checkout. One of the nicest/largest hotel gyms we've ever visited (one tip: bring your own gym towel from your room to use in the gym; they don't tell you you have to bring your own, and the front desk of the gym might give you grief for trying to get one from them; the lady manning the gym desk was nice enough to make an exception and provide us with some gym towels to use). The mini-bottles of free water they used to provide (when we last stayed there years ago) were no longer offered. The elevators are CONFUSING there - there are multiple elevators in every hallway, and only particular elevators will go to the basement/gym, and particular ones will go to the roof/pool/bar. There were no markings however telling you which goes to which until you get into the elevator. Unfortunately there were several pretty huge negatives that will give us second thoughts about staying there next time. The two biggest ones were smell and cleanliness in our rooms. The room, when we entered, was SO heavily perfumed that we were literally choking. Imagine the perfume section of your local department store like Macys/Bloomingdales, and then amplify that 10fold. We are not kidding, it was so bad we opened up all the windows/doors for hours deciding that we'd prefer the smoggy air of the traffic below over the perfume. Surprisingly, the heavy perfume scent in our room did not go away and only decreased by about half with the windows opened - so we wonder if that scent was actually being pumped into the room from the vents? In any case, it smelled like someone had been smoking there and was trying to cover it up. The second big issue for us was cleanliness of the bathroom: there was mold around the bathtub and the ceiling tiles were similarly moldy. It was such a shame as the rest of the room was fairly clean, and the bathroom (all in white) would have otherwise been quite stunning. So, sadly, after this stay despite our typical preference for Axel hotels, the heavy room scent, moldy bathroom, and Skype-incapable wifi means we will most likely try a different hotel next time (maybe the W that we saw towards the water from the rooftop?).

Reviews.Title: “Very descrete - underated”
Reviews.Author: imduk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is advertised as a hetro friendly hotel - this shouldnt put you off - firstly the downside - Checkin - after 2 pm - can be a problem if you are on an early arival - however the hotel do store your bags - anyway now the good points - Reception - minimalistic in looks - service good and efficient Bedrooms - Stylish, comfortable - fantastic pillows - very clean - great flat screen TV's Roof top pool - on the small side but big enough - great sunbathing area a nd fantastic bar - not the cheapest but not expensive - remember its a hotel in a major city Parking - its Barcelona - if you can dont take a car - but if you have to there is a car park near bye £25 euro for 24 hours The hotel rates it self as a 3 star - I stayed in 5 star hotels what are not as good as this hotel - opposite the hotel is a great tapas restaurant - reasonably priced but great food - Overall a very good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: texasbrian
Reviews.Content: This was an incredible place to have stayed while visiting Barcelona. The staff were always extraordinarily helpful, especially going easily between my broken Spanish and their command of at least three languages. The room was well-appointed, with a nice shower and Ikea-style wireframe shelving that made for some unusual storage spaces. The bed was very comfortable, although there is no comforter. As for location, it's hard to beat: this property is near the best bars, some amazing restaurants, and a few short blocks from La Rambla, Plaza Catalunya, Casa Battlo, and La Pedrera... possibly even the Font Magica and Plaza Espanya if you're willing to go for a 15-minute stroll. The only downside here: The wifi connection is slower-than-slow. It was painful. There are two computers on the Floor 1 for goes use, but it makes any computer use in your room a chore at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the middle of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MBWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: Pros/Likes: - Great looking modern room of decent size and with a balcony - Flat-screen TV with 30 channels - Nice friendly hotel staff; check-in and out were fast and efficient - Minibar with some space left to put in your own bottles - In-room safe deposit box - Wonderful location with lots of nearby restaurants/bars plus just a seven-minute walk to the nearest metro station - Nice restaurant with room service (good salads; fast delivery) - Two PCs with free internet in the mezzanine level - Great coed spa with jacuzzi, sauna, and steam room with massage services - Exercise room with good equipment - Rooftop and street-level bars with a good mix of people - Rooftop pool with great views of the city Cons/Dislikes: - Breakfast was 16 euros (though 12 euros if you decide/pay at check-in) - In-room internet wi-fi was 7 euros per day - No in-room coffee - No door eye viewer to check first when somebody's knocking - The worst thing was noise from flushing toilets from the rooms above, though the noise decreases with the bathroom door closed (but you can still hear it) Neutral: - The bed was fine but had no headboard so you would be leaning against the wall (e.g., for watching TV) - Small bathroom though adequate - The air conditioner sometimes was slow or not cold enough Miscellaneous: Primarily a gay hotel but they mean it when they say it's hetero-friendly as there were many straight couples staying at the hotel Impression: Great hotel in the middle of Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Staff are excellent, manager is a disgrace and hotel is very average”
Reviews.Author: Jamesr0253
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in June. I have been traveling for 8 months and this was the worst experience I have had so far. The staff were excellent, however the general manager is an utter disgrace. Maybe the problem is higher up but to lack of staff at the hotel is wrong. We ordered some drinks and had to wait over 40 min in the boiling heat as the poor bar tender was doing room service and attending to the bar. We ordered a hamburger which was raw and tasted horrible. When I went to complain it was a huge issue to speak to the manager or preferred just to swan around in a cream suit than deal with the issues. Sorry you are not working at this hotel to just look pretty you have to WORK. I was the accused of lying about the food, which went down like a done of bricks. When I mentioned how long the drinks took he srugged and said oh we only have one staff. Well let me give you some advice mr horrible general manager, take your cream suit off and do some work for a change. Overall I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The bar manager Angelo is amazing and made up for the horrific experience, but next time in Barcelona I'd only go to axel for a drink. The axel in Berlin kills Barcelona in every way.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service level, yet 3 star facilities”
Reviews.Author: OLV_P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Axel in 2006 and at that time it was the first and only four star gay hotel in Europe. There was a lot of hype about the hotel both from the gay community and the hospitality industry. Everyone knows gay consumers are most difficult to please in hospitality, especially at 4 and 5 star hotels. The hotel has a beautiful classic facade, with impressive views at night, made even more dramatic as the building sits on a corner of an intersection. I returned to the Axel almost 5 years after my previous stay, having learned that the hotel underwent major renovations in 2010 and that some important improvements were made such as adding a gym and enlarging the SPA. I was pleased to discover the customer service level has greatly improved, especially Front Office, Kitchen (main restaurant) and Sky Bar. Housekeeping is as slow as it was during my last stay and after cleaning rooms have a strong choloride smell. I was not at all impressed with the renovation of the public spaces. In 2006, they were indeed fashionable, cutting edge and contemporary. Today, the lobby looks lackluster and the black tall plastic chairs with the black curtains hardly make the welcoming area quite cold, more resembling of an entrance to a night club. On the roof top, again the bar looks very dark and the wooden floors have been painted dark brown. What used to be a small swimming pool is today a very small plunge pool. As a central design point of the hotel. I was expecting owners to pay more attention to the roof top. As for the rooms, they are small, really small (as they used to). I thought the renovation would be a great opportunity to increase the size of some rooms, especially the ones facing the inner courtyard, which are so dark they barely have any natural light. The renovation in the rooms consisted mostly in changing the wallpaper, curtians and floors. All lighting is the same as it was in 2006 and so is TV, a rather small size LCD. Towels and bathrobes (therwise sold for 50 euro!) look used, many even torn and bathroom amenities are generic ones, with 100% artificial ingredients....in a gay hotel ! Many guests I have met during my previous stay and my current stay, said they opted for the hotel to enjoy the parties and networking with other guests. Unfortunately, there are no major improvements on this front either. Same weekly parties take place, week after week and unless people spend time in the Jacuzzi, there are no other major networking options. The hotel did implement AxelPeople, a sort of an ''inhouse facebook'' where guests are invited to create their own profile and network with each other. During my stay, I hardly saw 2 people online at a time, plus I would suppose some did not have their laptops or simply did not find it interesting. Concierge should do much more about promoting events which take place in the city - maybe send a daily calendar by email or a print version. I would suggest one major event per week, especially in highseason, instead of 3 or 4 events as they are doing now. Also, given the size of rooms, facilities, the hotel is overpriced ! (breakfast is never included). I booked a City room (standard room) and I was told I was given an upgrade to a Premier Room (slightly larger in size) but overlooking the inner courtyard. I wanted the same Premier Room category facing outwards, and I had to pay a premium for the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Axel losing it's appeal”
Reviews.Author: tjtraveller_11
Reviews.Content: The Axel Hotel Barcelona has definitely lost what used to be a hip and friendly edge. The hotel has begun a transformation which makes it less “hetero-friendly” and more “gay-friendly”. While the staff and many patrons are gay, it is obvious the hotel is trying to become less so. The fluctuating room rates however, reflect their desire to snag as many gay dollars as possible, with truly exorbitant rates around gay specific happenings. Unfortunately, the rate paid does not reflect either the quality or comfort of the hotel. Their mild redo is little more than a fresh coat of paint, and the general lack of quality service make for a rather poor lodging choice. The location is great, however and within walking distance to many popular spots in town. The rooftop bar has a great view, but is sadly overshadowed by the down right rude staff that serve there. High drink prices and a disdainful attitude do not go well. The W Barcelona has prices just as high, but friendly and courteous staff. Overall, we will not stay at the Axel again, and I would not feel comfortable recommending this hotel as a lodging choice, whether gay or straight.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Patricksworld
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Great location and try to get room with balcony. Really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. As always”
Reviews.Author: Alfy1
Reviews.Content: We always go to Axel hôtel, both in barcelona and in Berlin. We find the hôtel very Nice and the staff ver y friendly! In Berlin they upgraded our room as it was m'y birthday We are returning to barcelona for 10 days in august 2011 for our wedding anniversary!! Who knows maybe another upgrade :-) All in all a pleasure to stay at this hôtel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The only place for me in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: plantboy5
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was incredible. A huge room (small closet areas) and a huge comfortable bed. Has a great Vibe and met people from all over the world every night at their Roof Top party. I was there to party and have a good time and would go back tomorrow if I could. Liked everything about it and will recommend it to all my gay American friends.

Reviews.Title: “All 'style' no substance!”
Reviews.Author: Laochmor
Reviews.Content: Overly priced for average service! Rooms were like boxes and their internet service did not work in spite of their multiple servers - this was very dissappointing as it was one of the main reasons we booked. Roof terrace was great but watch out for over priced cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fun Stay”
Reviews.Author: giromondo
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Axel. Found the location to be very convenient (restaurants, bars, metro stations, sightseeing... ~35 Euro taxi from airport). Rooms were clean with nice design. We had ample room for storing things (would be nice to offer more hangers in the closet). Beds were very comfy. Bathroom was spacious - v good water pressure, temperature in shower. Nice amenities. A/C worked fine, room was quiet... conducive to good sleep! Staff were generally helpful, though sometimes indifferent. Front desk seemed short-staffed a few times (just 1 person or no-one available). But they did provide useful advice and suggestions. Several connections were available for wi-fi - and performance was generally good. Great view from pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Not the gay hotel it is marketed to be. Wouldn't go out of my way to return.”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer813
Reviews.Content: Our feelings about the Axel Hotel are mixed. One the one hand, the building is very nice and the location is good. The rooms are also pretty decent, but (like most hotels) show signs of wear and tear. On the other hand, we could not help but feel that the gay aspect of the hotel was very oversold. We chose this hotel ONLY because it was marketed as a gay destination, but to our great disappointment, we discovered that it is not what it was described to be. The first day of our arrival, there was a party on the roof that we were told about at check-in. When we got to the roof, though, it was full of very young women and heterosexuals. The few gays who showed up with us felt markedly out of place. For the rest of our stay, we ran into more women and heterosexuals on the roof bar and in the hotel. The Axel markets itself as "hetero-friendly," but based on our experiences, it would be more appropriate to call it "gay friendly." I certainly don't think any hotel should close itself off entirely to any group of people and I'm not complaining that they let people other than gay men in (I'm not advocating discrimination!)--my issue is that I felt deceived by the way the hotel is marketed. Just don't go expecting an overly gay experience. One of our other major complaints is that the roof bar was hardly ever open! I can think of at least a half dozen times on our trip where I would have bought drinks, but couldn't because the bar was closed. Thus, we ended up spending our money elsewhere. It wasn't like we were there at odd times either--you'd think any hotel bar would be open at 6:00 PM! However, the bar apparently closes for several hours between the afternoon and evening shifts. It didn't matter to me whether the downstairs bar was open (it might have been)--I wanted to enjoy the roof deck and the views. If I wanted to have a drink in a dark corner, I could go anywhere else. It really makes no sense to me why the roof bar isn't open throughout the day. And speaking of the roof, can you guys make the outdoor hot tub warmer? The water was so cold on our last day that we couldn't even get in. On the rare occasions they were working, the bartenders were not particularly friendly or helpful, and they would often disappear for long periods of time, making it difficult to get a drink. Other staff could have used a lesson in customer service as well. The only really friendly employees were the maids. I should also note that the spa is beautiful, but is apparently never used. I was there for a few hours for a treatment and relaxation and didn't see a single other person. I'm not complaining about my time in the spa--it just seems like a waste that it's not utilized. Perhaps they should charge less for it? Lastly (as other reviewers have mentioned), the WiFi service was completely unreliable for our entire stay. We had to move around the room until we found a signal and stay put to keep a connection, but even then, we’d lose it after a few minutes. Useless and not worth the price at all. In short, the Axel isn't a gay hotel--it's just gay-friendly. And if gay-friendly is what you're after, there are a ton of choices in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to centre and straight friendly”
Reviews.Author: tankerton1944
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Ramblas. Metro nearby and bus routes close. Modern interior style. Wellness Centre below offers discounts for massages etc. Roof top sundeck has bar, small pool and tub. Breakfast is extra and (2011) is € 16 - unless you want to eat the works it is expensive. Fresh melon, squeezed orange juice etc and all kinds of rolls pastries cheese meats and scrambled egs on offer. Rooms are cool and well appointed. Large walkin showers Great staff. The hotel is set up for gay visitors but all are made welcome The door knob labels are unusual ! 1 Do not disturb 2 Make up room 3 Please knock !! Expensive and under used bar on ground floor Close to some gay bars and restaurants but the non-gay ones are cheaper and better I would go again

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish - as expceted from a "heterofriendly" hotel”
Reviews.Author: krispeekreme
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Axel for three nights. We are a male gay couple, and were interested to see what this hotel was about. Our room (facing inward at our request - both inward and outward were offered to us) was quiet and very stylish. The rooftop bar had a great view. The gym underneath the hotel was clean and very adequate for travelling. This hotel is not "over-the-top-gay" and I would recommend to either gay or straight people. The staff were exceptionally hepful and well dressed. The wifi internet in our room was a little unreliable from time to time. Those that worry about it being "a gay hotel" should fear not: do your self a favour and try it.

Reviews.Title: “Mouldy Air Conditioning Warning”
Reviews.Author: doitonabike
Reviews.Content: The central air conditioning emitted the distinctive odour of mould. If you have allergies or are immune suppressed DO NOT STAY at the Axel. Do not take the chance. The A/C system obviously is not properly maintained. The Axel is often described as 5-Star but utterly fails to meet this standard, The rooms and linens are nice but the service is merely adequate. The hotel barely meets 4-Star standards and is not worth the regular room rate. We had a one-night stay after disembarking from a cruise. There is no restaurant open on a Sunday which is unacceptable in a full-service hotel. Notices in the room referred to robes and slippers - we had none. Other hotels at half the price include free WIFI - the Axel wants almost 7euros a day; we used the complimentary service at Starbucks to telephone home. Our impression was that by calling itself a gay hotel (there were many str8 couples as well) the Axel thinks it can inflate its rating. Don't be fooled. This is a good 3.5 Star business hotel only. Anyone paying full price is being severely ripped-off.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kleefcliff
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Axel Hotel Barcelona was great. From check-in to check-out, the service was wonderful. The front desk staff (including Andre, Win, and Ricardo), could not have been more pleasant and helpful. They were helpful with directions to local attractions, as well as restaurant recommendations (we loved the Alba!) We'll definitely be back to this hotel next time we visit Barcelona. We found the property to be mostly gay, but also included some straight couples as well as lesbian couples traveling with kids. The hotel has a rooftop pool, hot tub, and bar that was fun to visit at the end of a day touring around the city. I would have given this property 5 out of 5 stars, except for one thing: We would have liked the rooftop sky bar to have stayed open later (it closed at 6pm, just when the roof starts to get more popular), and the food service up there stopped at 5pm. Otherwise, an amazing experience at the Axel!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money for one second”
Reviews.Author: zurichfive
Reviews.Content: For a hotel claiming to be "gay lifestyle" it is simply awful. 1) no place in the room where you could put your travel luggage, shoes 2) furniture is more design than function. #fail 3) the breakfast is really crap - every 2 star hotel does better 4) wi-fi not working properly at utterly high price 5) staff is not friendly 6) staff would not even explain the amenities at check-in time 7) breakfast room neither clean nor nice in any other way 8) documentation of gay life is better in ANY other hotel in Barcelona Paws off this one, it's a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Wow..what a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DarrenPLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Axel hotel in Barcelona on the 23rd of May. what a shame it was only 1 night. Great hotel/Design and very friendly. Very comfortable bed too, had an amazing sleep. The shower was great..big Glass cubicle ..loads of space and very clean. I have stayed in many hotels all over the world. It ws a pure pleasure to stay here. Amazing view from the roomtop and what areally nice breakfast..loads of choice and plenty of fresh fruit.The whole hotel was very stylish and great design. The reception staff were very friendly and smiling. Not the last time i'll be staying at the axel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel, could not ask for more”
Reviews.Author: maggiemaggie091
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for one week, just came back. Very nice , modern interior, everything very clean. and I am a very fussy person. Ideal location for visiting the sites, metro and buses very close, you can even walk to the Sagrada Familia, Me and my husband, we had a room on the 6th floor with a view for the main road (ideal). Very comfortable bed (for a change), balcony and a nice shower. All the stuff are always welcome you with a nice smile, very professional and helpful. Even if you are very fussy you will not find one bad thing about this hotel. A lot of gay people stay in this hotel, but no difference for me although I must admit they are all so handsome, what a waste for girls:) Forgot to mention, very quiet, no noisy people in the hotel. Overall, perfect location and an ideal hotel I would stay there once again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again :)”
Reviews.Author: Danielle_Roger
Reviews.Content: Hello, just got back from a very enjoyable week in Barcelona. It is a very polished and a great value hotel. Location about 15 minute walk to Place Catalonia. Buffet breakfast was a great value. You get a discount if you pre-reserved for each day of your stay. It was plentiful and a great way to start your exploration of this wonderful city. Rooms facing the street are noisier that the courtyard room. We had ear plugs so not an issue for us as we liked to open the window and hear the street life. Free internet access on upper lobby. Definitely would stay here again. Danielle and Roger.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for gays - and other nice people”
Reviews.Author: robinoslo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed four nights at this hotel. It was the perfect choice. Very nice location, lots of nice bars, cafes and shops in the neighbourhood. Many spanish native people residing and working here. A few blocks away the buzz is that of tourists. Nice to be close to Plaza Catalunya etc, but prefer relaxing in a quieter area. All staff I met was excellent. Very friendly and patient when I asked for a special shop, lunchplace etc. The spa was wonderful, beautiful, I had a great massage. Nice breakfast, and I also enjoyed a rooftop nightcap (from the minibar) under the full moon, a good sign that they don't close the roofterrace after dinner. I am very sensitive to noise, so got a room facing the backyard. Nice bed. I will definitely be back at Axel next time I visit Barcelona. - Robin, Norway.

Reviews.Title: “"Straight friendly" is a fair description, but definitely a gay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Market2k
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very nice, staff was extra friendly and helpful. The hotel is situated in the epicenter of gay Barcelona but you don't feel anything as extreme as West Hollywood around Santa Monica & Robertson at all. I could recommend the Axel to gay men but definitely not to a family. We'd go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: OzzyMuz
Reviews.Content: The Axel is a modern hotel in a great location for those who want to explore Barcelona. Its only a few blocks walk to La Rambla and a number of great tapas bars (Tapas 24 and La Flaunta). The rooms were of ok size, but wouldn't have wanted to be any smaller. The king bed was super comfy and the shower was fantastic. The hotel gym (free) was great and the spa was 6 euro per day to use. The hotel has a parking deal with a garage for 20 euro a day. We arrived about midday and the check in did wonders to get us a room early. While there was a definate gay vibe about the hotel (a few naked torsos about, even on the room safe) the staff were extremely helpful and the mix of guests was about half gay to hetro.

Reviews.Title: “((Friendly))”
Reviews.Author: localPatronOslo
Reviews.Content: Barcelona I've been many times in Barcelona and love the city in many ways. This was my first meeting with the Hotel Axel. The location is perfect. Outside, but inside. The street Aribau is a beautiful setting among it all. And I mean everything. The staff is professional and never to bother. Apart from the woman who never said hello on arrival, it was brilliant reception from the boys who worked there. The price is higher than i normally appreciate, but through hotels.com it was an affordable price. I had a request for a room high up in order to have a good sense of space overlooking the streets, apparently the receptionist did not understand when he placed me with a view to the backyard. But, I should've told him, which I did not. So... The room is perfect, but something small. Everything works well and it smells clean and delicious. TV facilities were good, but the remote was very slow and design from the last century. The phone was in modern design (...) It also costs money to release a fart, and I am always annoyed when it costs money to be on the Internet. So 90s. Include it in the price for the room is a suggestion. I really like the style that the hotel is «hetero-friendly» that signals the good values from the owners. There are also several minor details established with a twinkle in your eyes. Very good - and create a including atmosphere. Room service and food was terrific. Try cheese and fruit salad. Perfect!. There is also a fantastic roof terrace that you will love with a Jacuzzi. A hotel, I certainly recommend, especially if you manage to get a good deal from hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, nice area, but...”
Reviews.Author: h0bg0blin
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel knowing it 's gay friendly. It was actually hetero-friendly, still nothing in the staff or the client's behavior made us feel uncomfortably. The hotel is in a nice area, it is decorated with a minimal attitude and it is clean, so from that aspect it's a very good option, financially speaking. Still, and this is only my personal view, some things were degrading gay partnerships. Maybe some people do love it, but I cannot say I liked the nude mens photos on everything (room deco, safety boxes...), the dark red-toned lighting in the elevators, or the fact they offered condoms in the bathroom set, but not a body lotion (in every hotel I ve been they offer shampoo, shower gel and body lotion, everything else is considered extra)... As a heterosexual I would be offended if any hotel was promoting much hetero-sex in my room, so I cannot understand why a gay person must be treated differently. Still, must be noted, that Axel Hotel doesn't hide what it is and anyone should check it's website to choose if they want to stay there. We didn't regret it, but surely it could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Freindlytraveller
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in this Hotel, unless you love incredibly loud music in the foyer, ridiculous 'red light' even in the lift first thing in the morning, degrading naked body photos for every deco u can think of : from computer screens to tv and/or room deco, etc shoved down your throat WHEREVER you look! If you think, that being 'gay' merely means a life-style of picking up casual sex-partners, and cruising for that, than this is the place for you. But if, like me, you think that this is a RIDICULOUS, misleading and utterly degrading portrayal of same-sex partnership, which only defers from 'heteros' by being attracted to partners of the same gender and - in fact - have a very normal and stable relationship, long term. And thus, if your real reason to come to Barcelona is to enjoy the SITES, such as Gaudi, the amazing Picasso Museum, the Pueblo Espanya, and many other lovely things, like the really nice food, than stay at any hotel which will treat you with QUIET, restrained respect which you/i/all of us fully deserve! Not mentioning that they will charge you for the wi-fi, with the full knowledge that it DOES not actually work in the hotel !!!! Day-time robbery! Find another Hotel, I say, there is such an enormous choice in Barcelona….

Reviews.Title: “Mixed thoughts”
Reviews.Author: gazzerukukuk
Reviews.Content: The experience started well enough. The check in was done by a very polite young lady. However, the room was a tremendous disappointment. It is basically one big room with a sectioned off bathroom and the shower is separated from the bedroom by just glass, giving no privacy whatsoever. Luckily the glass steams up somewhat when having a shower but this sort of arrangement is disappointing. There are signs in the hotel room which you can put on the door which basically gives an invitation to strangers to call in on you - I'm not a prude but this sort of behaviour is disgusting, especially for a so called 4 star hotel. We experienced rather glum looks from the barman and the drinks were very expensive. Probably the most upsetting this was that our room did not have a view. It simply looked out onto the atrium of the hotel and this was rather upsetting. I feel the location of the hotel is fantastic and I would love to stay here again. However, based on the chance of getting a room without a view and those distasteful signs that people put on the door, I think I will choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Axel hotel made my trip to Barcelona that much more enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: sbshiraz1
Reviews.Content: Axel hotel with it's central location, friendly and efficient staff was welcoming which made my stay quite enjoyable in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: saphyrestardust
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon in March and stayed for 5 nights. First impressions were great, the hotel lobby was lovely and the staff were pleasant. We were a little diaspointed with the room, it was small and had very little natural light with it being on the inside of the hotel. As others have mentioned it was all one room containing bedroom and bathroom, there was a sliding door separating the toilet. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. There was wifi available in the rooms, but it wasn't cheap. There were 2 old computers on the first floor for guests to use that had internet, unfortunately though for the last 3 days of our stay the internet wasn't working at all. The main disappointment for me was the service... Everyone was nice enough but nothing seemed to get done. For example, the first night of our stay we asked if we could upgrade to a suite, or a room on the outside with a balcony. The girl on reception said that the hotel was fully booked that night but it shouldn't be a problem for the rest of the week. Nothing ever happened with that, despite me mentioning it again. Also we had a problem with the keycard, the door wouldn't lock all the time. We spoke to the staff member in reception and he advised us that maintenece would check it the following day, again this never happened. The rooftop terrace was lovely, though the pool was freezing in March! My only suggestion for that would be to perhaps keep at least one of the lights up there turned on at night. The downstairs bar was nicely decorated, the barmaid was friendly but the drinks were somewhat overpriced at £12 per mojito. The location was pretty good, roughly 10 minutes walk to Plaça de Catalunya and Las Ramblas. Overall it wasn't bad, but it wasn't exactly the hotel i'd have chosen for my honeymoon. Barcelona in general was fabulous! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice but a little bit noise”
Reviews.Author: tsoune
Reviews.Content: I had a problem with the shower from neighbour at 9. The breakfast is very nice and the coffee is very good and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated”
Reviews.Author: ParisOkie
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Axel Hotel for several years, and this was the first time I returned since the recent renovation. They've done a beautiful job updating the rooms, expanding the rooftop terrace and enlarging the restaurant. The staff is always pleasant, friendly and helpful. Breakfast is plentiful and delicious. Don't miss Shimai on Thursday nights - the show is lots of fun and they are hilarious - even if you don't speak a word of Catalan! The new wellness center is state of the art with the latest equipment, and the aquatic center with jacuzzis, sauna and steam room is a great way to relax and unwind after a long day of work or sightseeing. They've also added an outdoor bar on street level that is a great place to have a drink before continuing on to the other local bars. The scene in the neighborhood is always lively and animated.

Reviews.Title: “just amazing”
Reviews.Author: JohnW64
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel. location great, staff helpful, spa facilities perfect, room comfortable. will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant experience”
Reviews.Author: Tariqmanchester
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel great,design,friendly staff and a pampering experience all in one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: denverflier
Reviews.Content: The Axel is a great hotel with a great location and staff that is very helpful. We arrived about 7:00 AM after getting of a trans-Atlantic cruise and we're able to get into our room early without any charge. The hotel is in a great neighborhood in one of my favorite cities! They bill themselves as hetero friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Kappa_Delta
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I recently returned from a trip to Barcelona and stayed at the Axel Hotel and had a great time. What impressed us about the hotel and our stay was... 1. Price....Hotel cost was reasonable and not overpriced compared to other hotels. 2. Location...Hotel location was excellent...access to the metro, restaurants, ATM's and major city intersections was ideal. 3. Staff...Hotel staff was more than accommodating and helpful. Staff was able to provide us great recommendations on where to eat, visit, what to look out for, etc. It was my fiance's birthday as well and Wim at the front desk helped to arrange flowers to be delivered for her. The rooms were typical size of hotel rooms and housekeeping always keep the room clean and provided us with extra towels and toiletries when requested. Everyone also spoke good English. 4. Customer Service....This is a lost art at many hotels we stayed at,however at Axel it was a staple. We've stayed at many hotels throughout our travels in the U.S. Caribbean (St. Kitts, St. Lucia, Jamaica, Antigua, Bermuda, Puerto Rico, Hawaii), Asia (Taiwan, Thailand) and Europe (U.K. Germany, France, Prague, Brussels) sorry for the list but we had to emphasis that we travel and stayed many hotels. By far the customer service experienced and exhibited at Axel is in our top 5 rankings. The only minor matter is the hotel did not have wash cloths. However, it was explained to us that wash cloths are not a common amenity provided.

Reviews.Title: “Everything and More”
Reviews.Author: brazil44
Reviews.Content: After extensive research, we decided on Axel Hotel for our stay in Barcelona. It was better than what we could have imagined. Everything on their website was accurate. The staff was extremely helpful. We arrived in Barcelona at 10:30am on an overnight flight from Fort Lauderdale. We got to the hotel at 12:30pm and although check-in was not until 3pm, they allowed us to go into our room. We had an inside room on the 7th floor. Although there was no view, it was very quiet. Later in our stay we heard another guest complaining because of the noise in his "city view" room. It was obvious the hotel just went through a renovation. The bathroom had updated fixtures and bed was very comfortable. We found the "Kitchen" restaurant in the hotel a bit pricey, even for Barcelona but there are several cafes and restuarants close by. As a matter of fact, most attractions are within walking distance. On the bottom floor of the hotel is a wellness center consisting of a fitness center free to hotel guests and a spa. The 7.50 euro charge to use the spa facilities was WELL worth it. I usually include both good and bad in a review but there really wasn't anything we could complain about. Axel Hotel will be first on our list next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, unfriendly, pretentious and expensive”
Reviews.Author: a1ex_e1
Reviews.Content: As a gay couple we welcomed the idea of a boutique, gay hotel which was heterofriendly rather than gay friendly. The idea of a gay hotel suggested that we could avoid having to endure children and enjoy a friendly, relaxing environment. The hotel was expensive but as it was going to be the last two nights of our holiday we thought we could splash out. The hotel turned out to be a cross between an expensive knocking shop and a gay sauna. Certainly it was not designed for heteros or couples. It is where rich men go to meet other rich men for sex or spoil much younger men. Being simply a gay couple who had come to see Barcelona and use the hotel for accommodation was greeted with some surprise from fellow guests. The roof top pool is no more than a few inches deep and is somewhere to be seen by those relaxing on sun loungers rather than something to swim in. There is free internet (Gaydar is the norm), the rooms are very nice (complete with signs to hang on your door indicating that you are reading & waiting for sex), the food though expensive is good (particularly the breakfast) but the staff are just appallingly rude. The nicest member of staff we dealt with was the manager who checked us out. Everyone else seemed to have an uncaring, obnoxious, superior attitude almost begrudging the fact that you could afford to stay there. For the same price we could have stayed in a 5* branded hotel and I really wish we had. We both felt completely out of place and unwelcome. The atmosphere was oppressive. It was a major disappointment which I would not want others to endure.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: Kayem26
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location for exploring Barcelona on foot, close to the Gaudi Buildings 10 minute walk and close to Las Ramblas (10 minute walk). The hotel is a gay hotel but is hetro friendly. This wasnt mentioned on the website that I booked the hotel with, but this didnt bother us. The hotel has all mod cons and amenities. When we arrived the hotel had upgraded our room to a king size with a garden. The room was huge, spacious and clean. The mini bar had a great selection too. The hotel has a gym and swimming pool which is free to use, as well as a roof top pool and sun loungers. The Saunas and spa cost 7 Euros a day. I would recomend this to young travellers visiting Barcelona and I would hesitate in booking a stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Neukenuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 40th Birthday at from the 26th Feb for 4 nights. Stayed in room 605. Found that the room nada constant musty/damp smell that only subsided when I kept the bathroom closed. For the first 2 days of my stay I had free access to the wellness spa in the basement. When I went to go and relax on my birthday I was told that I would have to pay as there was a change of policy as the wellness centre no longer had a relationship with the hotel. There was no communication of this change when I checked in. It all ended up with a very uncomfortable exchange with the centre staff and ended up paying 7€ to relax to be constantly cross-sold at that point for massages, drinks, etc. The hotel should have managed this situation better and subsidised existing check-ins before 1st March until they left the hotel or advised customer before hand. Rooms were bright and very quiet. in room entertainment met with my requirements when used. Wifi was intermittent and sometimes very slow unless you were in the corridors, but free for the duration of the stay so not a real deal breaker. Mix of clientele was good though and relaxed. The day desk team were helpful with a smile, where at the person on the night duty always looked like he didn't want to be there. Jury is out if I would stay here again. Although I would have recommended it for the wellness centre.

Reviews.Title: “hotel manager is a lying weasel!”
Reviews.Author: FliegendeHollander
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at AH Barcelona during 2010 Christmas week. When we were checking in, I noticed that the lobby setup was a bit weird, with the ground floor below the street level. Once you get in through huge sliding glass doors, there is a small semi-circular landing with five steep concentric semi-circular steps down. On our second day, my partner was late for a bus tour so he ran up those steps but the doors never opened. He lost his balance and fell down the steps landing on his right hand and breaking his wrist. After spending the whole day at the hospital, we ran up some bills for the cast, medicines, support etc. When we finally met with the AH Barcelona manager Borja Julia Blanch, he admitted that, based on video tape of the incident, the doors didn't open in time, and that the hotel would cover my partner's medical expenses through their insurance which we thought was fair. Front-desk person made copies of all medical receipts and doctor's papers, and we left satisfied thinking the matter was closed. A week or so ago I contacted him wondering about our arrangement, and, to my total surprise, he basically negated the whole deal saying that it was my partner's own fault. Needless to say, we are currently in the process of filing a personal injury law suit against Axel Corp. and B. J. Blanch.

Reviews.Title: “"Hetero friendly.....Gay trap"”
Reviews.Author: PTSHFrederiksberg
Reviews.Content: The Axel Hotel in Barcelona advertises that it's a "Hetero friendly" place. We visited the place a weekend in early March and expected a gay friendly atmosphere - but got disappointed, finding oue "superior" room in lousy conditions with balcony doors that didn't keep close, a non-existing Wi-fi connection in the room on the 6th floor (despite lots of promises from the staff), a guard in the so called wellness department who didn't allow us to get in (but who focused on that slippers were mandatory) - and finally a delayed breakfast Sunday morning, where the servant who should open the breakfast buffet was so busy chatting with his private companion so he couldn't open the breakfast lounge before 08.10 - as he couldn't find the keys.... Axel Hotel Barcelona must be named a gay trap rather than a gay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding gay hotspot”
Reviews.Author: DORIANjake
Reviews.Content: Axel Hotel defines gay Barcelona with an outstanding location, stylish interior and superfriendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: usarmenia
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nicely appointed, though not so big though. Our room had an enclosed balcony with stained glass windows, which fronts the front of the hotel. It was very pleasant to sit on the balcony and take in the sun in the early morning before heading out. The king-size bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately, the hotel does not use mattress covers on the bed. We were a bit concerned by this for hygenic reasons. The shower/bathtub does need a grab rail as they are very slippery to step into. There were always plenty of towels and bath amenities. The shower had good water pressure ! The hotel has 2 computers at your disposition on the mezzanine level of the reception area. This would not constitute a true business center. There are no printers hooked to with computer. The spa area was very well appointed and extremely design. The pool on the rooftop desk was closed as it was out of season when we stayed here in December 2010. We did try the breakfast one day at 16 EUROS. It was adequate but a bit overpriced for what was offered. It is a continental style buffet menu with fresh juices and fruit, scrambled eggs, sausages, ham, cheeses, cereals, yogurt, and a hot beverage of your choice. We did not try the restaurant in the hotel for dinner. There is a bar as well on the ground floor. Typical trendy bar atmosphere and very smokey too as Spain did not start anti-smoking in public areas until 2 January 2011. Definitely worth a stay as the location is very good with bus and subway lines nearby. You can walk to many nearby shoping areas, restaurants and nightclubs. The neighborhood is quiet and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Design Hotel in Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanDiversity
Reviews.Content: The Axel is positioned as an open-minded design hotel in the Eixample district, one of the coolest neighbourhoods in Barcelona. The hotel is very easy to reach (just 3 min from Pl Universitat) and in the surrounding 6 blocks, you will find all kinds of restaurants, shops and everyday life (great mixture). The entrance hall is a cool piece of design, but unfortunately, the staff is a bit pretentious (based on what the place is supposed to offer ...? or why?). On the first floor there is a small business centre, serving its purpose. Most rooms are facing the streets or the crossing. Some are facing a courtyard (would not recommend those although the courtyard is quite cool). The upper floors offer more light, and bit less street noise (as always...). The roof-top terrace is super-cool and among the best in Barcelona (as it overlooks all surrounding buildings). There is a Jaccuzi and a pool up there, and a bar (in the summer). There is a new public gym and spa in the basement, run by the hotel, but guests will still have to pay extra (it was free this month). The Spa is not extraordinary, though. Breakfast is a standard buffet (what a pity) in a design room on the ground floor. Overall recommended place - along with other design hotels in the Eixample or the Raval.

Reviews.Title: “CORRECT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: johanbelgium1
Reviews.Content: good location, gay runned nice rooms nearby pl. Universitat ( airport shuttle)

Reviews.Title: “nice option”
Reviews.Author: PepeSolfri
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Barcelona increased in plasure with the stay in Axel hotel. Price/quality is very good. Nice to see some straights that feel to stay in gay enviroment confortably: we are not heterofobic!!! thanks god we did not finish to those terrible gay hotels filty, bad test and volgar! we had no shame to say : we stay at Axel!!! the hotel is clean, well disignes and confortable! staff is nice and friendly, cleaning lady (at list our) very busy to keep it nice! pay attention: not all rooms are the same. We were very lucky! to the direction of the hotel: please don't do like budget ariline to make pay all single services: interntent.. and like in the future the spa... then you will end like a hotel in Paris that charge extra the use of the shower!!!! better some euro more then keep the tresh in the hotel! giuseppe

Reviews.Title: “Dont Miss This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James62364
Reviews.Content: WOW, where do i begin... This Hotel is GREAT! I've stayed there twice in the past two months... I live the States and was on a business trip and thought i would try it out... and glad i did... I can't say enough good things.. Good people (STAFF IS CLASS ACT)..Actually times I stayed at this Hotel everyone greeted me by name and were very kind and helpful... I would recommend this hotel is anyone and have already... Thanks, it is time for me to head back to the States.. if I ever get back to Barcelona, The Axel Hotel will be my first choice of places to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Very good location for a beautiful gay hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Merllinn
Reviews.Content: If you don't want to take a taxi from the airport you shouldn't worry about the access to Axel Hotel. Just take A1 (from terminal 1) or A2 (from terminal 2) and get off at Universitat. The hotel is 300 m from here, a nice walk in a great city. Because it was not a very busy period and the hotel was not quite full we have been upgraded to a superior room, first sign for a great stay in this hotel. The room was very nice, it was a simple style we really enjoyed. The bed was very comfortable and I loved the pillows, we slept like babies :). I was a bit disappointed by the bathrooms, they were a bit in contrast with the rest of the room. The door from the shower cabin was not very clean and the floor of the bathroom had some spots of dirt on it, old ones that couldn't be removed. One of the best spots in the hotel is the SPA area, for me it was great. Jacuzzi, steam bath, dry sauna... they were all just perfect. I promise to return here during summer time so that I can also enjoy the pool and the relax area on the roof :). The breakfast room is not very large but it is cosy, breakfast is not huge but plentiful and very tasty. It is also a nice place to watch stylish men having their morning coffe. I can't leave unnoticed that there are many str8 people that are being accommodated at Axel, it was not bothering at all but I would have expected the place to be more like a gay oasis. This is not hotel's fault, you cannot control the sexual orientation of guests at the time of booking. All in all, my experience at Axel Barcelona was a great one, this is the reason I rate it 5 out of 5. And here I have to mention the very friendly staff (men and women) that were helpful and spiritual...

Reviews.Title: “VERY COMMERCIAL- loosing its gay market niche”
Reviews.Author: gapgu1
Reviews.Content: First Impressions: This hotel has recently been renovated clearly at great expense and is indeed trendy and modern inside. However noticeably the philosophy of the hotel has also now changed (compared to prior years) to one of pure commercialism -and that means large numbers of families with children and straight couples are staying - there much more than before. It is no longer serving the niche market it once claimed. Hotel Image: The hotel slogan of "hetro friendly" is now just a brand image - the reality is that as a gay guy with partner i felt overwhelmed by the number of hetro families with children. Staying there: Generally clean comfortable and pleasant - everything the hotel used to be. However my advice is get down to breakfast early before the choice from the buffet rapidly diminishes! They also played loud pop music in the breakfast room which included lyrics containing a range of 4-letter swear words! Nice! Wellness Area: Parts of the the new 'wellness' area were (already) being repaired during my stay and were out of use. When open again, the Wellness area was relatively empty except for hetro couples. The wellness area is regularly monitored by staff to ensure everything is in order. Overall: The hotel continues to offer high standards and trend setting design. However if you stayed at this hotel in prior years - you will now notice the difference. We are not sure if we would want to return.

Reviews.Title: “good location but needs imporvement in many ways”
Reviews.Author: arkoudaki
Reviews.Content: i stayed there twice in the last 4 weeks and paod over 1200 euros. I was hoping to see little things happen that would make my stay special. No kettle in room which is a must in the rest of europe, the staff argue with you if you point out something because they take it personally. the internet never works NEVER and when you tell them they come up with some lame excuse. i wasnt offered breakfast at all as part of my lenghty stay especialy one morning when i had to wait 4 hours to check in its 16 euros and overpriced. Also what was shocking is that at the end although at bar the coffee was cold and cost 2 euros at check out they asked for the 2 euros.....please... th

Reviews.Title: “Gayest Hotel In BCN”
Reviews.Author: TrottingDr
Reviews.Content: Service was lovely, decor very gay, contemporary and chic. No free wireless internet and no bahtub, which i desperately needed after several days of unjust abuse at the hands of the spanish authorities. Staff at lounge bar was very friendly. Despite the nightclub style athmosphere at the ground level, the room was very quiet. Location is ideal. Rooms on the smaller side. Price is well worthit but when i wanted to rebook for August, their rates were exorbitant and we decided against it. Overall i loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fully deserves its star raiting”
Reviews.Author: brianTManchester
Reviews.Content: Situated ideally (University Square) for the Metro and the T2 Aeport bus (5.05 euro, don't know why it was this strange price) and within a block or two for most of the clubs and bars we wanted to visit in the gay example area, I have no hesitation in recommending this lovely hotel. No worries about the staff speaking English (although I used a few Catalan phases that seemed to go down well). We were immediately upgraded when we said it was out first visit (tip) into a very nice 'superior' room with a balcony. Some might say the street noise is audible a bit, but to be fair we hardly noticed it. There are smoking facilities on the second floor patio area and the bar downstairs was very nice with an outside (arch covered) smoking area as well. We also used the cafe across the road Lorenza (cheapest coffee 3 euros for two!!) and the staff were very friendly. We had breakfast in the hotel and it was just the same as any holiday hotel with hot and cold buffet, toast tea etc..(but a bit pricey, but I've paid the same/more in London 14-16 euros each.). Would I go back? yes. There are some hotels on and around the Ramblas, but I liked the stroll down into the Plazas (5-10 minutes) and I didn't feel as edgy as I did in the Ramblas area! I know the Ramblas is a people watcher area, but I wasn't sure the right people were watching me (be aware you will look like a tourist)! (nice to be a few blocks back). This time of year was quiet (good) and I forgot most of the shops close on a Sunday (good for them). Had a night in the Axel bar and it seemed to be popular with both gay men and gay women (which helped me enjoy it more). quite a few women coules staying thee at the same time from Manchester) Most of the people I met were only too pleased to help and didn't mind the fact I have virtually no Spanish (but if you can use French, that seemed to get me half way there). Like any city break a few days is not enough to to see everything, but we have used the tour bus (22 euros ish) in the past and it takes you to all the major attractions and you can hop on and off wherever you like. The Barcelona Card is pricey(not useable on the tour buses) and we used it this time and it paid for itself in reductions to the museums/art exhibitions/Metro and red public buses after a day (and you don't need to worry about buying tickets all the time). I read a few reviews before I went and I think they were mostly correct, but it tried to be plush and modern and I think it succeeds and for that you might have to pay a bit more than the lesser hotels. So in conclusion will I stay there again in September on the way back from Sitges..YES. PS(47 euro for 200 Malboro gold, might be just as well buying them at the airport now on the way back). Forgot to mention, go to the rooftop bar and be amazed with the style and views!

Reviews.Title: “all you need for a perfect stay in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: carlos1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very nice and comfortable one. And the staff is really friendly, well educated and allway ready to help. I think is a perfect hotel to spend ome holidays in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerry186338
Reviews.Content: beautiful rooms, great staff.I make 4 or 5 business and leisure trips to barcelona every year, and this is the best hotel I have found in the city yet. it is gay friendly, but I am not gay. still it will be my hotel of choice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed in better than the Hilton and apex hotels :-)”
Reviews.Author: UKRYAN
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff room was very nice and clean and location was fantastic for going out on the gay scene in Barcelona shall definitely be back to stay thank you

Reviews.Title: “So great I had to go back”
Reviews.Author: LagunaInnkeeper
Reviews.Content: Was in Barcelona for a Conference and was so happy with my stay that I decided to return after a weekend in Sevilla for a dew more days. Especially appreciated the slick bathrooms/dressing area in the deluxe rooms overlooking the quiet courtyard and the rooftop pool. Courteous staff, minimalist comfortable rooms, my only suggestion was larger soaps... and bigger robes as theirs have obviously shrunk. Was assured that they were working on it and based on their attention to details, I believe it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, well appointed gay hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: alastairsmith
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room on the 5th floor with a very comfortable king sized bed and great shower. We were at the front of the hotel but barely noticed street noise. Perhaps the room was missing a comfy chair and bin but the trendy decor and furnishings were fine. It was not the weather for the roof jacuzzi and pool but this hotel has the best location for the gay traveller to explore and shop!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: isleb0y
Reviews.Content: Amazing Hotel in Barcelona. Super friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are just spectacular. Bathrooms are beautiful. Jacuzzi and pool on the roof. gym center downstairs. Great bar and location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! (except closed minded folks, it is a Gay owned and run Hotel) But they truly are Hetero Friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Ayman69
Reviews.Content: Excellent for gay travelers because its central location and various services. The staff are very nice and helpful. The walls are thin so you might hear your neighbors. Cleanliness can be improved. In general, I give a positive review.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Cosy...the place to be in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Oeilaguise
Reviews.Content: When you enter this marvellous hotel, you get this "whoooaa" feeling. The service is really good, the rooms have great decoration and I particularly loved the bathroom with large rain shower and great dressing area. We had a standard room with a very nice terrace (2nd floor). The only very tiny negative side is that you might feel the subway passing under the hotel sometimes. We would not hesitate to come back again, at 3 min. walk from Universitat metro. forgot to mention the amazing rooftop terrace with a view on the beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Superbe”
Reviews.Author: Mogta
Reviews.Content: well equipped and stylish hotel with friendly staffs, convenient place. I recomment this hotel to other (especially gay) travelers

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Bonamis69
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, stylish hotel, superb service and facilities, the most friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “"Great taste in every detail"”
Reviews.Author: GiseleVerona
Reviews.Content: " Absolutely beautiful. Great taste in every detail. Beautiful people, staff very helpful, rooms very clean and the athmosphere is that of a modern and open - minded space.I strongly recommend...for everyone!!" Gisele and Lorenzo, Verona

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: SLB15
Reviews.Content: Location and design are very good. Cleaning could do a lot better. The suitcase we stored under the bed came out all dirty and full of dust. Apparently cleaning does not include under the bed in this hotel. There was also mould in the shower which we dont really find acceptable for this class of hotel. Window glass was dirty also. Heating did not work and we never got the room any warmer than 17°C which was rather cold in the evenings. We reported it to reception every day and they had somebody look at it but it did not get fixed during our 4 day stay. Lovely spa area downstairs, but overhere also some cleaning issues. Not a bad hotel, but they should get cleaning and service better organised. I'd like to go back if they get that sorted out, but as it was now it's not up to standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall”
Reviews.Author: GAlfaro
Reviews.Content: I travelled to BCN with my sister and stayed at this heterofriendly hotel and we had a great time. Service was great everyone went out of their way to make our stay a wonderfun experience. We really enjoyed the rooftop terrace, always filled with beautiful gay men and cool artsy people, great music oh and the food YUM so, so good. The Spa was great, specially after walking all day around Barcelona, the hotel is located walking distance from a lot of the tourist attractions and great restaurants. The bed was Super confortable and the room super sexy i recommend you stay there if you are single or if you are looking for some romantic fun with your partner. The ground bar has a very nice decor, oh and try to get one of the rooms with a stained glass balcony, i really enjoyed sitting there with my laptop or a book.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good price, could do some services better.. i would return.”
Reviews.Author: JohnCostelloe
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights in Axel, Barcelona.. This is my second time staying here.. It's a lovely hotel, prices was quite good - around 100 euros a night.. Great location, design, atmosphere.. Service is friendly and helpful but could be better in terms of local knowledge (restaurants etc).. Wifi was bad, constantly cutting out.. TV and movie charges are quite expensive. Strange for this hotel, the next room had a screaming baby. But thats not the fault of the hotel.. Overall, a good experience. I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Anytime again”
Reviews.Author: ceasar5
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay - nice hotel - good service - quiet rooms - good location

Reviews.Title: “Complete Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: comminsdaniel
Reviews.Content: We were really very disappointed with our stay at Axelh otel. We had booked the room several months ago, and after seeing many advertisements for your hotel in gay magazines such as Tetu, here in France, as well as exploring the website, we were really looking forward to our stay. Exterior of the building: The building is not illuminated like on the website. We did not recognize the building at all. Check-in: With the exception of one person, reception staff was depressing and stoic. No “hello” no “welcome”, no “thank you”, and certainly no smiles. More like a funeral parlor staff than a hotel reception. We were also informed that our reservation was lost. Room 302: Complete disappointment, to the point that we wondered if we had checked into the wrong hotel! The room was dark and unwelcoming. View from the room is on the rooms across the courtyard, at less than 10 meters, and absolutely no sunlight. There is no sheer curtain, only a blackout curtain, which given the vis-à-vis, we had to keep closed all the time. The “king size” bed was two single beds pushed together, and the sheets did not even cover the entire mattress. We found the wall paper and room decoration to be very outdated. The lighting in the room really needs improvement. Neon lights that either all on or all off make the room cold and very unromantic. In the bathroom, the toilet does not stop running and there is mold in the joints in the shower. The day of check-in, the cleaning staff entered the room at 4pm without knocking while we were in bed. At night, impossible to sleep because of the music from the bar. Overall, we feel that the hotel was missing so many thing that would have made the 105€ we spent on the room seem worth it. The rooms could be so much better designed and details would make it a much more romantic and enjoyable experience for a couple. Most hotels in the world are friendly these days, no need to go to a self proclaimed gay friendly one to get a gross room and poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwest_mail
Reviews.Content: Axel Hotel is a very stylish and well located. Check in was simple and we had no issues with noise as some others had noted. I was surprised at the number of hetrosexual couples as they seemed to outnumber the gay cliental. That is just an observation, not a complaint. The pool area is a great place to chill out after hours of walking around such a fantastic city. Our only real complaint relates to cleaning of the rooms. Most days we headed off sightseeing around 8:00AM and returned back around 4:00PM...of the 5 nights we stayed, the room was only made up once before we returned. I am not sure what the issue is there, but it was slightly annoying.

Reviews.Title: “over rated and over priced”
Reviews.Author: Mike_B074
Reviews.Content: How this hotel keeps on getting such high scores is mistery to me. Been here 4 times and always there's a problem with something. First time : construction works, noise, no pool, no rooftop solarium. Second time construction should have been finished but was not, so I ended up with same problems. Third time : construction was finished but work was going on on the wellness pool which was empty + lots of dust and noise from painting still going on in some rooms. Fourth time : all is finished but with rooms barely a year old there's mould in the shower, dirt under the bed, ... It kept me wanting to go back to see how it would be if everything was finished but it's getting worse. The so calles sound-proofed rooms here every noise from next door and if your neighbour watches TV all night you're not getting any sleep. How's that for soundproofed ?! Rooms next to the elevators should not count on much sleep either. Several days left the room at 9am and hung the sign at the door to "clean the room now". Got back at 4 in the afternoon and still nothing was done. The cleaning staff needs to drop their attitude and start getting service right. I could go on for a while but neither the quality of upkeep, nor the service justify the price you pay. At these prices service, facilities and cleaning should be perfect. I'd call it "a nice try" and than I'm being kind.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the center of the Gayxample”
Reviews.Author: vmmh
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for the gay traveler, it's walking distance to most gay clubs and shops. For those interested in more than nightlife, it's also very convenient to the Barcelona metro. We spent four nights in Barcelona and loved staying at the hotel. Wished we had used more of the amenities, but we were out and about the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “style, perfect service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: stievmunich_Germany
Reviews.Content: Definetely a hotspot (not only) for gay people! Friendly staff and perfect location. Rooms a little bit small but clean. Amazing roof terrace with swiming pool and whirlpool. Big SPA Area. Free Internet Access. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and will be back”
Reviews.Author: AaroninDublin
Reviews.Content: I was really really impressed with our stay in the Axel. The rooms and public area's have a real WOW factor and clearly alot of thaught went into the planning of the hotel. The staff were all really friendly and willing to advise on where the good clubs ect were and what times they got busey at. The hotel has an Axel card that gets you into some places for free which was a bonus. We got the room at a very good rate. There was a Halloween Party on in the main bar the night we stayed which was good fun. It did suprise me how many non-gay guests there were. When I visit BCN again I would defo stay at the Axel again And if I was in BA or Berlin I would also be happy to stay at Axel in those cities too.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: pelun
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10-15 September 2010 Axel suite #703 I must agree with most of the negative reviews of the hotel. I stayed at Axel few years back and thought it was a reasonable hotel. Good location and nice roof terrace. I imagined that after the recent renovation it had become something special, but, unfortunately, not entirely true. They added one floor where the new pool terrace is situated. It's much better than before, both during the day and at the evenings (especially Wednesday-Sunday parties). Where the terrace was previously located one floor below, there are now 4 new suites, which have very large terraces (apart from room 701 which only has a small terrace). The terrace was fabulous (ours was the corner terrace) with sun loungers, nice dining area and cool lightening. If it wouldn’t have been for the terrace, I don’t think we would have stayed so long! The suite itself was nothing to write home about. Cheap furniture and decoration. Thought I had walked into an IKEA store. Floors of cheap light pine look-alike material. Furniture similar light pine material. No decorations, and already bit of wear and tear. Bed was ok, but pillows hard as stone. The hotel does not offer any alternative softer pillows. No blanket for the bead, only the bed sheets which became a problem. The floor-to-ceiling windows were obviously a great feature and the curtains effectively blocked out all the light in the morning (and no disturbance from the traffic). But they didn’t block out the heat from the sun! So, around 10 in the morning the whole suite was boiling! The AC was by far effective enough. Some sort of remedy was to keep AC on coldest temperature during the night; with result we froze during the night due to lack of a blanket (only managed to get an old moldy blanket after the weekend). The bathroom was fine with a shower, bathtub and separate toilette, but the amenities were minuscule and there was no soap dish or anything else to place them in the shower. Most of the staff at the reception were really snobbish and not overwhelming enthusiastic. No help with the luggage. Concierge service? When? Think saw him most of the time during the evening parties on the terrace. The majority of the other staff was great and very friendly. Room service was good. Nice cocktails and food satisfactory, but nothing spectacular. The hotel had a great gym! Another stunning experience was on our final day. Our flight left in the evening. Since hotel wasn’t full we asked to keep our room. It was free of charge until 2 pm but after that we would have to pay 50% of the daily room charge. We asked if we could take a shower in the gym before leaving and it was ok, for an Euro 25 charge per person. Or we could, free of charge (how generous!), use the open shower on terrace next to the pool, and change in the toilette!! Oh my God! To conclude: I’m not sure the huge terrace in the suite can make up for the price the hotel is charging (in level with some 5 star hotels in the neighborhood). The evening parties on the pool terrace are in any case available for everyone, so would recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for friends to getway”
Reviews.Author: animalparty
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good value for money , i stayed in a few hotel's in Barcelona( mainly 5 star) and compared this hotel has very competetive rates , considering the hotel is of a high standard . The rooms are very nice , you can see in the shower from the bed , so don't stay with someone you would'nt want to see you naked . This is a hotel to stay in if you want the other person TO see you naked . My room had a lovely view of the Barcelona's streets and chairs in the windows of the room which i loved . The Jacuzzi on the roof is lush and the view is great , very romantic! Staff where lovely , however drink/food serving times .....were'nt open a lot in the day , however i did so in late season , so this could be why . At first when you arrive you may feel you're out of the way a little, i soon discovered how close to everything i was , i went for a wander and in 15 minutes found myself wandering into Las ramblas(and i was walking in heels ) Axel is in the gay district , which i found buzzing and friendly in the evening times, great stay for couple/friends The area is very authenic Catalan , good cultural experience , i would actually prefer to stay in this area than Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “No gay hotel any more”
Reviews.Author: dyava
Reviews.Content: Together with my partner we spent 6 days in the Axel Hotel seduced by the hotel's web page and some gay magazines advertisements. The best of the hotel is a location, in the very middle of gay Barcelona. But there is no gay hotel any more - the majority of the guest, they were hetero-couples, even some of them seemed to be surprised by the presence of some of the gay couples on breakfast. We had the premium room, and it was quite comfortable. But the housekeeping service - I would say - should be improved. Every day they used to forgot about something- fresh towels, bath towels, cosmetics, paper tissue, toilet papper, etc. Beware internet Wi-FI quality! The Wi-Fi network is very slow, and configured so badly that I can't use my Mac at all, and my partner Mac internet was very slow. The hotel's staff tried to convinced me that "must be something wrong" with my computer, but it worked perfectly with other wi-fi networks in Barcelona. I spent a lot of time fighting with the hotel wi-fi cut off from network for 6 days! So, to be honest, that is 3/4* hotel, not for gays not for business travelers as well

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but no duvet or blanket!”
Reviews.Author: burroontour
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here, booked very last minute so got a good rate. First impressions very good, trendy, nice furnishings in the reception and a bar, restaurant, spa, rooftop bar. We were given a standard room which was fine, nice to have English channels. This is a gay hotel and this is quite in your face in terms of room decor, pictures, a "please distrurb" sign to hand on the door etc. This was fine with me and my husband but might not be to everyones taste. Nice shower, nice modern decor in the room. The reason for my low score is the lack of attention to detail to have a pleasant stay. There was a lack of hangers (3), no robes as advertised, one pair of slippers, no WiFi. On the bed were just sheets, we put up with this for 1 night but it was October and I was cold so my husband asked on the 2nd day if we could have a blanket. I had assumed we were meant to have one but they'd forgotten, this wasn't the case, the hotel didn't have any! They managed to find a single, rather dirty duvet, but this is meant to be a luxury hotel, very strange. It's a shame as if they sorted this out (I'm not the first to complain) it would be a nice hotel. We didn't use the bars (rooftop closed in October) or the spa but everything looked nice. The area is good but we generally preferred the location and the hotel we stayed at next - Room Mate Emma so will stay there again on our next stay.
