Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room made for a pleasant off-season stay”
Reviews.Author: amturnip
Reviews.Content: Good about the “Axel Premium” room: A fabulous little balcony, with two chairs, table, and electric socket, enclosed by stained-glass windows that opened for a breeze, overlooking a typical Eixample 8-sided streetcorner. The room was bright by day (big window in addition to the balcony) yet very well insulated from street noise and light at night. Recently renovated, great bed, good climate control. Practical, no frills, easily-cleaned surfaces. Good about the area: Blocks from Passeig de Gràcia, but not overrun by the bad element that follows tourists. Plenty of food around on the two cross streets, ranging from groc shops serving locals, to super delicious dainty pizza slices, to sit-down evening tapas. Nice walk to the coast. Stylish shopping. “Fun” notes: Mirror outside bathroom was angled for a view of the shower area. “Please Disturb” door tag could invite other fun-loving guests to your room. (I did not hang it.) The bad: I had a good stay - The bed, the windows, the fabulous balcony made up for the hotel's flaws. But these were numerous. Malfunctioning internet. Cleaning staff ignored the “L” door tag and serviced other rooms before mine. “Barcelona City Card” rate did not include the card itself, but rather a voucher that I failed to redeem because I would have had to wait in line a long time in the tourist information dungeon, and I preferred to cut my losses and just go out and be out in the ambient.

Reviews.Title: “good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: ferdinando70
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a prime location for gay life. Any gay clubs, bars, restaurants are within a stone throw. I was in a standard room with a very comfortable double bed overlooking an internal courtyard. no views at all, but i didn't spend much time in it anyway. my friend and I enjoyed a very sunny weekend in the roof terrace where there is a very sweet swimming pool and Jacuzzi. A nice touch. Forget swimming, it's just to have a dip and relax in the sun lounge. The gym is well equipped for being just a hotel gym and the sauna/steam room is also a plus. Buffet breakfast was nice as well on a eat as much as you like basis, usual things, bacon, egg, bread, jam, fruit, fruit juice croissant and so on. Major disappointment are: - you have to pay to get Wifi: for the kind of hotel it is, or it pretends to be, you would expect to have internet access included in the price (I think it was something like 6€ a day or something like that). I think that nowadays it should be part of any basic hotel service. there are 2 computers with free internet access in near the reception area, nevertheless i would have liked to check my own things in my room. you can also access internet through your tv in your room for another 8€ every half hour (is that price for real?) - Bring your own shower gel. What you will find in the bathroom will be just enough to wash your face and the microscopic soap bar seems a reminiscence of a Barbie doll accessory pack. I was travelling just with my hand luggage and with the liquid restrictions in the flights, i thought that what the hotel bathroom kit would be enough! i was wrong! - I don't understand if the guys at the reception were just laid back or they genuinely did not care about you. be prepared to pass by the reception being completely unacknowledged. Upon check in I have just been handed my room key and i had to sort myself out, the guy didn't even bother telling were my room was. No that i am an idiot, i could work it out myself, but please make an effort. having read the reviews in advance i was kind of prepared to all this, but still hoping to be surprised. apart from these minor hiccups, the experience has been very pleasurable and i would come back. The USP is that it is a luxury gay hotel, but for the same price there is much better

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: sylrob2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights from the 6th to 12th September. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room we had faced the inside corridor and while there was no view we did have a very quiet room allowing us to sleep peacefully every night. The rooms are tastefully decorated although the modern touches sometimes lacked practicality. For instance, nowhere to put your soap and shampoo in the shower, the telephone located under the headboard and easy to knock over in your sleep, a very small bar of soap to be shared. But these are minor annoyances. The roof top bar and lounge area was wonderful. After a long day of visiting the city it was great to come back and enjoy and drink and soak up the roof top view. We would go back to the Axel in a hearbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best choice in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: atlken
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively around the world and am always concerned about finding the 'perfect' hotel which incorporates the highest levels of guest services, hotel deisgn, in a location convenient to area attractions as well as safe, and at an affordable price. It is rare to find a hotel that is successful at incorporating all of these - The Axel Hotel does so in a hugely successful way! I loved being able to easily walk from the hotel to all parts of the city we wanted to visit. Very convenient to La Rambla, Sagrada Familia and even a great walk all the way to the port/beach. From the exceptionally friendly staff, beautifully appointed common areas, extremeley modern/clean/comfortable rooms, breathtaking views from the roof-top pool and bar, to the 5-star services offered at the gym and spa, this was a gem of a hotel and I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “I've never felt like such a special guest in such a fine place, and each guest with whom I interacted shared my sentimen”
Reviews.Author: GeoffreyfGreene
Reviews.Content: If you go to Barcelona, stay at Axel. The staff are ABSOLUTELY amazing. From the front desk to each of the bars and everyone in between, the service and the attention were as good as it gets. Our room had amazing sunlight, ample space, super-comfortable bed/bath/shower, and great views and enabled us both to sleep like babies. The location cannot be beat. I felt more like a guest in someone's home than a tourist at a hotel. In addition to the impressive staff, the hotel itself was stunning and so very comfortable. The pool was great, the restaurant service (and entertainment) was top-notch, and everything was within steps of the front door. Considering the actual accomodation, the staff and the location, there is no other place to stay in Barcelona as far as I am concerned. I'll return for another visit ASAP. THANK YOU AXEL HOTEL for such a great experience in Barcelona!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: roadjackNY
Reviews.Content: I was shocked to read the negative reviews of this hotel. Everyone at the front desk was polite and efficient. The superior room was fantastic! I requested a room with a glass terrace and was thrilled to be able to get one because there is a limited amount. It really made the experience top-notch. The room was well appointed, yet minimal. The size of the room seemed large by European standards. And the rooftop pool and hot tub were great after walking around the city all day. It is a bit of a scene—everyone checks you out as you walk through for the first time. But once you're sitting in a lounge chair enjoying the sun with a gin and tonic in your hand, who cares? Some people have objected to the hetero-friendly slogan, but I thought it was a nice way to acknowledge that it's a gay hotel where they welcome straight people. Although it is primarily gay, there were a few straight couples there. And that was fine because some of my best friends are straight. Would definitely stay at the Axel again!

Reviews.Title: “Above the call of duty”
Reviews.Author: blokebling
Reviews.Content: we were greeted by two friendly and helpful staff at the desk, wim and Ricardo. slight problem with our superior room so we were 'Upgraded ! ' for the three nights of our stay, we were pleased. The sky bar is exciting with roof top relaxing bar that serves coctails with a smile and local spanish and hotel residents mix on seats or loungers together. the jacuzzi or pool on roof and georgous views over the city are awsome..why this hotel is not five star like others i have been in i don't know?. the basement has a 'Wellness center' whith giant plunge pool jacuzzi,steam room,heated tiled loungers and full size new gym with large changing rooms. this is first holiday in ages where i enjoyed exercise because of the faculities. Finally i can say i would enjoy this hotel nearly as much as the beautiful city i stayed in :) Paul and Andy

Reviews.Title: “Grea location but disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: FerWorld
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel after our gay cruise ended in Barcelona. The location was great but the service was disappointing. We waited for almost an hour in line for checking in. They should have predicted the arrival of this gay cruise and reinforced the check in desk personnel and room cleaning. Our room had a really bad bed, a few small towels, and a tiny soap bar, among other poor amenities. I could have lived with this, but worst of all, it had dirty floors and corners. Breakfast was expensive (more than 15 Euros) and poorly served - I should have gone to the Starbucks 2 blocks away :-) The free wireless connection was terrible. To be fair, I want to mention 2 nice treats: the day of our arrival they set up a small welcome brunch in their bar, and a really effective luggage room to leave suitcases before the check in - but these were just for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Gay Luxury Boutique Hotel: sadly an oxymoron. When will "gay" hotels become more than a glorified bathhouses?”
Reviews.Author: ekraepelin
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the Axel Hotel, after completing an all gay cruise of the Mediterranean. We were familiar with the hotel and its location, having stayed at a nearby location on previous trips. The convenient location is one of the best things Axel Hotel has going for it, as well as the hotel's roof-top deck. Unfortunately, the hotel management doesn't appreciate what makes a truly fine, boutique hotel .... and I personally resent the "hetero-friendly" ... i.e., gay ... target audience being an excuse for poor service and amenities. Yes, the hotel has some things going for it ... but multiple little things became quite annoying ... such as 1) one very small bar of soap per room, slightly larger than a postage stamp, which is fewer and smaller than the two condom packages conveniently provided (had to ask for more soap, though I noticed condoms were replaced readily, without having to ask) 2) absence of any blankets or bedspreads (had to ask twice, before finally going downstairs to main desk to request one, which was provided reluctantly) 3) only two smallish size bath/shower towels per room (which were harder to come by than the large beach towels on the sun deck) 4) sporadic, infrequent availability of a concierge to make dinner reservations, even during the daytime 5) tacitly facilitated cruising areas... If you're looking for a gay experience, and can tolerate the attitude and inconsistent service and amenities ... this spot may satisfy please you. If you are not youngish and gay ... or if you're an experienced traveler who looking for something more than a trendy, glorified bath-house, skip the Axel ... and stay at one of the nicer hotels in Barcelona that understand how to satisfy and indulge a traveler.

Reviews.Title: “On The Whole, Really Good”
Reviews.Author: KiwiWithWings80
Reviews.Content: Aside from a checkin hiccup, we were very impressed. OK, so we arrived at 1pm, slightly early, but were not able to be checked in until after 6pm. Now this was dealt with by appologies and a promise of free cocktails, so the attitude was good, but the inconvenience unforgivable. The hotel is a beacon of style and chic. The rooms are minimal, well designed but fabulous - very spare but comfortable. A terrace bar with pool and lots of eye candy, although the patrons are representative of most shapes colours and ages. Not cheap, well located and we would sooooo stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “As always very nice, beautiful and relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: Zueriman
Reviews.Content: Title says it all... Not the cheapest hotel, but to recommend for people looking for quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Wrldtvlr27
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with great staff, clean rooms, and nice location.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best located hotel for culture, food and fun”
Reviews.Author: Scipiothello
Reviews.Content: I particularly appreciated the spacious premium room with its balcony and nice view on the street. The king bed was comfortable. The general atmosphere is festal and put you in a ggod mood.

Reviews.Title: “happiness”
Reviews.Author: CAIOMEN
Reviews.Content: nice experience cool people trendy place Beautiful guests Best localization Portuguese spoken

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Staff...best gym”
Reviews.Author: TravelTop
Reviews.Content: Great value, cool-hip-room- big shower -cool amenities-loved the view. Early check in wasn't a problem. Service was really good. I witnessed the front desk guy Wim speak Spanish, French, English and German to 4 consecutive guests in line. Really helpful on recommendations, directions. Best piece of advice in navigating around the area is Barcelona is on a hill. I just remember to "walk up" when I got lost. The hours of their restaurant- and many businesses in Spain for that matter was kind of confusing. Some closed during Siesta, some opened late- some never opened. Oh- the Fitness Center was fantastic- it was a real He Man Gym- not some tired old treadmill in the corner. and get this..it was open to MIDNIGHT!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: maurieh
Reviews.Content: I´m staggered by any bad reviews of the Axel. I´m checking out tomorrow after 4 great nights. The rate was reasonable, the room fantastic, and the staff were friendly, informative and never seemed phased even with some language difficulties. The facilities are wonderful, from Sky Bar to the Spa, and it´s location, great...or everything...gay or not. enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Hotel has gone downhill.”
Reviews.Author: eddie6684
Reviews.Content: Hotel Axel has always seem ill prepared for their business, but we put up with it because of the location, but this last trip was the worst and our last visit to Axel. Front desk staff is too busy and rude to customers. Hotel was dirty. Room was worn down and much overpriced! $430 Euros? Was originally going to stay several days, but checked out after one night and went up the street to Hotel Cram which is MUCH nicer with friendly staff and calm atmosphere Price for a BETTER room was only $130 Euro a night! Also, I read on another review that the guests found bed bugs in their bed and we were also bitten by bugs in our room! This hotel needs an upgrade all around. More staff with better attitudes and upgrades in rooms. Will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, not value for money, bad attitude by some staff but great location”
Reviews.Author: Gary197336
Reviews.Content: On arrival the helpful receptionist mentioned that there was only 1 room available at my grade which was quite dingey so he was upgrading me to the rennovated wing and an upgraded room. I got to the room but was bitterly disappointed. I would love to know who the interior designer was as it was awful. An interior facing room which was therefore quite dark with vile looking gold wallpaper (bad taste!) bare walls other than an undersized flat screen TV. It felt claustrophic with no character whatsoever. Room service was not 24/7 and menu was limited. When I called for room service one morning, the waiter said he would bring down the breakfast when they got a moment as they were busy...not the sort of response one expects from 4 star hotel. Also no tea/coffee making facilities. Roof top terrace was impressive as is the basement gym and sauna/steam but hotel of equivalent standard (Crane hotel) around the corner was Euro40 cheaper per night with a much better designed room that included a balcony. On my last day the shower was luke warm (I did move the temperature gauge several times to see if it would make any difference). I mentioned this to the receptionist on check-out and he suggested if there had been a problem other guests would have also complained . As he hadn't received any other complaints there obviously wasn't a problem - WRONG ANSWER...improve your customer service. This was my second time at the hotel - first time 2 years ago before the refit. Sadly this will be my last time as I do not feel I was getting any better service, standard of room or customer service than a similar hotel around the corner which was 40 euros cheaper!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel, mixed experience with front office staff”
Reviews.Author: nmedh
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, and very very nice location, some thoughtful facilities. Some of the staff (mainly front office staff) are very warm and helpful, while a couple of them were quite rude. I would like to recommend Paulo (I am not sure I have spelt his name right, but he is from Portugal) Hotel upkeep is something they need to look into. The first room I was alotted had several problems (TV remote not working, aircon not working). I was eventually given another room. While this second room was much better, on the last day of my stay, the electric system in the room kept on tripping. It would go off every few minutes. I complained to the front desk but nothing much happened. Strangely, the room cleaning happens at 4pm. So when you are trying to wind down/ have a siesta after a long day walking around, in comes the chamber-maid! Also, the rooms do not have a tea/ coffee kettle - unheard of nowadays! Guys, you can learn a lot from Asian hotels

Reviews.Title: “Great location friendly staff if you are good looking”
Reviews.Author: MichaelELee
Reviews.Content: Thankfully I am good looking. Nice location, roof deck has great atmosphere at night with bar and music Overall a nice well priced hotel with good environment

Reviews.Title: “got bigger but not better”
Reviews.Author: Gsquard
Reviews.Content: After the renovation/expansion works hotel got bigger, staff is still efficient, 4 elevators still working, the only thing i hated was a tiny and narrow swimming pool on the roof terrace. The terrace (sun deck) itself is nice, plus there are two bars there (open to public every evening of a weekend). They were continuing some minor improvement works - so it was noisy sometimes. Definitely worth 110 EUR/nigh, but not 170 :)

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS!! Terrible, terrible, terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Heichdhu2010
Reviews.Content: Our stay started well and we were greeted by a lovely receptionist but that's probably the only positive thing I've got to say. Generally the staff were incredibly rude and aloof. It was like we were putting them out when asking for anything. You didn't feel like a customer. There are no umbrellas on the roof terrace so unless you want to be fried by the sun you can't really go up there. On Monday nights the roof terrace is closed so you can only have a drink in the downstairs, dark and dingy bar. What's the point when it's lovely upstairs? We went to the new W hotel for a drink instead which is gorgeous. Stay there instead. It was an awful experience and I'd never want anyone else to experience it. Try and book somewhere else. I promise you'll regret it if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: MisterD78
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days days at the Axel Barcelona hotel. We found out very quickly a few things: First, the location is absolutly great, near Gracia and Rambla and in the heart of the gay area. Second, 3 of the 5 days we spent there were drilling and banging noise just above our heads. Third, the staff wasn't always pleasent, especially after we got angry about the answers we recieve after complaining about the noise. Fourth, in 4 of the 5 days staying there, there were towels missing in the room, from no towels to only one large one. This in no service for the money taken for staying in the hotel. BTW, breakfast is far too much expensive. Better eat on your own in the cute small caffe around.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Zocordat
Reviews.Content: Given the usual standard in Barcelona, the price for what you good was reasonable. Unfortunately I could not make use of the terrace and pool as renovation work was ongoing. Early morning construction noise was also heard from the patio where my room was heading to. Location is very good. I made use of the fitness room as well.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: Matt873
Reviews.Content: Bits of this hotel are good - the rooftop pool area and bar - and bits are only just acceptable - the rooms, in particular. Starting with the good bit, the pool area on the roof is sunny, well used and with great bar service (the lady (Naomi) who serves up there is very friendly and service oriented). The rooms are a let down - admittedly, we checked in early and probably got the worst room - but we had an internal room with a view of a light well covered in metal, there were no blankets on the bed, just sheets (what is that about?) and the room was very small. Servicing the rooms was a bit hit and miss - we left the "please make up room" tag on the door at 10AM and the room was not serviced until 4PM meaning that we had to camp outside until it was done. The restaurant was acceptable for breakfast, but the buffet was pretty basic. A 3.5 star rating would probably see this hotel out.

Reviews.Title: “Awul Hotel ....”
Reviews.Author: AGS11
Reviews.Content: After staying here 2 years ago, a group of us decided to go back... what has happened t this once great hotel. We were never told about any construction work going on, the pool was closed, no gym and no roof top bar... The staff didn't seem concerned when complained. We checked out on the 2nd June and the hotel was no where near complete... We were also told no work would be done over the weekend which turned out to be false. Ifyou can cope with drilling in the floor above, below and outside from 7am till 6:10pm then stick with your booking. Much nicer hotels in Barcelona for a much better price. Over-rated and another hotel which thinks gays will pay over the odds. Won't be rebooking agan

Reviews.Title: “DESPITE THE CONSTRUCTION, I LOVED MY STAY AT AXEL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LA_FilmGuy
Reviews.Content: While not surprised, I'm a bit dissapointed by all the negative reviews Axel Hotel has been getting since reopening earlier this month. I myself was one of the first - if not the actual first - guest to check into the hotel when they reopened on May 5th. Yes, construction was apparent and, yes, all hotel ammenities were not readily available (pool, bar, spa, etc.) but all of this was made very clear to me by Axel Hotel before my arrival at the hotel. That said, I don't think it's very fair to damn the hotel for the ongoing construction. Other reviews here may chose to, but I certainly won't. As for the hotel itself, I was very impressed. I spent a total of 6 nights at the hotel, the first of which was spent in a room a bit to close to an active construction site. I brought my concern to the hotel staff and was immediately upgraded to a street-view room with a balcony overlooking the beautiful city street. Was I happy? Of course I was. The room was spacious, clean, stylish, and very modern. I couldn't be happier... or so I thought. The next morning I had breakfast in Kitchen, the hotel's restaurant. I was thoroughly impressed with the spread - fresh rolls, meats, cheeses, cereals, yogurts, fruits, juices - you name it, they had it. (Breakfast was included in my package deal - I was charged in error a couple times, but I'm confident this will be rectified by Axel when I contact them.) Later in the day, I requested some ice in my room. A few minutes later one of the hotel's staff (Anthony I believe his name was - very nice young man) arrived with ice... and a complimentary bottle of champagne. Who can complain about this? Not me. On another occasion, I mentioned to the hotel staff that I would have liked to have used their gym had it been open. They quickly provided me with a free day pass to a nearby health club. I went and was very satisfied with the facility. Fast forward a few days later. I was having a conversation with Anton, a very nice young man working the front desk, and I had explained to him how my iPhone had been stolen from me while walking around Barcelona. Low and behold, he told me that an iPhone had been found at the hotel and, much to my surprise and gratitude, I had my much needed phone back in my possession. I could not have been more grateful. Overall the staff at this hotel was amazingly competent and hospitable. I was especially impressed with Ricardo and Anton who assisted and advised me on several occasions throughout my stay at Axel Hotel. I also had the pleasure of meeting the general manager - he, too, made made stay at Axel a very pleasant and memorable experience - despite the construction and lack of ammenities available. Would I return to Axel? Of course I would. Would I have liked to enjoy the rooftop bar, an elevator ride to my room, or a day at the spa while staying at the hotel? Well, yes, of course. But let me tell you, Axel did more that I ever expected to meet my needs while I was a guest at their facility. My recommendation to everyone here is this - give this hotel a chance - you won't be disappointed. Great staff, great location, and, if you're lucky, great memories too! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable visit”
Reviews.Author: Universal10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, room was really nice very comfortable bed and large tv, food was excellent quality in the restaurant. This place will be much better when the renovations and the pool are all finished, still worth a visit, staff are very helpful and its great having other Gay travelers if you need some fun!

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: CHABLEU
Reviews.Content: I was there begining may, the hotel is under construction, dirty, not finished but high price for the rooms, noisy. I dont recomand to go there before its finished. But the location is very good middle in the town. A few things were also wrong in the room : broken bar and no glass, no hot water in the washbasin, anly one towel. Good bed and nice breakfast. And no lobby and toilets for the customers. The hotel wants to be trendy and design but its only a shine, this is not enough, for the price you need more service.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, under delivered.”
Reviews.Author: AnyangMan
Reviews.Content: I wish I could write a positive review about this hotel. I was persuaded by many of the reviews on here to book this hotel, and was greatly looking forward to my trip. Unfortunately for the first three days of my hard earned break I was booked into a four star hotel 20 minutes walk away from all the action. This was because their refurbishment works went over schedule. When I did finally check in to Axel the building works were still going on. It was like Fawlty Towers...Workmen (not the sexy type unfortunately) were banging everywhere. There was lots of noise and building dust. Lifts weren't working. Pool/spa area was off limits. Women were running around everywhere trying their best to hoover up. You get the picture. It was all a bit farcical. I was a disappointed bunny. A couple of other gripes...ordinarily you have to pay for internet access in your room. (I was generously let off). When will hotels get the fact that this is a huge irritant for people who are already paying a hefty amount for the privilege of being in the hotel. I just don't understand how hotels can charge for this simple service. C'mon guys - wake up and smell the coffee. The mitigating factor is that the staff were pretty helpful (especially the very cute lad who humps bags all over the pace - he should be a Colt model). I could see in the faces of the staff that they knew the hotel had opened too early. They were making the best of a bad situation. Although they were too professional to say, I think the blame for my poor experience lays with the managements for: a) not project managing the refit properly, b) greedily opening up shop even when the work wasn't finished. I mean, hello, do you think paying customers are stupid? It would have been nice to receive proper compensation for my inconvenience eg: a five star hotel would have been better than a four star, and an automatic upgrade to something fantastic on arrival in Axel would have been the least that could have been done. I have to say I could have got something much better in Barcelona for what I eventually paid. The overall impression I'm left with is of a rather amateurish business that doesn't deserve to charge the rates they do. To put things right shouldn't take much. A bit of leadership is all that's needed. You should also be aware, fellow traveller, that this is a city centre hotel, with all the accompanying car noise right outside your window to enjoy. The rooms are okay by European standards, but North Amercians will indeed find them pokey. And as usual for Europe, there's no coffee machine or kettle in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: QguyLB
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel easy to locate after being dropped off at the main square from the Aerobus. The reception checked me in quite early in the day without any issues, and upgraded my room upon arrival which was a nice surprise. The room was nicer than expected, with a small balcony and a nice view of the streets below. Yes there was construction noise, but I was so tired from my over night flight from the states, I fell asleep without any problems and never had a problem napping during the day. The bed was fantastically comfortable. The restroom was adequately large, and the shower fantastic! I found the location to be excellent for seeing sights of the city. I never tried the hotel bar or restaurant, but did see them busy at times during my 5 nights at this hotel. Overall a great experience at Axel Hotel, and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “it's like coming home - friendly, comfortable, central - that's why we're regulars”
Reviews.Author: Gaudifans
Reviews.Content: Always better to go for the superior rooms which look out in two directions and perhaps a higher floor though we don't notice traffic noise. Do ask if you want a bath as most rooms have showers. The rooms are spotless, perfectly maintained and minimalist but with all mod-cons / TV internet access, loverly robes, slippers and bathroom goodies. beds so wide you could swim across and linen (and pillows) we like so much we're thinking of asking for a tip where to get the same. The Axel often does deals - if you get on their mailing list you can get great packages with a big discount including on the great buffet breakfast. On this visit, the hotel was about to close to extend into the building next door and to refurbish the rooftop spa - pool, gym,hot-tub, wet and dry sauna - and bar area. When they re-open with quite a lot more rooms we are expecting to find the place busier, yet still with time to be welcoming. We've been coming for years. We never stay anywhere else in Barcelona - it's our ideal base, from the airport, and to all the places we like to go. We've never done a review on Trip Advisor before, but we often read them and use them to guide us as to where to stay. It seems only fair we make an effort to leave this genuine review in thanks as we have found a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with the hotel, location good, building work going on roof top bar closed with sauna and jacuzzi,”
Reviews.Author: bigmark16
Reviews.Content: found hotel eventually, good location, room quite small seen online that roof top bar was closed also sauna and jacuzzi wasnt told this by the staff who i must add were very helpful, had to pay to get internet in the room and any free tv channels in english kept loosing the signal, quite dissappointed with the few days that i was there

Reviews.Title: “Gay boys would love it!!”
Reviews.Author: xxxdarren
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Axel Hotel 3 times, Stayed in Suite to Standard Double rooms, I love this hotel in every way. There are lots of gay bars and restaurants near the hotel open very late so you don't have to walk around with a map in a new city. Have fun in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sjtl1000s
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very polte from the moment I was greeted after a long trip from East Coast of USA. In fact, the politeness was consistant throughout my 4 day stay. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have slept in at any hotel including 5 star places. I went on to Madrid for 4 nights and spent the time wishing I had stayed the whole time at the AXEL in Barcelona. I was at the AXEL in Berlin during the summer and hope to visit the one in BA someday. AXEL is GREAT and my companion was equally as pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly design...”
Reviews.Author: DeJ1
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is wonderful and the Axel Hotel is one of the best places to stay (gay) when you would discover the very nice city... Friendly Staff, nice design, ... typical Barcelona !

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel gay friendly very well situated in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: guysguysguys
Reviews.Content: Quality/competence of the staff Nice atmosphere Just one negative aspect : due to works in progress, some noise, spa a little bit too reduced, and the lack of a frigo in the room For these reasons I consider the prix paid a little bit expensive (I can understand also we were in the new year period

Reviews.Title: “better and I expected”
Reviews.Author: Todd2PS
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and was ready for a nice hotel. But, I was still impressed. The rooms while small by US standards were immaculate and well designed. I especially liked the "organiser" where I was able to stash everything. The bedding was great, and the goodies in the bathroom useful. But, the real pleasure, and not to be missed, was the buffet breakfast. I know that at some hotels there are huge buffets, but it was the quality of the food that was so impressive. The baked goods and the ham were two of the best things. The roof terrace is currently under reconstruction. But, the small gym and hot tub were open. I was actually pleased with the inside room. With traffic into the early hours I appreciated the inside. There was still construction going on, but they didn't start until fairly late, and I kept the window closed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: derekzoli
Reviews.Content: All perferct. I can't deny I was a kind of worried when I read that this was a Gay Hotel as I am not gay and I was giung there with my wife. Of course this was a stupid fear, everything was nice, service was just great and rooms too. Position is perfect: most of the sights are at a wolkind distance. If I come to Barcellona again I will for sure stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: iandonoghue
Reviews.Content: We had a brilliant time. The staff were great - the rooms were fantastic and the service brilliant. Over all a really great place that we will be heading back too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and extreemly friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: EnglandFaw
Reviews.Content: Position of the Hotel was perfect for our city break. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Rooms were clean and well serviced every day

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: excalibur_2006
Reviews.Content: The Axel Hotel is in a very good location, only a short walk to many of Barcelona's interesting districts. There were many local restaurants in the neighborhood, many of which were quite good, especially Restaurant Canela about 300 meters from the hotel. The hotel staff are very nice, very helpful and multilingual. But that is all the good news there is. The room -- at least mine -- was terribly inadequate, spartan to the extreme with the only good feature being the bed. It actually felt like a cheap sex hotel when in the room -- no place to sit down, no surfaces on which to put anything, a silly wardrobe, 2 uncomfortable plastic chairs, and a bathroom that when in the shower 3 cm of water ends up on the entire bathroom floor -- a severe safety hazard. The street noise is constant and loud. The head maid was very intrusive, never waiting more than 2 seconds before barging into the room -- very unwelcome and unprofessional. The breakfast is NOT worth the price. Go across the street to the little cafe for better food at 1/4 the price. The bar is ok, modern and trendy. The lobby nice. But, all in all, this hotel is kind of a black-eye for the gay travel world. I would never recommend this hotel nor will I ever stay at it again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and clean”
Reviews.Author: max360
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay in this well located hotel. The room was simple and clean. The room safe was large enough to store a MacBook Pro 15" with accessories and personal items. Wifi is available at a low additional charge. There is a rain shower with a handheld as well. The free bottled water was great. If they should ever want to add anything, I would suggest a small refrigerator. But it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Gwendalondon
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely wonderful hotel; delightful and friendly service, beautiful rooms with sauna/ steam/ jacuzzi on the 7th floor and fantastic roof terrace. We come to Barca a lot and ALWAYS stay here! Within walking distance or short tube ride of everything; I never need to use public transport when I am in Barca it is the best city to walk around. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. At the moment they are expanding so there is a certain amount of building noise and the roof terrace is not open.

Reviews.Title: “Best location....”
Reviews.Author: schildpad2003
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, on a great location with very friendly staff. Nice room, nicely decorated, just a little small and to bad there was constructtion works on the other site of the window, but hey, it's Barcelona, there is always work to do...I would surely recommend this hotel to everybody who travels to Barcelona. 10 minutes walk from Catalunya square and Ramblas

Reviews.Title: “Leaping Ahead: Axel Barcelona Defines Hospitality in A Creative Way”
Reviews.Author: Parlonny
Reviews.Content: I was completely won over by Axel. Right from the moment my companion and I sauntered through the glass doors of the main entrance-which are enclosed in a beautifully appointed façade, to the time we regrettably had to say our farewells, we were whisked away into a world of complete bliss at the hands of our hosts. The interior is quite welcoming—a simple reception counter within a cozy lounge and acceptance/waiting area, and a restaurant (Kitchen by Axel) and bar (Underground by Axel) off to the right. The design is decidedly modern (trendy, yet nuanced with elegance – sort of W-esque), and the staff, who tend to be versatile in their disciplines (can sometimes be seen shuffling between bar and restaurant) couldn’t be any more delightful. Rooms are located on floors 1-5 and suites on the 6th Fl and are mostly garden or street (with terrace) views. These are accessible by elevator—or, for the more athletically inclined patron, a staircase is also at your disclosure. You’d also be happy to learn that there’s a pretty decent gym on the very top floor as well. For those who prefer to lounge on holiday—or maybe opt for a little bit of wellness, Axel is equipped with SPA essentials—Jacuzzi, steam and dry sauna and, a swimming pool on the roof deck. Though, don’t expect to do laps here and, if you happen to be visiting in non-summer months (as I was) the water may be a little chilly as the pool isn’t currently heated. Get online if you have your laptop w/ you by having wi-fi connection activated in your room (€6 for 24 hrs) or feel free to jump on one of the terminals located on the second floor—gratis. Also, If you’re dehydrated after a late night out (let’s face it, you most likely will be after indulging in Barcelona’s nightlife), fret not, Axel’s got well stocked (with bottled water) refrigerators on each floor where you can help yourself to some H₂O for free. For the romantics, breakfast can be served in bed (place your order the night before) or if getting out of bed isn’t too much of a bother [insert raucous laughter here], Kitchen serves breakfast (buffet style—continental and hot for €16 per guest) till 11 AM daily. Overall, it’s a very impressive and comfortable establishment for all – and very aptly and conveniently located. A point to note: Though one may immediately surmise (guilty as charged) that this is a gay hotel, all are welcome. Beyond the open reception, staff members can be seen donning T-shirts with the slogan, ‘hetero friendly’. Tip: Need more information on what to do/check-out while you’re in Barcelona? Ask the extra helpful front desk staff, they’ll be happy to give you some pointers.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: meganvee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Axel is centrally located, a few blocks from a metro station, walkable (albiet a little long 15-20 minutes) to la rablas and passeig de gracia (restaurants and casa mila). It is near the gay bars and has a good coffee shop across the street. The staff is amazingly pleasant and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and modern. There is free bottled water on every floor that was always stocked. The bar downstairs is good for a drink while waiting or a night cap. We didn't try the restaurant, but it looked ok. The rooftop pool and hot tub are small, but a perfect place to relax. The rooftop bar was closed for the summer. Great hotel for the value, would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most pleasant accomodation one could expect from a Festival!”
Reviews.Author: Pallidaluna
Reviews.Content: Staying in Barcelona a few days as guests of a Film Festival couldn't have been more easy, pleasant, relaxing, than at the Axel Hotel; friendly atmosphere, nice people to have as an hotel's staff. Thanks again, Ricardo and colleagues!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: aadder
Reviews.Content: We had a superb stay at Hotel Axel. It is by far the nicest gay accommodation we've stayed in. All the staff were so friendly and took plenty of time and trouble with us. Good facilities and food; really interesting and smart decor. Some of the bits and bobs (like need a bit of TLC to bring them properly to good condition but this is a minor point. I would recommend this hotel very very much, for couples both straight and gay. We will definitely return. Lovely place! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Libertate
Reviews.Content: Third visit to Barcelona but first time I stayed in that part of town. Everything is walking distance. Loved the staff, rooms were modern and clean, be it sparsely furnished but that's fine with me. Will definitely return to Axel on any future trip to Barcelona and eager to check out there other locations. Wifi was available for a very reasonable 6 Euro a day though reception was spotty in some areas.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Mahecasa
Reviews.Content: I was wondering how could be this hotel so I booked only one night to test. I must say that I've found a very good place in town with good staff, friendly attention and guests were also willing to speak and share conversation. Definitively, I will come back

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: vervegirl
Reviews.Content: We were in Spain for 10 days and this was my favorite hotel. The staff at the front desk was very kind and accommodating; my only critique would be that they didn't seem to have many recommendations for restaurants in the area. One of the guys recommended 2 places (with so many great eateries in Barcelona this seems low), the other guy we asked recommended a place for paella that didn't serve paella. The room was very clean. We had no issues with noise coming from other rooms. The street can get loud if you open the balcony door, however with it closed you hear nothing. We had a huge shower, which was a welcome change after 3 hotels with very small showers. There was no minibar, which I would have liked, but they had COLD free water for guests on every floor. The location was great....we counted several gay bars on the same street as the hotel...and it was a 10 minute walk to the metro station. Also, as a bonus there is a grocery store across the street, which comes in handy if you want a cheap snack. All total...we loved it and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Knowledgeable friendly service + great location = wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: MLoCDo
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. The staff were very approachable and knowledgeable of local restaurants and night life. They spoke wonderfully patient English to our broken Catalan/Spanish and were always willing to accommodate with suggestions, maps, and directions. The breakfast was a great way to start off your day and had manageable hours. The rooms were a nice size with a comfy bed. We were upgraded at no extra charge and so our bathroom was quite spacious. Everything was clean and well kept. There was a lock box in the room for valubles, a nice rack to hang clothes, and we had a lovely juliette balcony overlooking the street. We ordered internet for our room one day and had problems and the front desk immediately fixed it for us. The upstairs lounge/pool area was nice, although the jacuzzi was broken for a couple days while we were there (but again was fixed quickly). The clientele was generally a bit older than us (us being 26 and 29); I would say mid 30's to 40's and lots of north americans. Had a chuckle: rooms come with door signs reading "Please make up room.", "Please Don't Disturb." or "Please Disturb" as well as complimentary water in a fridge down the hall, maps of local gay vendors and restaurants, condoms and lubricant. Don't get me wrong though, this did not come across as a shady hotel, just pleasantly cheeky. {:O) Some minor (and I mean minor) problems; there is contruction going on next door so that was a bit loud at times, but ear plugs are provided and I ended up not really using them since it was a minor disturbance. The upstairs lounge Sky Bar seemed nice and had a cool "atmosphere" being outside and open to the Barcelona sky, however, the drinks are rather expensive compared to other local bars. The decor in the room was very functional but a little lacking on the style and character, and the toiletries were a bit cheapish - only mention this cause airline lost my luggage. I was booked into a massage as a gift, and although the guy was nice, the massage was expensive and wasn't great, if I'm being brutally honest. And lastly, the internet station was slow and a bit unreliable, although very useful for planning the day! The hotel also provides a very up to date selection of night life flyers, some of which offer discounts on the entry fee to clubs. We were also given free entry to one rather expensive event from the front desk one evening. Overall, this was our first "gay hotel" experience and it was really excellent. The staff really made our stay fantastic. The hotel is right in the heart of the gaybourhood, as well as minutes from the metro. Any minor problems we had were immediately resolved and the other little stuff was really nothing when you realize where you are; beautiful Barcelona! All in all, a really great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: scottyb72
Reviews.Content: The Axel Hotel was a pleasant place to stay for a few days. The front desk staff was pleasant and friendly. The superior room was comfortable and clean and the housekeeping staff was wonderful. The closet can be improved that is for sure. One perk was definitely the free bottled water available in the hallway on each floor. Bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: rebucfan
Reviews.Content: The Axel hotel offers and excellent location, and at times excellent value if you get a good rate as we did. The staff is very responsive and they were very helpful guiding me when my passport was stolen in a subway by a pick pocket. Ricardo at the front desk and Mireia at the bar are two jewels that the Axel should pride to have in their staffs! We had the pleasure of meeting the hotel proprietor Juan Julia at checkout. He was very personable as well! We highly recommend the Axel hotel for gay travelers, or hip heterosexual couples.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, gay, well-situated”
Reviews.Author: MtlMcCann
Reviews.Content: Attractive, modern hotel with large, bright rooms. Very well located to shopping, metro, gay bars, restaurants. Tiny pool on roof more to sit around and tan than to swim, but a nice chill-out area with a bar. Free computers a plus. Helpful multilingual staff. Had bad construction noise our first night (apparently ongoing through 2009-2010, next door) but were quickly switched to the quiet side of the hotel. Request room on quiet side and facing the street... you get a bit of a balcony and a nicer view.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing would be the highest star I would give - zero stars”
Reviews.Author: upnadam12
Reviews.Content: If you like mold in the bathrooms, dirty floors, poor food in the resturant as well as over priced, a dirty sauna and steam room...and not to mention the blood that was found on the comfortor on the bed...then this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JW_1000
Reviews.Content: Hotel Axel is very clean, quiet, has excellent facilities, friendly staff and an excellent location in Barcelona. Cocktails at the welcoming roof bar were an added treat. Breakfast in bed was good value too. Every time I returned to Hotel Axel at the end of a hard day sightseeing or lazing on the beach, and glimpsed its balconies and stained glass exterior I felt proud and excited to be staying there!

Reviews.Title: “With a little more effort, it could be a terrific gay boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DouglasNYC
Reviews.Content: A sophisticated gay traveler expects a higher level of service and accommodation than this "heterofriendly" boutique hotel provides. Overall, I commend the owner for filling a niche market and my experience was acceptable. However, the "smoke-free" room reeked of smoke and there was no staff to circulate through the hotel at night to pick up leftover glasses on the roof terrace or from room service. The roof terrace is a terrific amenity yet, inexplicably, there was very limited bar service and the lighting was horrific. Though they advertise "free wifi"--it is available only in the lobby with the purchase of a cocktail. You must pay an additional 6 euro for wifi in your room. Free wifi should be included! With a little more attention to detail, it could be a terrific gay boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “AXEL is an "I certainly want to come back again hotel" ;-)”
Reviews.Author: gretawasgay
Reviews.Content: A Light and modern hotel in the best area of Barcelona. Friendly staff, very good service and clean. The poolarea on the roof was very relaxing.;-) ...The room was exellent...slept like a queen...;-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, Great location, Average service”
Reviews.Author: dmhinsf
Reviews.Content: Service from the front desk was somewhat below what one would expect from a hotel...I think I expected the staff to be more gracious. The same was VERY true of the service in the hotel restaurant "Kitchen" at breakfast. The staff was cold and indifferent. The property itself is nice and the room was crisp, clean and nicely furnished. The housekeeping service was VERY slow every day I was there. Sometimes I would go out and come back late in the afternoon and the room still had not been serviced. The rooftop bar/gym/pool was quite a nice feature with views of the neighborhood buildings and rooftops. The gym could use some repair and some more equipment. The WiFi was not reliable. The location was convenient to everything including Catalunya square where a lot of touristy things happen. The hotel is also close to public transportation. Of note, the hotel mis-directed me to an Aerobus stop that has not been operational for a few months (since July) on my last day. This made me trip back to the airport much more of a challenge than I anticipated. Finally, when I checked out at 6am, I had not had coffee and was barely awake and the front desk agent INSISTED that I could not check out without completing the evaluation form. The hotel is gay friendly which is a nice feature and caters well to the gay traveller in terms of facilities, informational resources and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Gay centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: FrankiBergen
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel. Staff is very polite, and make your stay as nice as possible. The only downside is that the breakfast is not 100% ready at schedule in the morning, and that the breakfast is not served before 08 in the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “AXELent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nikolas_gr_a
Reviews.Content: I like very much the situation and the hole hotel . I didn't like the the locker in the room (very nice but I prefer a closed one) . Room service telephone, never answers . Very good hotel but expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Geebee305
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Axel Hotel several times and find it to be such a great place to stay in Barcelona. The location is close to gay bars and clubs, although it is also within walking distance to shops and places of interest. The hotel is always clean and comfortable, the rooms are very tastefully decorated. Restaurant on the premises is first class, for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The rooftop pool and bar is a good place to socialise with fellow guests. Perhaps one of the best features of the Axel are the staff who are always so helpful in dealing with any queries or advising places to visit. Overall I rate this hotel very highly and would have no hesitation in recommending to friends or relatives. I look forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A nice "package" all around!”
Reviews.Author: vbkurutza
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend at this hotel. It very much lives up to what the website claims. STAFF Friendly, efficient and professional. We even spied the owner taking drink orders and chatting to hotel guests. They are a great team! ACCOMIDATION Nice sized room, very clean with fresh towels and luxury bath products. Can’t ask for more of a central hotel. And we love the free water bottles – why can’t other hotels pick on this keen idea. AMMENDIES Roof pool/bar is great fun and the best spot to relax after a day out sightseeing/shopping. The main bar is cozy and fun; the bartender is cute but can also make a rather good cocktail! Breakfasts were a treat with a large selection of local and healthy choices. On our next trip to town we most certainly would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice gay hotel; a little shabby”
Reviews.Author: robjeffdc
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, modern hotel that any gay traveler should consider. It seemed a little run down; perhaps no longer worth the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “TOTAL Satisfaction!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nateairnj
Reviews.Content: The feeling of genuinely being welcome at a hotel is the only thing that describes walking through the doors at the Axel Hotel. I had the pleasure of staying here for 10 days, and enjoying everything that Barcelona had to offer. From the friendly greeting, to the amazing benefits card, the rooftop pool/Jacuzzi & bar, to the stylish rooms…the Axel is truly a gem in the heart of the city! The friendly vibe that the staff exudes flows right to all of the people staying at the hotel, and makes for a memorable stay. The multi lingual staff was very detail oriented, and went above and beyond the call of duty to ensure my stay was very nice. I was greeted each day by my first name with all of the front desk staff. All of the printed materials and discounts that come with staying at the Axel were a vast surprise. The local area around the hotel was very nice as well. There are many fun and quaint shops on the same street as the hotel, as well as very festive bars, and eateries! As a young traveler (25), I feel the Axel took care of all of my needs, and then some. As a Miami beach native, everyone brings music with them to the beach. An amenity that was very invaluable was the portable iPod speakers that you could loan at the front desk. I’d also occasionally stay out late partying and having a great time, and was never interrupted by housekeeping early in the morning. There were a variety of shows that brought in many locals to the hotel, which was exciting. Is the Axel hotel pricy, YES! That said, looking back at all of the offerings, the Axel was well worth every Euro!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: swimmer3Paris
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel with a great staff

Reviews.Title: “Very modern hotel catering for all types”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller02
Reviews.Content: Couldn't really fault this property. Our room was a corner superior room and well worth the few extra Euros, the roof top splash pool whilst small is enough, breakfast was great and also well worth doing. Only downside was that the roof top bar closes at 5.00pm on Mon and Tue - which happened to co-incide with our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel -- I Will Return”
Reviews.Author: ChuckNYC
Reviews.Content: The Axel Hotel has been rated by some magazines as the world’s best gay hotel. That certainly may be true. It also would win plaudits as a mainstream hotel. Its location is terrific – in the midst of Barcelona’s vibrant gay area, but also just a 5-minute stroll to the great shops on the Passeig de Gracia, to the Plaza de Catalunya and to Las Ramblas. Other colorful sections of Barcelona are also within walking distance. The Axel’s rooms are spacious (I had a Premium room, # 406, with a small balcony, an alcove framed in stained-glass windows and a very comfortable bed). Air-conditioning is powerful, as is the shower, while the double-glazed windows keep out the street noise. Its breakfast buffet is excellent (though there are several cafes within a block’s walk, if you’d like a simpler breakfast), while its dining room serves a very good dinner at a reasonable price. The roof terrace offers delightful views of Barcelona, as well as a bar (serving snacks at lunch and in the evening), dipping-pool, sauna and fitness room with more equipment than that found at larger hotels in Spain. The staff is friendly and very helpful. Greatly appreciated too is the refrigerator on every floor stocked with bottles of cold water – at no charge. No charge also for the two computers, offering 24-hour Internet access. On this, the Four Seasons, Ritz and other luxury hotels have something to learn from the Axel. Bottom line: The Axel deserves its plaudits. I’ll definitely return when I return to Barcelona – and if I visit Berlin or Buenos Aires, I’ll surely want to try the Axel hotels in those cities.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Comfortable and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: SFSquirrel_94114
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 nights at the Hotel Axel in their Junior Suite (rm 612) and it was excellent. The bed is comfortable and the bath area was well supplied. The best part of the suite is the sunroom/terrace. A great respite from the heat of the barcelona. great location to nearby bars and the front desk staff (Vim and Andre) were excellent and helpful. The rooftop deck is a great place to relax after running around the city. Note - one drawback of this room 612 is that it is next to the service door to a staircase. I let the staff know that the door slams everytime a staff member used it - so hopefully they'll fix it. Also one cleaning staffer seemed to not understand that hanging the "Privacy Please" sign on the door actually means - don't bother. Isolated incident I hope.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: markusinmiami
Reviews.Content: The Axel is a bit overhyped...while the fridges with free water in the hallways and the roof top are fab, the rooms are fairly basic and one can probably get a better deal in the city for the same money. Plus, there´s construction next door, so we were woken up at 7.30 am each morning. If you want to be in the heart of gay Barcelona, stay there but don´t expect a 5star experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Past its Prime”
Reviews.Author: CreateSF
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Axel hotel, room 608, the Axel Suite, July 12th through the 16th. The location couldn't be better. The staff, for the most part, are curteous and friendly, at the front desk. The wait staff are another story, especially in the morning. They just seemed to want people to eat and leave. Aside from the great location, and the room, overall was great, but very very expensive (350 euros a night). There were some significant problems though, just be aware: 1. small issue, but issue non the less when you're paying 350 euros a night for a hotel. The first night, we realized that they had neglected to give us a blanket or duvet for our bed! I called and asked them to bring one up, quickly, as it was late, and the front counter person said that this would be difficult as there was no one to watch the desk. I explained that for what we're paying, he could perhaps call someone. He did, but delivered a duvet for a double bed, not a king size. The next day, we received the correct size duvet; 2. In the morning, they are not very good about replenishing the food in the buffet area. Additionally, there were constantly flies all over the breads and the fresh fruit...it really did make you want to skip eating; 3. Every morning, there was a problem getting hot water. Our last day there, it was impossible. We complained and they said that there were 5 rooms that so far reported it and they were working on it. 5 rooms! We were leaving within the hour, so couldn't wait for their resolution; 4. The most significant and irritating was when they opened the roof deck to the public. It was awful. I was trying to use the jacuzzi, steam room, and sauna to sweat out toxins, and here were all of these gawkers, taking photographs, pointing at myself and the two other people in the jacuzzi!!! And, there was no one supervising these people. It felt violating and invasive. And, when I went into the steam room, at one point, two men came in, who were NOT guests...fully dressed, and they were doing drugs just outside the steam room. I opened the steam door and caught them and asked what they were doing, and they lied and said that they couldn't get cell reception elsewhere...funny, they weren't holding mobile phones. Lastly, the straight folks were going into the only bathroom in that area, 2 and 3 at a time...also extremely suspicious. And, when I retreated because I had had enough, to my room just one floor below, there were people in the stairwell fooling around! I immediately called the front desk to complain. The man was very apologetic but said that there was nothing that he could do, that he was sorry but they couldn't really supervise people on the roof deck as they were understaffed!! The next day, I met with the manager, who couldn't have seemed more disinterested. I said that they should CLOSE OFF areas of the roof deck with signs indicating 'espacio de huesped, strictemente prohibido entrar'....(guest area, strictly prohibited to enter)...or something along those lines. This was a Wednesday night - open to the public, and just an awful experience. I loved our room and view and location...but service, excluding front desk and maid, were awful...just awful. I recommend Hotel Cram, one block away, and just beautiful. It's not a gay hotel, but for what we got at the Axel, who cares!? I would rather stay in a straight hotel that's gay friendly and have a proper experience, rather than a gay hotel that's straight friendly yet treats its gay guests the way we've been treated for centuries...second class.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price, decent gay hotel”
Reviews.Author: David-Iain
Reviews.Content: Rooms quite spartan and minimalist. However beds comfortable and the rooftop bar though small was very nice at night to go for a drink. Nice hotel just not amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Fooled by the Trendy Facade”
Reviews.Author: MattPJ1971
Reviews.Content: Although the Axel has been written-up in a number of publications, the facilities did not live up to expectations. Our room was small and very noisy (from construction next door). The facilities were not well-maintained, and this was especially true of the fitness center. Members of the hotel staff were always very friendly and willing to assist with directions and recommendations. However, there are better hotels available at lower prices.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't bother...”
Reviews.Author: My_great_odyssey
Reviews.Content: I'm a gay traveller and stayed at the Axel in June and have also sampled the Buenos Aires Axel in the same month. By definition, the Axel Hotel's "Hetero-friendly" catchline leads you to expect a friendly, potentially quirky-flamboyant, yet sincere, well meaning lot. Hotel Axel proves that there still exist the pretentious who give no attention to your basic requirements whilst simultaneously have an air of entitlement to your hard earned cash paying their wages. On a basic level, it took over an hour and 3 phone calls to get the missing TV remote control to my room. Another call got the WiFi (very grudgingly) activated. There is no baggage assistance, which makes things rather sweaty on a 38 degree celsius day with over 30 kg of luggage. The rooftop area you see in the pictures is actually a rather creaky facade and not somewhere you'd willingly risk your travel insurance exploring. The lift is synchronised with Halley's Comet as when you push the button you typically wait 75-76 years for the lift to arrive. Then, when it comes time to bask in the air-conditioning and pretend it's 18 degrees, there are no covers for the beds (just very basic sheets) - I had to improvise and use the pool towels as a duvet cover. All of this makes me feel like a "niche traveller" who is getting taken for a ride on a donation train. Had the marketing been in-line with the experience I wouldn't have minded, but the hype leads you to expect something much better. Finally... The carparking... Please, don't bother using the "Axel Carparking". It's not their own service and it's about a block away from the hotel. I was abused by the carparking attendant for using the Axel-supplied parking voucher and they wouldn't release my car. I'm still struggling to reconcile the event and the logic involved. The resolution was to pay a 25 euro "fine", at which point I checked out of the Hotel. Although the carpark was in no part affiliated with the hotel, one does expect such an establishment to at least vet the services that they either endorse or sub-market. The best points are the location and the bar tender who knows how to make a good drink. I do recommend the cocktail menu as the accuracy of preparation and the method used are tip top. They have quite impressively inserted possibly one of spains best cocktail bars into their establishment. Please note, this is based purely on the QUALITY of the finished product. However, DO NOT expect the cocktail service to be prompt or to receive a smile, Gracias or Thank You in the process, but do expect something to offset (but not negate) the rest of the experience. Caveat Emptor!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMax
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Axel for five nights in May/June 2009 and we both really liked it. The staff was goodlooking , friendy and helpful. Our room (# 407) was a little small, like most European hotel rooms, but very clean and comfortable. I especially liked the large glassed in shower. We ate at the restaurant one night and the food was quite good and not too expensive. The hotel is in a nice neighborhood within walking distance to many of the attractions of Barcelona. There are many good restaurants nearby as well as gay bars. My only complaint was that the rooftop bar was closed in the evening. The desk clerk said it would open as of June 1st (we arrived on May 31st) but it remained closed. It would have been nice for a cocktail before dinner but there is another bar downstairs. I expected more of a "cruisy" atmosphere but most of the guests (including us) seemed more interested in seeing the city, rather than hanging out at the hotel. I've stayed at gay hotels in various cities in the US and none compared with the Axel. We plan to visit Argentina in December and we will definitely try to stay at the Axel Buenos Aires.

Reviews.Title: “Best Gay Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thairose
Reviews.Content: I booked the Axel Hotel via Expedia at the last minute and got a great deal at about $100 per night for a single room. When I arrived at the hotel the front desk staff was so nice and upgrade me to a deluxe double with the outside view of the city. I was surprised at how modern the decor was since the building looked old from the outside. The room was comfortable. The only complaint is for the closet which is a set of metal shelves open to the room so you can't hide any of your personal stuff from view. The great thing is free bottle water from the fridge in the hallway. I wish all hotels do this. The pool and spa area on the roof was nice. However they should have people to keep it tidy at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs, Bed Bugs, Bed Bugs!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pkadance
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived very early on our check in date and asked if the hotel could hold our bags until we could check in. They agreed and stored our luggage. Upon return to our hotel about four hours later the lobby next to the front desk was full of luggage. We checked in and received our keys for room 302. We entered our room and I checked the bed for signs of bed bugs, as I do in every hotel we stay in, and found nothing on the mattress. Fortunately I looked up and saw that the top of the head board was covered in little black spots. This is the first sign of bed bugs! The black spots are actually the blood droppings of the bed bugs after they feed. I quickly told my partner not to touch anything! I proceeded to the other side of the bed and saw on top of the head board, just inside the crack, a huge bed bug just waiting. My partner proceeded to get the trash can liner from the bathroom and pushed the bed bug inside of it. He then killed it and we went down to the lobby to check out. We explained to the front desk that the head board was infested with bed bugs and we gave him the liner containing the bed bug and blood. He told us he could send housekeeping to the room but fortunately I know that this would do nothing. We demanded our information back and told them to cancel our reservation, and we were assured that we would not be charged. Of course the manager was not there. We found another hotel to stay in and try to enjoy our stay in Barcelona. Unfortunately now our bags must be steamed and cleaned thoroughly so that there is no chance of the bed bugs entering our home because of all the bags it came in contact with in the lobby of the hotel. And to add to the horrible encounter at the Axel Hotel room 302, they charged us for the entire amount for our weekend stay!!!!! Are you kidding me? We have now contacted the Axel Hotel and its manager, Juan Julia, and have demanded they credit us. If you have stayed at this hotel and found bites on your body and thought to yourself, you must have been bitten by mosquitoes, better think it through! We were scheduled to stay at the Axel on May 23rd and 24th in room 302. If you or anyone you know stayed in this hotel and defiantly if they stayed in room 302 please tell them to check there luggage and there homes for signs of bed bugs! We told the hotel not to book this room, but you never know!

Reviews.Title: “staff extremely rude”
Reviews.Author: jimtotravel
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel the afternoon of May 7, 2009 with my partner. We told the front desk clerk that we were staying in another hotel but would like to consider the Azel on our next trip. We told the clerk that we had looked at the web site and we asked if someone could show us the pool, the bar and a typical room. The front desk clerk said "Everything above the first floor is off limits unless you are a guest.." He flatly refused to show us anything and then went about pretending to be busy. I wouldn't stay in this hotel if the room were free!!! This is supposed to be a gay boutique hotel, not much gay friendly about it other than the gay flag out in front.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: renotahoe
Reviews.Content: We just got back from seven nights at the Axel Hotel in Barcelona. We enjoyed our stay very much. The room is clean and the furnishings nice. The bedsheets are the kind that stay on. The staff was extremly friendly and helpful. The location is great. The bars are near by and the La Rambles is not too far away...an enjoyable walk. Lots of great restaurants nearby. We will be back. Barcelona is moving into my top three destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonySI
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several gay hotel and this is the best by far. Clean, Classy, Full Service and an unbeatable location. The staff were helpful, friendly and very attractive as well. A nice rooftop pool, jaccuzzi, sauna and steam room and gym as well as a bar. Walking distance to everything you could want. Nightlife, metro, Ramblas. I wouldn't stay anywhere else when I return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific urban gay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rickpw
Reviews.Content: I have traveled quite a lot, and have stayed in "gay hotels" in many places. I don't know of any urban gay hotel that comes close to the Axel. I only wish there was a gay hotel this nice in New York, Paris, San Francisco, Chicago, London, Rome, or any other major city. (This same company has opened an Axel Hotel in Buenos Aires and in Berlin; I have not visited either of those.) Most times gay hotels are a huge compromise. The Axel is sophisticated, modern, well-located, extremely clean, well-appointed, and a perfect choice. The only gay accommodations that might rival it are the best properties in Palm Springs and Fort Lauderdale, but they are not urban hotels and for a different purpose. I stayed at the Axel for five nights, April 4-9, 2009. My room (their most basic one) was plenty nice, the bed was great, the bathroom very nice. It had a king sized bed, and the space of the room was admittedly small, but since I was staying there alone, this was not a problem. It was no smaller than most city hotel rooms in Europe. If you had two people to a room, you might consider an upgrade to a more deluxe and larger room. The rooms are soundproof. The only noise you hear is coming from outside (some construction, which is completely beyond the control of the hotel, of course). The staff is great. They all speak English. (I am American and speak no Spanish or Catalan.) They are happy to give any kind of advice asked. They'll tell you about sightseeing or where the underwear party is that night or whatever. The restaurant is very good. I ate dinner there twice and found the food to be pretty sophisticated. The rooftop bar area is great. I can imagine that in warmer weather it would be a terrific hangout. The pool is lovely but small, but it's just for cooling off, not doing olympic sized laps, after all. There is a jacuzzi, a small but adequate gym, and a small sauna and steamroom. For a hotel this size, the amenities are unusually good in this regard. The wireless internet in the room was cheap by hotel standards (6 Euros a day), and was fast and worked well and reliably. (Not the case in many hotels, I have found.) If you are traveling without a laptop (I had a laptop with me), there is internet available for a charge in the room with a keyboard that works with the TV, and also a business center with internet available free of charge. I was told by the staff that 90% of the clientele is gay. I suppose some broadminded straight folks would stay there, maybe to be in a place where children are unlikely. The location is good, a 10 minute walk to La Rambla, and a shorter walk to the metro. I took the Aerobus from the airport and back to the airport, and it was a short walk each time to the bus. (Note that the drop off point from the airport is not the same as the pickup point. The hotel staff can explain this.) There are gay bars and shops very close to the hotel. This is definitely in the gay section of Barcelona, but the gay presence is a little more toned down than in Chelsea in NYC, or Boystown in Chicago. For men interested in such things (I know you're out there), there is a sauna nearby (Sauna Casanova) that seems to be the best attended in town among many choices.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel....great location...and...”
Reviews.Author: jdieringer
Reviews.Content: This centrally located hotel is in easy reach of many of the attractions and shopping of Barcelona. Near the Universitat metro station which is a central business/commerce hub. Nicely appointed rooms with a good restaurant, a marvelous breakfast, a bar (a nice place to meet others) and it even has room service. Clearly, this is a gay hotel even though they say they are "heterofriendly". The pool, hot tub, sauna (wet and dry) are on the roof and offer a place to relax and meet people.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Love”
Reviews.Author: AllanGrandRapids
Reviews.Content: This trip was planned as a last minute surprise for my boy friend. We have both visited Barcelona on our own but never together and never seemed to find the time. We both unexpectedly got time off work. I contacted the hotel and was suprised by their friendly and quick response to my request. They helped plan our entire long weekend with restaurant reservations and theater tickets. When we arrived at the hotel there was a small delay in getting to our room and we were given a complimentary cocktail while we waited. When we got to our room we were suprised by the amazing view as well as the over all decor. From start to finish the experience was great.....the staff was exteremely friendly and helpfull. We can not wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Snooty
