Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and my trip to Barcelona on a whim in order to escape the dreary North European weather and, having read some of the reviews just a few days before going, went with some apprehension. I booked for three nights mid-week and despite paying a single rate was given a reasonably sized double room. The clinical whiteness of the room was a little overdone (the only relief afforded by the black slim-line TV) but everything was clean and in good working order. The bathroom had a decent 'monsoon' shower and separate hand held nozzle for all those hard to reach places. A free facility on offer was an i-pod docking station, which was much welcome as music CDs on the TV came at rather a hefty charge. The room service was done properly, although, oddly, one of the door hangers actually said Do Disturb. This being a gay-orientated establishment I wasn't terribly sure whether this was a typographical error or not! With regard to the Spa complex - I had this to myself. The gym is a little small and would only contain 3 people comfortably but are you really on holiday to have a work out? The sauna and steam are both fine and the jacuzzi delighful (though it would have been better shared with someone tactile but that's life). This being December I can only confirm that the plunge pool is at least more than ankle deep. I also booked a massage through the hotel and this was provided by a very professional Venezualan who was both handsome and friendly (so it can happen). I had a full hour for EUR70 but there were no extras - so you may find better value and possibly extras at one of the saunas where the going rate is in the region of EUR40/hr. I unfortunately was unable to research this matter as some kindly gentleman availed himself of my wallet and all its contents on the metro. This was from the inside zipped (albeit exposed) pocket of my overcoat. If you're going to BCN take and use a money belt. Don't be poorer but wiser after the event like me (sob!). The downside to the hotel, if there has to be one, is that my 5th floor room overlooked the front of the hotel. This may have had a nice view from the miniscule balcony (which vertigo prevented me from venturing onto) but it also meant lots of traffic noise. This being Spain, where every road is a race track, the noise did not abate at any time - day or night. Clearly the seal on the double glazed doors of this particular room needs replacing. If this is likely to concern you you may be best asking for a room at the back. On the upside the hotel is located fairly centrally to all the main sites and is also within walking distance of most of the gay establishments. I didn't sample the breakfast as a coffee and a croissant suffice for me but the lunchtime menu looked terrific value (i was usually having my croissant at about this time, however). Finally the A1 (Blue) Airport bus costs EUR4.05 for a single trip. Note that the only central boarding point is located outside El Corte Ingles in the Placa de Catalunya and the journey from there to the Airport took 40 minutes not the 20 minutes that I was advised by the hotel. Bear in mind that this may take longer in high season/at weekends especially if you live your life like the White Rabbit..........

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Does NOT Live up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: wehodavid
Reviews.Content: After staying a week in Madrid at the Intercontinental Hotel, I was really looking forward to visiting Barcelona for two days and staying at the Axel Hotel. This boutique hotel advertises itself as "Hetero-Friendly" and as such markets itself to the gay community. I arrived mid-afternoon with my roll-aboard bag and noticed the stairs inside the front door of the lobby. Hmmm. No ramp. Ok, so it's not exactly ADA compliant but, hey, we're in Spain not the U.S. So check- in goes quickly and I'm off to my room. I open the door and immediately smell the odor of mildew. Not good. I shut the door and call the front-desk. The hotel is booked and there are no other rooms. Hmmm. Ok, so I open the balcony doors. At least I can let in some fresh air. I check out the bathroom. The room itself is one open room divided by the glass-walled jacuzzi bathtub/shower. I notice the mold growing on the perforated ceiling of the bathroom. That's where that smell is coming from! So, I take a shower after my afternoon of travel and notice that there is a large pool of water on the bathroom floor afterward. It seems the short glass partition on the side of the tub isn't long enough to contain the water splashing out of the shower. So I throw a towel down to soak up the puddle. I begin to notice the little things at this point. Doors not aligned, screws missing, wallpaper peeling, dirty marks on the walls. It is apparent that this hotel USED to be quite modern and chic. However, it's showing it's age and isn't well kept. I checked out the rooftop Spa/Pool/Gym. The pool is tiny though I didn't select this hotel for that. The Gym is inadequate though again I didn't select this hotel for that either. I didn't get the chance to try the restaurant/bar since there were so many good restaurants in the area. The one thing this hotel has going for it is its location. It's an easy walk to the metro and many sites. One of the other annoyances is that to book this hotel, you must pre-pay for at least one night. This is far from industry-norm. As for value, I paid the same rate for this hotel as I did at the Intercontinental in Madrid the previous nights. If the Interconti was 5-star, the Axel rates 1-star.

Reviews.Title: “Imagine staying in a gay club...”
Reviews.Author: aggcardiff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly fine - ultimately it does what it says on the box. It's nicely designed, has some great design touches and a lot to offer. It's well located for a gay time of it, and a little walk if you are staying there to see areas beyond the gaixample. Everything does feel a little smaller than suggested - the pool / chill out area is tiny, but it does look lovely. I stayed here with my partner and although everything was fine, I wouldn't stay there again. I'm perfectly happy to indulge in a bit of 'scene' visiting every now and then, but this was a little too in your face. It contains everything that s good and bad about the gay scene in general and if you're not particularly into the whole club / bar culture, it might leave you a bit cold. Ultimately, I found it slightly predatory of ambience and a tad, unnecessary. Barcelona is a hugely gay-friendly city and other hotels offer better value / location than this one, with the option of dipping into the scene as and when you want.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: richeyint
Reviews.Content: Staff can sometimes be pretentious but a few of them are great. The tall tanned boy in the restaurant makes the difference. The rooms are not very big but very comfortable. Just misses a desk to work. There is a small table. Great shower. The balcony of our room could be accessed from 2 rooms which can be uncomfortable. Great pool scene. Breakfast is +++

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, but overrated”
Reviews.Author: peter07043
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the Axel, but after hearing such great things about this hotel for so long, perhaps our expectations were too high. The building is beautiful, the front desk staff top-notch, the location is perfect, the rooms are very clean, and there's free bottled water for the guests. We also had a very good rate. However, the roof deck is very small, the pool is tiny and shallow (not really a 'pool' at all), the bar on the roof was closed the entire time of our stay, the our room was very small with hardly any room to place of clothes/luggage. We were a little disappointed, but we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Axel.”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelSunnyvale
Reviews.Content: We are a 50-something gay couple from California that recently stayed at the Axel Hotel for 3 nights this past September, on our first trip to Barcelona. We used the reviews on tripadvisor in order to select this particular hotel, and were a bit concerned that the Axel might be a little too "hip" for our rather conservative/retiring tastes. It was not. We were also aware of previously expressed negative comments regarding service and quality of rooms. Again, at least in our experience, these criticisms seem unfounded. The staff were uniformly pleasant, efficient, and helpful, and our standard room on the 5th floor was in excellent shape, clean, and quite satisfactory. Our room faced the street-side, which is our preference, and did allow some street noise to enter the room, but it was not enough to be of concern to us. The room included both slippers and terry-cloth robes, as well as regularly replenished toiletries, towels, etc... The glassed-in shower was large, with beautiful Euro-style fixtures/hardware. And as mentioned in a few previous posts, the bed was unusually comfortable. On the downside there were not enough resting places for luggage: a folding luggage rack would have been helpful. We had to pay nightly for Wifi in our room (6 Euro per night), but the access speed was very quick (much faster than our home DSL uplink). We ate one night at the hotel's restaurant and were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food and friendly service. (We had the mushroom-cheese risotta and Argentine steak which were both delicious.) It surprises me that more people do not mention how nice the roof-top lounge area is with pool, hot-tub, exercise room (with treadmill, free-weights, weight-machine, etc...), sauna, steam room, and inviting lounging areas. A few quibbles here: the hot-tub is a bit small and shallow, and as mentioned elsewhere the pool is just for dipping - sufficient for cooling off after a nice sauna. One other unexpected surprise was the enjoyment we obtained from meeting with our fellow travellers at this hotel: a mixed, interesting, and congenial group, (this based on just a couple of communications we made). A few other pluses: our plumbing, air-conditioning, the elevator, were all in good working order; early wake-up call and taxi-arrangements to the airport - all without incident. (An aside regarding laundromats: the ones we were directed to were several long blocks away from the hotel and of only mediocre quality. If you are doing a multi-city trip as we did, it may be easier to get your self-service laundry done elsewhere.) Unless we hear of a better hotel in Barcelona for gay couples, we definitely will be staying here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Should become a standard”
Reviews.Author: cfmjust
Reviews.Content: Always weary when it comes to such hotels as they have a tendency to be a pink euro rip off but the Axel should become a standard setter in terms of friendliness and competence of its staff as well as the quality of its rooms and services. Breakfast was very good, dinner excellent value for money. A couple of minor recommended improvements: better sound proof the hotelroom doors and somehow restrict the view from the whirlpool to the little gym, the staring by people from the whirlpool can be a bit annoying. Otherwise we'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KildareBradley
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Axel a number of times and while it is a beautiful hotel in a great location it is a little expensive. I have no issue paying for quality, luxury and service but we were dissappointed to notice that on each visit the level of customer service was detoriating. One could be forgiven for believing that the staff were in fact the paying guests and the atmosphere was not friendly or welcoming, their attitude best described as rude in fact. The facilities on the roof terrace were not open and on enquiry we were treated as though we were an irritation. We wrote to the director of the Axel to advise of our view and opinion and received no acknowledgement or response. Barcelona is beautiful city that i would recommend highly and the people are great but honestly I would recommend staying at a Hotel where the staff actually want you and welcomes you as a guest. Will give the Axel a miss on our next trip to Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: TravellerNow
Reviews.Content: Starting with the excellent Web site to the final checkout of the hotel - all was professional and memorable. A great value in the centre of Barcelona and the best 'straight friendly' hotel we've ever stayed at... Try to get one of the corner rooms with the glassed in miniterrace - very charming spot to have your breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Axel Hotel was Great!”
Reviews.Author: Edf1020
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 2 night stay at this great hotel. Located in the Eixample area of Barcelona, you can walk to most of the major sights in the city center. Plus, Barcelona has an excellent subway system with stops near the hotel. Of the four hotels I stayed at in Spain on this trip, incuding another much more expensive 4 star one in Barcelona, this was my favorite. Great location, clean, airy rooms, the most comfortable bed and large bathroom were all appreciated. I booked a standard single (has a king size bed). They gave me one on the corner, so my bathroom had a tub, not just a stand up shower. And the soundproof doors opened up to a small juliet balcony overlooking the street. I liked the open shelving/closet in the room. I thought it provided more room than the airmoires some European hotels offer. The little touches made a big difference here too. A refrigerator on each floor stocked with cold water for whenever you wanted. Two sets of bath amenities in the bathroom. Extra large and soft towels for both the bathroom and the pool. Large, fluffy pillows for the bed... The staff was all very helpful, especially at the front desk. And the service at breakfast was the most attentive and quickest I had all trip. Maybe not a big thing for everybody, but I loved that they served you a pot of coffee, rather than just one cup at a time! The rooftop pool and bar were also quite nice. The pool is small (there's also a hot tub and small, but quite adequate, gym), but they loungechairs and views are wonderful. It's a great spot to meet friends for a drink at the end of the day. When I come back to Barcelona, this is the only hotel I will stay at and I have already recommended it many of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: islandboi
Reviews.Content: I was in Spain for 3 weeks with my boyfriend, we traveled all over, through the north, central, south and to Menorca. The Axel was a wonderful relief!!!! The rooms were nice and the beds and linens the nicest, most comfertable we had in Spain. The rooftop pool is a little small - like a pond really, but better than nothing. The gym is kind of pointless, I thought. A few free weights. The location is good and thank god...the hotel is smoke free! It was quiet too - I was worried about noisy guys coming in at all hours...it was not crowded, in fact, rather dead, so that could be why..but I was glad, I wanted to rest and sleep. The windows are double glass and block out all street noise. I do wish they would have had a fridge in the rooms. They have a cooler stuffed with water in the halls, but I (although I used it) found it wasteful - all those plastic bottles being used and tossed when the tap water is safe and fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - a little pricey but would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: JT88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in June 2008. The Axel is a hotel that is gay and straight friendly, but caters to a mainly gay clientele. As a same-sex married couple from Canada on our honeymoon, this hotel fit the bill! We booked a city-view room (see photo). The rooms were averaged sized and, while the floors and walls looked a little worn, everything was quite clean. The hotel provided slippers for the room which was nice. The in-room safe worked well. Towels and toiletries were changed daily. One minor gripe was the hair conditioner - all the amenities are packed into these Axel coloured cube bottles that are not squeezable. The green-coloured conditioner provided was of a less fluidic consistency which made it hard to get out of the bottle. Trying to get the conditioner out of the bottle in the shower often resulted in what looked as if the Green Giant had exploded in our bathroom. Didn't use the pool upstairs but saw some people enjoying the jacuzzi. Used the gym twice upstairs - it is open to the outside air and can get very hot, so I would recommend using it early in the morning or late in the evening if you want to use the gym. Otherwise, it is adequate by hotel standards. The complimentary bottles of water in the hallways were a plus. Like a previous poster stated, it's too bad they couldn't use larger bottles as we felt like we were being wasteful going through so many small bottles. We booked our hotel stay via their Discover Axel package (one of a number of packages online). We were welcomed to our room with complimentary glasses of champagne for each of us which was a nice touch. There was a great deal of confusion during our first night of checkin (we didn't get the official drink tickets to Zelta's Club and Zelta's club was unwilling to take a handwritten note that the front desk gave us to use instead, and the Bus Turistic card wasn't included). This was quickly remedied the next morning by the front desk who had an envelope ready for us with the missing contents (though it was too late for us to use the Zelta's Club drinks by then as we had already paid for them the previous night). Our package came with complimentary wine that was delivered to our room one night which was very nice. We also had a complementary dinner in our package at the hotel's El Comedor restaurant. They asked us what time we wanted it and so we arranged it for that first nigth that we arrived. When we arrived to the restaurant, we indicated to the busboy that we had a reservation and were seated down with full menu in front of us. Unfortunately as we were about to order, we clarified with them whether we really could order from the entire menu at which point they realized we were the package-included-dinner couple who they were expecting, and had to switch our menus to the more limited choice one. The dinner was ok but frankly nothing to write home about. It was followed by a dragshow that was funny, although would have been more-so had I understood any Spanish. Our package also included wifi access. Wifi speed was very fast. However, one thing to note is that, upon login with the given user/password for our room, the connection appeared to latch on only to that first connected computer. Even if we turned off the computer, the wifi signal for some reason wouldn't recognize any other electronic device (like another computer or PDA) - only the first device that connected to it. Any subsequent device that tried to connect received a 'you are already connected' message even though the original laptop was completely turned off. Strange! The wifi signal was fast enough to do VoIP phone calls back to North America which is a plus. The included buffet breakfast was probably the brightest spot of the hotel, surprisingly. There was a large variety of foods, including eggs, prosciutto, fresh juices - the menu varied slightly each day but we were very happy with the breakfast seletction and quality. In fact, it was probably the best breakfasts we had on our European honeymoon trip. Speaking of food, if you could go to only TWO places to eat that is walking distance of this place, our first and highest recommendation would be Paco Meralgo Restaurant at 171 C/Muntaner (about 7 or 8 blocks away). We were so enthralled with the tapas there that we went back AGAIN the very next day. Paco Meralgo has to be the best kept secret for tapas now in Barcelona without the hordes of tourists (especially if you go before 9pm), stealing the crown from what's becoming the tourist trap known as Cal Pep. Just do a search on Chowhound (where we found people praising Paco Meralgo). Second place one must go - Cacao Sampaka on 292 Consell de Cent just a couple of blocks from the hotel. Their Aztec hot chocolate is a MUST-try - the thickest best hot chocolate you'll ever eat with a spoon. One last note - our package came with a Bus Turistic card for the 2 full days of our stay. My spouse and I usually shun tourist buses and never imagined we'd use it. We usually look at passing tourist buses and shudder. But boy are we ever glad we had the tourbus passes this time around. It was SO worth it to have the bus turistic card as it allowed us onto the Bus Turistic network where we got on/off the bus and got to see so much of Barcelona that we otherwise wouldn't have. The audio guided tour during each segment of the bus journey was fun to listen to. In fact we didn't even need to use the subway once the entire stay in Barcelona as the 3 intertwining Bus Turistic paths were so convenient! The coincidental inclusion of the Bus Turistic pass (which I think is normally about 26-29euros each for a 2day pass) was well worth the package deal with Hotel Axel, even without the included dinner/wifi/wine. Checkout was a breeze. We never really did figure out what the 'free gift' that was part of our package was. We asked if it was the Axel ballcaps in our rooms (it certainly wasn't labelled as such) and the front desk just said 'yeah, sure' so we took the ballcaps. To this day we have no idea if that was what the 'free gift' was or maybe they just forgot. Certainly not a big deal for us. Overall, I'd defintiely stay at the Axel again. Central location, only a couple blocks from where the Aerobus picks us up and drops us off at Universitat (in fact it's one stop before the busy Catalunya stop, so if you take the aerobus, you'll be on and seated before the massive tourists get on at Catalunya who are forced to stand all the way to the airport). Also be sure to note where the Aerobus drops you off at Universitat because it's one of the few stops that isn't clearly marked with an Aerobus sign.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: piboBelgium
Reviews.Content: The axel is certainly not the place to stay if you're on a budget and it is true that it is a bit overpriced. Nevertheless, we enjoyed our stay very much, our overall feeling is that the place is worth the money and we will consider to stay in the axel again. Most members of the staff were really nice and very helpfull and gave us great tips for restaurants, shops and partying. The guests consist of various types of people (young, older, european, american, male and female) and we liked that. The atmosphere in the hotel is certainly nicer then in a mainstream hotel and the rooftopterrace is great. Because of both reasons you may probably spend more time in the hotel then you usually do during city trips. The gym is small but there are sufficient free weights for a good workout. The breakfast was really expensive but still a good option if you want something more then churros or a croisant in the morning. Note that the receptionist tried to overcharge us more then 100 EUR when we were checking out for roomservice and breakfasts that were already paid for. I'm sure that this was an accident but do check your bill before you leave....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: altitudegroup
Reviews.Content: Lesbian friendly the Axel Hotel is in a great part of town. Close to the metro and some very fine bars and restaurants. Staff were very friendly and the hotel is stylish, modern and clean. Each floor has a fridge with complimentary bottles of water - nice touch. The rooms are not huge but good enough and the bathrooms are spacious. Try and get a room on the inside courtyard (not a courtyard at all but takes you off the noisy street side). The drag show on Thursday night was outstanding. Only downside is they have a minimum drink order per person of $10 - seemed a little excessive given we were staying in the hotel for several days. I'd prefer to have paid a covercharge! The breakfasts are great but pricy. Better to head to a local eatery and save the cash. A must do just down the road is the Flauta Restaurant and Bar - best Tapas and friendliest service we had in Barcelona (overall everywhere in Barcelona is friendly, but this was a standout). I would stay here again and look forward to it....and I didn't even try out the spa or pool.

Reviews.Title: “A nice but overpriced gay hotel”
Reviews.Author: ProtonVehiCROSS
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great location central to all the gay bars -- there are at least 6-10 within a 1 block radius - Neighborhood feels fairly safe even at night - Exterior and lobby are great - Free bottled water on every floor - Hotel staff and other guests are friendly and it seemed easier to meet people in this hotel than in your typical Sheraton-type brownbag hotel Cons: - Rooms are small and fairly clean but not as nice as what the Web site would lead you to believe -- some peeling paint, cracks, and other signs of deterioration are evident - Shower is one of the tiniest I have used - Cost was very high for Barcelona at €165 per night in February 2008 - It’s a 20-40 minute walk to most of Barcelona’s other major attractions along the waterfront; other attractions such as Sagrada Familia are probably a too far to walk it - Internet is not free Overall: - A very good if overpriced hotel and I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Location, location !”
Reviews.Author: AirlineGuyNYC
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, VERY limited storage space. No place to put your suitcase and leave it so you can open it. Reception staff is "adequate" but not overly welcoming, but they do their job. Great roof deck and views, but I would imagine the tiny pool is packed. Great location, easy walking to everything central in BCN. As long as they don't get carried away with prices, good place to stay if you don't mind the tiny rooms. Breakfast pricing was outrageous, so walk across the street in the morning for a coffee and croissant which is about a 10th of what hotel breakfast would cost you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Gay Friendly Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: rgehring
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice location, clean rooms with comfortable beds. Were there for a pre-cruise visit, and really enjoyed it. Expensive, but we thought it was worth it. Great help at front desk too, and they all spoke perfect english.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place, will return”
Reviews.Author: Terrell_msp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights over the US Thanksgiving weekend. Very modern decor. Acceptable workout room on the top floor and business center with a couple of computers. Has wireless available in room for an extra 6 euros per day. Normally I don't like to dine in hotel restaurants in the evening; however, I was tired from travel the first night and did from a seat at the bar. The food was excellent, had a great spinach and pear salad and risotto. Bar staff was very friendly. Room was spacious with king size bed and small flat screen TV, decent size closet, bath was shower, no tub.

Reviews.Title: “unattentive bar staff, possibly asleep”
Reviews.Author: jetflex
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean. The reception service is excellent as is the room cleaning service. Personally, I would avoid the bar . The service here was slow and the staff disinterested. Though, the bar manager tries his best. But overall the hotel provides well above average accomodation with a great atmosphere. Rooms at the front of the hotel can get street noise escpecially at weekends, so if that worries you ask the reception staff to get you a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, classy experience for couple from Atlanta, GA USA”
Reviews.Author: JEWalker
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Axel Hotel in Barcelona during a quick European visit during Thanksgiving and really enjoyed our stay. We've been together for ten years so would rather a quant hotel with comfortable settings than a social scene. During our staff (off season), the hotel exceeded our expectations. The room was small but comfortable with a small balcony that overlooked the neighborhood. The bathroom products were great as was the complimentary access to bottled water on each floor, which was always stocked and ready for the use of guests. The hotel is located in good area that's convenient to night life, dining, shopping and the sights. The staff was attentive, professional and courteous. Our next trip is to Buenos Aires and we plan to try to Hotel Axel based on our experience in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “my new favourite hotel in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: henryspain
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Axel only one night in a single room, check in was freindly and quick, the room was spacious and well decorated and very clean, bathrooms with all amenities you may need. The breakfast and dinner were both excellent. I cant think about anything wrong about this place. Oh maybe one thing, why is in the special lodging section on tripadvisor? I think it should be on the top of the barcelona hotels list. It is much better than many "straight 5 star" hotels in barcelona. GO THERE

Reviews.Title: “Good Gay Hotel, A Little on the Expensive Side”
Reviews.Author: twah
Reviews.Content: After trying several other hotels a few days in advance of our stay I went on Priceline and found the Hotel Axel. There were no special deals for it and it ended up costing 259 Euro for three of us. The accomodations were very nice and ultra modern. The staff was friendly and helpful. . Our room had a balcony on the street side. It was a little noisy with the windows open but when closed we really didn't notice the street noise. There was air conditioning so you could close the windows and turn on the air. Everything was a la carte in terms of additional services: 6Euro for wifi, 3 Euro for a small container of ice. The restaurant prices were comparable to those outside the hotel. There was a nice roof top bar and swimming pool which were not open due to the time of year. The hot tub was open and was nice. There was a small gym Other than the high price which was similar to all the other hotels in the same 3 star category, I would have no reservation recommending the hotel to someone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: gbk
Reviews.Content: Well I read the reviews before booking and I can just say that gay guys are tough customers! All those little things in the reviews are tiny things that sure could be better - but overall its a great quality hotel..and best of all its gay. Its not a 5 star hotel but its great - extremely clean, very friendly staff who went out of the way to help with everything, nice rooms with terrace overlooking street, great jacuzzi and steam on rooftop, very convenient location to both gay and tourist sights. Beds are super large and comfortable, yes the clothing rack is a rack and not a closed cupboard (can this seriously ruin your time in Barcelona!) and yes the shower door doesnt go right across the shower and some water gets on the floor - but you have a mat to put on the floor and your room gets cleaned every day - so does this really matter so much?! As for the guys saying there are men looking for sex here - well it is gay hotel! But if you are in your room with the door closed - how would you know what is happening outside your room!!! I saw a few guys giving smiles and eye contact - but nothing more than you get on the streets outside! There were straight couples here when I stayed and gay guys with straight friends staying too - everyone was super friendly and relaxed. It is a little bit expensive for what it is - maybe should be a bit cheaper but overall I had a great stay for 5 nights, met friendly guys, walked to the gay bars, enjoyed the terrace on the roof, and slept wonderfully in the bed and with the 3 curtains that block out all the sun in the morning. And finally yes its a busy streets outside, but look around you. It is Barcelona! Everyone lives on a busy street here, its city life and thats what is part of amazing Barcelona. So book here and enjoy your time in Barcelona ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Setup, Replace the staff”
Reviews.Author: CelticTigerDublin
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay. Clean, unobtrusive, Ultimately gay. This could very easily be a four star hotel. Expect to pay a premium for the pink pound. As an aside, the small rooms are small. The superior rooms have an open plan bathroom/bedroom. So, either share with someone you know really well or don't take a dump all weekend. Barcelona is such a vibrant city and the hotel has such a fantastic location that you can walk out the front door and be in most of the places worth seeing in less than half an hour's walk. (Walk everywhere or you will miss out). So, the small rooms are not a problem. The service is up its own ass. Lethargic to say the least, almost argumentative. I have a few quid now and I like to stay five star on my first visit to a city. (I have spent Summers living in a tent) . My feeling is that you pay to stay gay. If you're single and restless, hang out in the lift. I've heard that Madrid has a better city buzz. Next time.

Reviews.Title: “My 4th Time Staying”
Reviews.Author: chrisois
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th time staying at Hotel Axel, and am still very happy and pleased with my overall experience. This time I was traveling with 4 other gay friends. It was their first time to Barcelona and they wanted to be in the heart of the gay district. While other hotels may offer a better value, I have not found one with a great rooftop gay bar, weekly drag show and amazing air conditioning! Staff was very friendly and helpful, room was very clean and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Quite the gay scene”
Reviews.Author: Beetleman
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in Barcelona and stayed at the Axel Hotel as it was advertised as one of the biggest gay hotels in Europe. And that is is. They are right in the middle of the gay Eixample or gaixample as it is called. In hindsight we may have paid a little much for something that we realized wasn't what we were looking for - "the scene". On Wednesday night, our first night, parades of beautiful men - mostly locals - entered the hotel and went up to their Sky Bar - a beautiful bar overlooking the city. We had a drink up there and it was crowded and a beautiful view but perhaps we were just a little older (in our 40s) than most of the crowd. There was another event on another night which made accessing the elevator difficult (and it's a slow one) as we competed with the people going up and down to the bar. That was probably our biggest complaint about the place as it wants to be more than just a hotel - but also a bar - and part of the Barcelona gay scene. And if that's what you want, the hotel is perfect. Otherwise we thought the hotel was good. The room was a bit small and storage space a little difficult. The bathroom didn't allow for much counter space. Some of these things are expected for older European hotels but this is a newer hotel with very contemporary features. The staff was always friendly and attentive and one of them gave us an excellent restaurant tip - La Flauta - for tapas. The free water on every floor was a great perk and the value of that cannot be discounted in the summer when a small bottle of water as you walk around the city will cost you 3 Euros. We would probably not stay here again but if we had friends who were really into the social scene that came with this place, we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “never again- hugely overpriced”
Reviews.Author: rbcn
Reviews.Content: i suggested the axel hotel for some friends visiting me from abroad. When they checked into the suite, they had various comments regarding the lack of thought in this hotel. i checked out their room, as i felt bad for suggesting it. i have worked for an airline for 18 years, so i have a bit of insight on all ranges of hotels. After seeing the place, i would NOT suggest that anyone pays these over-inflated prices - there are many better options in barcelona at half the price. the Suite had an open plan bathroom, which was nice. but the toilet had no door, so you had to hear everyone on the loo - unacceptable. The showers DO NOT have thermostatic controls, why - they cost marginally more? the wardrobe is cheap chrome, open air and ugly. so you are faced with seeing your clothes and suitcases during your entire stay. one of the friends was on medication needing refrigeration, they DO NOT have fridges or minibars or tea coffee making facilities - unacceptable. they have the cheapest, nastiest flat tv that sticks out of the wall. on top of that, and yet even worse, you get a cheap samsung stereo with huge ugly speakers that hang either side of the bed. surely an afterthought in that orange wood colour. all in all, it feels like a cheap conversion with fake wood floors and substandard fittings. some of the lighting was interesting, though was very home-made and will date quickly. my friends returned to the Axel after a stay in Ibiza, this time they stayed in a deluxe room, which was as above, but with a bathroom with a door. They also commented that the staff were unfriendly, did not know anything about the local gay area, and were generally uninterested in their guests. (they could rarely get a taxi, and were not helped to find one) i also noticed they must use half of the power grid on lighting the guest hallways, it is truly painful lighting and shopping mall like design. though i loved the bottles of chilled water on every floor what more can i say, i will never suggest that anyone stays here. rl, bcn

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the stay very much”
Reviews.Author: Red_Turtle
Reviews.Content: Axel advertises itself as a gay hotel, and the clientele did seem to be mostly gay men (of all ages). However, it is in a quiet but very central location in the city, and the hotel is comfortable enough to suit most open-minded travellers. It is just 10-15 minutes' walk away from the main hustle and bustle of Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya, and there are quite a few gay bars and restaurants within one or two blocks of the hotel. The staff are also very friendly and helpful. Sure, I have to admit that the reception area seemed small and the decor at the entrance didn't grab my attention straight away. But the room was simply but stylishly furnished, and there were plenty of unusual and pleasantly surprising touches (such as the unlimited free bottles of chilled water on each floor, and complimentary packs of condoms among the designer toiletries in the bathroom!) The rooftop terrace seemed to be a focal point for many of the guests. There were a jacuzzi/hot tub, a swimming pool, a small gym, sundeck, and a rooftop bar serving drinks and cocktails. On a nice summers day, it was very easy to meet and chat with other travellers, and the atmosphere was friendly and relaxed. On different nights of the week, there were various events and the rooftop bar became a stylish drinking venue for non-hotel-guests as well. The hotel also had a restaurant on the ground level, which other hotel guests highly recommended (although I didn't get to dine there).

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: stany_boyDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights. The hotel is in a nice quiet area near all the gay bars and clubs. The hotel was extremely expensive for what you go, over €200 per night. Reception were indifferent to us as guests, we did not enjoy the interaction with Staff. Also breakfast was very expensive at €30 for 2. They also charge for WiFi access @ €7 per day. You could do a LOT better for what we payed for e.g. Hotel 1898. We would not stay there again. Young couple (23) from Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Loves the location”
Reviews.Author: John013
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the GayEixample, the front desk is excellent, and there is FREE Internet terminals. The service at the Restaurant and Bar is the only area where this hotel needs to improve, there is no discipline and the staff ignore clients arriving wanting a table. The cuisine is great but the service is not Rooms are OK, maintenance is a problem area, knocks and bumps are not repaired, plumbing in the bathroom is not fixed, small things but important. There is a small pool and jacuzzi with sauna and gym and sun terrace, this is great to chill if you have a later flight and need to soak up the sun. This hotel is NOT good vaslue for money it is expensive for what it offers, there are~more economical options available.

Reviews.Title: “Out and proud”
Reviews.Author: Ferrelled
Reviews.Content: First, I agree with Jet-Setter-SF completely. My partner and I stayed for 4 nights over Easter weekend. Greatest part of it all: the staff. While it would be complimentary to say they were responsive, it goes beyond that. They actually initiated contact and it was always pleasant even though our Catalan and Spanish was non-existent. And none of them is hard to look at either. Breakfast was ample and dinner was well-presented. Because the hallways are tiled rather than carpeted, they are dynamic and noisy. The gym is very small and minimaly equipped but arrangements are available with Holmes Place. Being about a 20 minute walk from La Rambla and wholly walkable to a number of gay venues makes a great location and we never waited more than a few minutes to catch a taxi right outside even though it was a holiday weekend. We will definitely stay here the next time but opt for a regular, street-facing room rather than the deluxe room with the stained glass balcony. Oh, and will prefer the separate bath more than the stylish one. The most comfortable hotel bed ever - bar one.

Reviews.Title: “Great for gays - would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: SoutheastAsiaSusan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Axel Hotel for three nights from 26-28 February. We booked the 3x2 nights offer (stay for three nights for the price of two) Standard Patio View Room. If you expect to see a garden you're going to be disappointed - the view was of other people's apartments, where they hang their laundry to dry. The room is a bit small, making storage a problem, and there isn't a bath tub like in most other three star hotels. But we loved the bed, which was very nice and comfortable. We also liked the flat screen TV and the streo player in the room not to mention all of the amneties provided by the hotel such as bathrobes, sandals, cotton buds, shoe horn, etc. But what we liked most was the free flow of cold bottled water kept at the hallway of each floor. The staff was very friendly, and they try to help, although when we asked for direction of a famous sauna not too far away from the hotel they gave us the wrong address, which resulted in extra cab fares. Overall, this is a very nice hotel for gays, and the location is quite close to many gay venues. The guest policy is nice, allowing you to bring friends up to your room without any questions asked. We would definitely stay there again if we were to come to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Regular rooms are OK, but avoid the "Superior" rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jet-Setter-SF
Reviews.Content: Hotel Axel bills itself as a hetero-friendly hotel. Indeed, I was in Barcelona for a conference and there were many hetero's there who had no idea it was really a gay hotel -- that is until they got to their room and found the large artwork of a naked guy on the wall. Quite amusing actually. Nonetheless, the staff treated them well, as far as I could tell. Still, the hotel is definitely designed for a the gay traveler on holiday. It is not set up for business travelers, but provides a comfortable bed in a convenient part of town. (WiFi was relatively inexpensive though -- 6 euros for 24 hours. And they had to PCs available for checking email, etc., for free.) On the positive side: the location, the very comfortable beds, the free bottles of water, and of course the gay-friendly atmosphere. The restaurant served good food at a fairly reasonable price, and room service was generally good, for someone ordering in English and not Catalan or Spanish. The breakfast buffet was bigger than expected. During my February visits, the roof deck amenities (pool, jacuzzi, gym, etc.) were too cold to enjoy, but looked like a great place to hang out in warm weather. On the negative side, the rooms were very spartan and on the small side. The double, city-view room had a nice balcony, but otherwise was small and lacking in storage and surfaces on which to put things. The wire-rack storage system (shown in room photos on the web site) is clearly a cost-saving measure and lacking in functionality. There were few surfaces on which to put things, such as a glass of water, a wallet, coins, etc. Also on the negative side, they say the rooms are "sound proof," and indeed the windows are effective at blocking street noise. However, every small sound from the corridor seems to be amplified by the hallway and is loudly transmitted through the door to the room. We stayed one night a second time a week later in a "Superior Room", which had a beautiful stained glass-enclosed balcony. Lovely to look at, but not well integrated into the room. In fact, the entire "Superior" room was poorly laid out and had a poorly designed bathroom. (Very poor feng shui!) All my bathroom pet peeves were there: 1) no door on the shower or bathroom, meaning steam permeated the entire room; 2) glass wall between the shower and bedroom (sexy when I was younger, but annoying now); and 3) no ventilation. All in all the Superior Room was not worth the extra money over the city-view double. Other details: TV had only two English language channels. The pay-per-view selection was limited and extremely dated. The restaurant is nice and knew how to make a good martini -- rare for that part of the world. The staff was pleasant and all spoke fluent English. I would go back, but would not splurge on the "Superior" room.

Reviews.Title: “Location and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Rodolphe
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Axel on Jan 19 & 20 for the first time and must say it was a great experience. Location is perfect as it is within walking distance to all major sights and shopping areas. Rooms are comfortable, mattrasses insured a good night sleep. Lobby and restaurant very stylish and staff is extremely helpful. Will definetely be back. Rolf, Paris, France

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff, Little overpriced in the restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: pat_dub_1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Christmas stay the Axel, Having stayed there several times over the past year I cannot say anything bad about the location and staff in this hotel. It is the perfect location as a base for a Gay Stay in Barcelona, right in the middle of the Gay scene but only a 5 minute walk to La Ramblas, the rooms are bright and cheerful and the reception/ bar area is a great place to meet fellow travelers. The one complaint I would have about this place is the "Comedor de Axel" (the hotel restaurant) Myself and my fellow travelers felt more that a little ripped off in this area. It was the only restaurant where the starters were twice the size of the main course (a portion of steak was about the size of a medium tomato) not to mention that the price for 3 courses is about €55 a head, which is about twice the local average. All in all if your Gay its THE place to stay but there are a lot of equally as good hotels in the area for about two thirds of the price. But it is worth the experience.

Reviews.Title: “MOST comfortable beds and pillows EVER”
Reviews.Author: wesbeach
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights at the Axel and it was a great experience the staff was fantastic and helpfull and the room spacious and comfy, its really a great value and i must mention the most incredibly comfortable beds ive ever sleeped on. over a great trip and location is central! bars and restaurants and cafes all around and 2 metro stops 3, 4 blocks away each. couldnt have been better!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Comfort and Impeccable Service in the Heart of Gay Friendly Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Shammysheep
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from a two week romp across southern Europe where we had the opportunity to stay at the Axel Hotel in Barcelona. Our experience was nothing short of phenomenal. The hotel lies in the heart of the trendy Eixample district within easy walking distance of numerous shops, restaurants, gay clubs, and the famed Las Ramblas area. Upon entering the Axel’s lobby, you immediately take note of the ultra modern contemporary décor. Being more of a traditionalist, I often find the contemporary style to be rather cold and impersonal, but the Axel hotel has executed this style in a manner that is both warm and inviting. The hotel staff were consistently courteous, always accommodating, and spoke better English than my high school literature teacher. I was a bit concerned initially at the lack of a dedicated concierge, but the boys at the front desk filled this role with competence and aplomb. Whether it was restaurant reservations or sight-seeing information, they always delivered. The accommodations, while not breathtakingly spectacular, were certainly adequate for the price range. My partner, a first time traveler to Europe, was taken aback by the small room, but I found it to be par for the course in light of previous trips. As previously mentioned, the closet space was abysmal. The bed, however, was among the comfiest of any hotel I’ve ever stayed at. Amenities abound at the Axel hotel. David, the hunky bartender, will serve you the cocktail of your choice in the smoke-free lobby bar where you can people watch and get to know the other guests. Feel lost without you computer? No worries - the second floor has a business center complete with internet access. There is also a fantastic roof-top bar, sadly closed in the off season, called Sky Lounge. Also on the roof you will find a small, but lovely, pool and spa as well as a fitness center/gym. Okay gay travelers, a word of caution. You worldly types who frequent gay oriented establishments will not be shocked to learn that the pool area can become a little crusie after hours. So, if you’re a conservative queen with fragile sensibilities, you may want to refrain from taking a late night dip. The hotel does not market itself as clothing optional, but there is no shortage of men sporting nothing more than a gold chain around the pool come sundown. In summation, I really enjoyed my time at the Axel hotel. The property, staff, location, and price all exceeded my expectations. Stay at the Axel and enjoy a classy gay resort that makes you feel welcome, safe, and gloriously fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class!”
Reviews.Author: trueblueother
Reviews.Content: I regularly visit Barcelona and eventually decided to try the Axel - having had fairly middle-of-the-road experiences of other gay hotels in this beautiful city. This is like no other gay hotel - it's absolutely Top Class. Friendly, professional staff in all areas; clean; the roof area (Sky Bar, jacuzzi, tiny pool, etc) is fabulous. The rooms are really good - although I'll echo other comments about the slight lack of wardrobe space. I don't echo negative comments about the locality - it's slap bang in the middle of the Gay Eixample - which is the Georgian 'new town'. Once you know whether you're facing north or south, the grid-like layout of blocks is very easy to navigate. Anyway, you're on holiday - who cares about getting lost!!! I'm going back to the Axel for Christmas. Try it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, clean, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sanfrantraveler
Reviews.Content: The good: -Nice lobby -Clean, bright rooms -Good opportunities to socialize with other guests - the cocktail hours they do are fun -Good location: in Eixample, walking distance to Barrio Gottic -Helpful, friendly staff -View out the front of the hotel was nice. At many other hotels in Barcelona you look only at another building. Here you see the intersection which is quite large and makes for good people watching. This is not the case from all the rooms, though, only the middle ones. -Stereo in the room - I wish all hotels had this. Not everyone wants to watch TV all the time. -Pay per view movies weren't too expensive, and you could pause and finish later. The average: -Quality of furnishings, cheap, basic and not up to what I would expect for the price we paid -Room is quite small -Fitness facility could be better at a gay-oriented hotel. It is similar to what you might find at a Marriott. The bad: -Price. Although we enjoyed our stay here, I did not feel it was worth 185 Euro / night.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: minicooperdownunder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights from September 21, loved the place. Rooms are great and modern very minimal and maybe a little short of closet space and storeage, but that may depend on the room you are in. Great buffet breakfast downstairs and the cold bottled water on each floor is a great idea. The topfloor has a very small plunge pool, spa, exercise room, sauna, steamroom and bar. The location is pretty good although Barcelona can be a little confusing as the area the hotel is in has no real outstanding feature to guide you and all the intersections are theses little squares and the buildings that surround them are all a very similar achitectural style. It is a gay hotel and the staff is very helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Club_Marin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Axel for three nights, our stay was very comfortable, the staff extremely helpful in english and in french. The room was great, quiet, good AC and very clean. Cold bottled water and internet is provided for free, this is very appreciated. We had great suggestions for dinner. A very plesant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: AdventureGuru
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hotel Axel. I moved there from another hotel after enduring a terrible one-night stay in the Gothic Quarter. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel mainly caters to the gay community, but bills itself as hetero-friendly. I enjoyed the free bottled water in coolers on each floor. It's the small things that really count. Also, there was free internet, another plus. The rooms are very clean and stylish. Only a couple of minuses: There were no wash cloths in the bathroom and no alarm clocks. But, pack your own and everything will be fine. And on my last day there was no hot water. But, given how friendly and inviting the staff was to me I let this one slide. You won't be disappointed staying at Axel. Great location near La Rambla, nice amenities, etc makes this place a nice alternative to the crowded and noisy Gothic barrio. You can walk there in 10 minutes. Book early as this place is always full.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: ElvisCole
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Axel in July 2006 for almost two weeks and had a really wonderful stay. First, the staff was, across the board, all excellent. From the patient front desk staff who all spoke English and had excellent knowledge of the city, to the wait staff that was super friendly to the housekeeping staff that kept our room in perfect shape for the entire stay. We had a third floor room on the street. We never had a problem with noise either from the street or from the hotel itself. It’s quiet enough to get a great night’s sleep and the optional black-out shade was a bonus for when we stayed out late and wanted some extra shut-eye. We also loved the rooftop deck. It’s a great place for hanging out and enjoying the sun and the plentiful eye candy. Yes, the pool is super tiny and not deep at all. But, it was still nice to jump in and cool off when laying out. The Jacuzzi is clean and nice, as are the steam room and sauna. Again, the service in the Sky Bar is excellent and the drinks yummy. The free Internet was really helpful and the free bottled water saved lots of money. Finally, the location of the hotel is great. It's 2 short blocks to the Universitat Metro station (with a good Starbuck's on the way). It's also just 5 blocks to Passeig de Gracia and restaurant / shopping paradise. It's right in the middle of the gay neighborhood so you don't have to go far for gay bars, clubs and restaurants. We loved the Axel and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “All In All a Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravlinMan
Reviews.Content: Checked in around 1am on a Monday. We'd made a three-day reservation because we weren't sure of our itinerery for the whole week. At check in, we asked about availability during the rest of the week if we decided to stay on. The desk clerk was very helpful. Although the hotel was booked through the weekend, he followed up and on the next night stopped us in the lobby to let us know he'd secured our room for the balance of the trip. It IS a pretty decent place. When we first arrived we were a bit put off by the rather spartan rooms and linoleum floors. The bed was nice however, and we had a room overlooking the street with french doors. The bathroom worked well enough, although the floor flooded with every shower because the shower "door" only closes across 2/3rds of the opening. The baseboards were pretty dirty, but all in all we thought the place was decently clean. Nicely located, just a few blocks from Las Ramblas -- about a 15 minute walk. The hotel was pretty empty on Monday, but by Wednesday things started to pick up and by Thursday and Friday it was full. Nice roof bar, pool and weight room with a sauna and steam. Complimentary computers on the mezzanine level. We checked out a few other hotels in the area while we were there, and decided that all in all this was a nice place for the money. Would I stay there again? Yes; however, if I go back I'm likely to try somewhere else just to get a different perspective -- and perhaps stay in a different part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable beds ever....”
Reviews.Author: Tattoosydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Axel for a week in late June 2006, and our experience was markedly different from the few negative reviews below. We had a wonderful time and would definitely stay here again. The staff of the Axel were all charming and very helpful. We made several email requests before we even left Australia, following from which the night desk staff made restaurant bookings for us, checked availability of theatre tickets, and were always happy to go the extra mile. This standard of service continued throughout our stay, from desk and service staff alike. We were delayed in Madrid, and did not arrive in Barcelona until midnight. Nonetheless, a quick call to the hotel meant our room was held for us, and the desk staff promptly checked us in upon arrival. We had a superior room on the fifth floor overlooking the street. The overall air of the hotel is smart, and the decor in the reception and public areas restrainedly trendy. There's even a clothes shop attached to the foyer, if your taste runs to expensive designer label gay eurotrash clothing. The room was quite large for a European hotel room, with nice minimalist decor and lots of storage space in the room. The air conditioning was very effective. The king sized bed was perhaps the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, with very soft sheets, huge pillows and a warm quilt. The bathroom was quite large, with a very good shower, huge towels and lots of shelf space. Both the bedroom and the bathroom were spotlessly clean, and were cleaned carefully every day, no matter what time we left for the day. The laundry service was effective and very prompt, even given the huge pile of washing we dumped on them after two weeks travelling. The free water, in fridges in the hallways, doesn't sound like a major thing, but in the heat of a Barcelona summer, it saved us a lot of money every day, given the amount of water we were drinking to survive. We ordered breakfast in our room one day, and it was very nice, with great pastries and coffee. Our room had a lovely view of the bustle outside in the square. While there was lots of traffic and noise, even late at night (as you would expect in the centre of a big city), the room was well soundproofed, and we weren't at all disturbed. It even kept out the noise of the thousands of fireworks that were being let off for the Feast of St John, the night we arrived. The bar and pool area on the roof was nice, if a little too crowded with aging Germans in lycra. The hotel is quite cruisy, especially on the weekend, with the odd patron roaming around in a bathrobe, although "flirtatious" is perhaps a better term. We certainly didn't see any inappropriate or overtly sexual behaviour (as has been described in other reviews) at the hotel, or indeed much that I would not have been happy for my mother to see. (Although we did see some things in nightclubs that would have turned her hair white.) The hotel is an easy 5 to 10 minute walk to two Metro stations (Passieg de Gracia and Universitat) on two major Metro lines, so it is convenient to everywhere you might want to go in Barcelona. The area is charming, with some very good restaurants, shops and lots of gay bars and clubs within two blocks of the hotel. All in all a wonderful experience. One note: When you are in Barcelona, make sure to make a dinner booking at Espai Sucre. This wonderful restaurant is owned by a "disciple" of Ferran Adria (the "world's best chef"), and serves mainly desserts. While there are a few savoury dishes available to start, the focus of the restaurant is the dessert degustation. The staff are lovely, and the food is amazing. We had the five course degustation with matching wines, and it was one of the most wonderful culinary experiences I have ever had. While you would imagine that five desserts (and coffee and petit fours) might be way too much, the menu is designed that all of the courses are very different, and build in flavour, complexity and sweetness, and are perfectly matched to the wines. The food is complex, but inspired. I would travel back to Barcelona just to spend the day at Sagrada Familia, and then have dinner at Espai Sucre.

Reviews.Title: “High on style - Low on Quality”
Reviews.Author: Adambe
Reviews.Content: IMy partner and I stayed at the Axel a couple of years ago. We chose a superior room and the size and design was very good, although the materials used seemed to be on the cheap side to me. What really got to me was the arrogance of the staff. We arrived mid afternoon, only to be told our room would not be ready for another 45 minutes, a good 90 mins after the check in time they state. This would have been ok if they had at least extended an apology. However, all the staff seemed to do was swish around looking stylish and treating the guests as an irritation. Another irritation was that the breakfast was way too expensive about 13€ a head I think, there is a small café round the corner where we had the same breakfast for about 8€ for the two of us. Overall, stylish looking with a great rooftop pool, (gets a bit sleazy at night, if you like that sort of thing) although overall finishing feels cheap and tired.

Reviews.Title: “A gay faulty towers at times!”
Reviews.Author: digbymax
Reviews.Content: We telephone to confirm our room and arrived to be told it would not be ready as one of the cleaners was ill. We were told to come back in an hour. I had an appointment and wanted to have a quick shower, yet an hour later it was not ready, another 5 minutes which turned into 30! We had the first floor rooms, but were unable to sleep as the reception acted as an echo chamber which seemed to amplify the music and entering of guests into the reception. Needless to say, we were both tired, but could not sleep in as breakfast and the builders had started. We asked to move rooms and they were not surprised *we had been told that the first floor was quiet*. They obliged and the remainder of the holiday there went well allowing for the normal gay surcharge on drinks. The steam room, sauna and Jacuzzi were good and the room was spotless and clean. The free water bottles were a nice touch. On balance a reasonable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - even for heteros!”
Reviews.Author: CTHeather
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Axel in November. We stayed in two other hotels in Barcelona, and this was by far our favorite. Staff was very helpful in pointing out attractions and also recommending great restaurants in the neighborhood. Gym is small, but has everything you'd need. Library has free Internet access. The restaurant in Hotel Axel was excellent. We dined there our last evening in Spain and were shocked at the culinary delights. Try it for more than breakfast. We did not feel out of place as heterosexuals in a "gay" hotel. Patrons were nice, staff was helpful, and the location is convenient. The rooftop bar and pool were off season when we were there, but I bet it's a fantastic time. Enjoy this modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation for 5 nights and checked out after just one night!”
Reviews.Author: TwoGirlsFromChicago
Reviews.Content: Not sure where to begin but its all pretty negative. Us: 2 lipstick girls from the states, well travelled, mostly 5 star but will consider upscale gay establishments such as we did with the Axel. Love our gay brothers and accustomed to and tolerant of certain boyish behaviors. Situation: We arrive at the Axel and are met with the most foul smell (think sewer) which seems to permeate the entire hotel. The lobby is faux stylish and dirty. Our only hope is for at least a decent room. No chance there. As we head to our room, stepping off the elevator, I feel as though we have entered a bath house. Men in the hall with small towels around their waists, see us and scurry to their rooms and doors shut. I begin to realize that I am in big trouble w/ my partner now! The room itself continues the feel of dirt and grime. The floor is dirty and the bath tub has the most disgusting mold. I cannot believe how this property has come to be ranked the top gay hotel in the world. Oh well, we decide to make the best of it and head off to check out the neighborhood. While it doesn't qualify as a gay ghetto, there are far better locations in Eixample including those with better lighting and much better dining. So after tuckering ourselves out away from the Axel, we decide to return to the hotel and head to the roof top. BIG MISTAKE. Apparently, the rooftop at night is j/o time for the boys of the Axel. Not only were we made to feel incredibly uncomfortable as we raced for the elevator to get away but one of the men was actually quite rude in the elevator. Needless to say, this was not the place for us (or any women in our opinion). The next morning we began our task of finding more appropriate accomodations, ending up at the Majestic Hotel (a five star hotel in the nicer part of Eixample). Our room at the Majestic was gorgeous with a terrace overlooking Passeig de Gràcia, and only 50 more Euro per night than the Axel. We had a blast at this hotel as the gang from America's Next Top Model were also staying there and those boys were much more well-mannered. Bottom Line (no pun intended, really): I've read the reviews from others who claim that this hotel is het-friendly and a place "you can bring Mom & Dad" but beware if Mom decides to take a hike up to the roof top after dark. And whether you're gay or straight, cleanliness is cleanliness and this place is a dirty dump. Unless of course you're there to cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive and dishonest.”
Reviews.Author: RandBrad
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about my stay here, and truthfully, there were things that we liked about this hotel. BUT BEWARE!!!! When using the online booking system, I did not notice that there was a tab for the number of people. NOWHERE in the pricing page does it indicate that the price is significantly different when two people are staying in the room (and it's not as though 2 people to a room is an unusual state of affairs.) I was staying with my partner, and upon check-in, the desk informed us that instead of 190 euros for the room we would be charged 240 euros. I found this to be an outrageous practice, but of course, who wants to arrive in a foreign city and start looking for a new hotel? What did we get for 240 euros? An adequate room with no view whatsoever (the "patio view" is another deception: the patio is a concrete pad at the bottom of the light court, and not a patio at all), and decent, but not overwhelming, amenities. In fairness, I will say that the rooftop pool and gym are very nice, albeit not as well kept as they could be. All in all, I would say that this is a 3 star hotel charging 5 star rates. It is a shame that gay travellers looking for a gay-oriented property can't find something of better value in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Partner and I loved it! It was our place!”
Reviews.Author: montroseboy
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Thursday and took the Aerobus from the the airport. Wasn't too bad, but we did have 4 bags, and the bus does get crowded. Cost around 3.60 euros for each person On the way back we took a taxi. It cost us about 22 Euros. The hotel was nice...we enjoyed...we have a city view, though it rained mostly when we were there. THe nice thing about the hotel was it was gay oriented. They did have internet in the room for a fee, but there are 2 computers on floor 1, that you can use, without a charge. I highly recommend this, as it is only a few blocks from the Metro Universtatd (spelling). the metro can get you to anywhere in the city and to the sites. We definately would stay there again if we visit Barcelona again. Have fun!
